English: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu Sư dang nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư jur tơ bơ̆n wă kơ bơ̆n hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ tam đei plĕnh teh, Sư đei boih. Sư oei hơdai păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă Sư kư̆m Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: He was in the beginning with God.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ Sư oei hơdai păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih

English: All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.
Bahnar: na Sư kư̆m gơh pơjing tôm tơdrong. Ưh kơ đei bu nai pơjing ôh, 'Bă Sư pơjao ăn kơ Sư pơjing tôm tơdrong.

English: In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ Sư gơh pơjing tôm tơdrong arih thoi noh, na Sư tơbăt ăn kơ kon bơngai tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi lĕ kơ hơdah măt 'năr pơchrang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh.

English: And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
Bahnar: Sư pơchrang kơ lu bơngai mă oei lăm măng mu, lu bơngai oei lăm măng mu ưh kơ gơh pĭt tŭk tơdrong hơdah Sư.

English: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh minh 'nu bơngai, anăn sư Yôhan

English: This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all through him might believe.
Bahnar: wă kơ Yôhan pơtruh kơ đe tơdrong bơngai pơchrang hơdah ei. Yôhan pơtruh kơ đe tơdrong bơngai hơdah ei wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ bơngai mă pơchrang hơdah ei.

English: He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
Bahnar: Yôhan sư ưh kơ sĭ bơngai mă hơdah dang măt 'năr ei ôh, sư bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơtruh kơ đe tơdrong bơngai pơchrang hơdah ei.

English: That was the true Light which gives light to every man coming into the world.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă hơdah dang măt 'năr ei, Sư pơchrang hơdah kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơngai mă hơdah ei, hơtai ei sơ̆ Sư jur tơ ala teh âu tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong hơdah Sư.

English: He was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.
Bahnar: Teh bơ̆n âu đơ̆ng Sư pơjing mơ̆n, na kơplah Sư oei tơ ala teh âu sơ̆ lu bơngai ala teh âu ưh kơ băt kơ Sư.

English: He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.
Bahnar: Sư jur tơ teh đak Sư kơdih, mă-lei lu buăl Sư ưh kơ wă sơng iŏk Sư.

English: But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name
Bahnar: Na dôm lu bơngai mă sơng iŏk Sư tơpă păng dôm lu bơngai lui kơ Sư, Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai 'noh jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
Bahnar: Lu sư jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, kơlih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn, ưh kơ sĭ kiơ̆ kơ krung kơtum adrĕch adrung kon bơngai ôh.

English: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist dang nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư jur jing kon bơngai. Sư oei hơdai păng kon bơngai bơ̆n. Bơngai bơ̆n 'bôh Sư gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang; Sư 'noh boih Kon pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă; Sư 'mêm mơnat kơ bơ̆n, pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: John bore witness of Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’ ”
Bahnar: Hơtai ei sơ̆, Yôhan bơtho tơdrong Yêsu Krist 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl lơ. Sư pơma re bơtho đe thoi âu: “Gah 'Bok âu boih inh bơtho iĕm sơ̆, 'Bok mă inh khan gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng inh, Sư tih hloh kơ inh tơpă. Inh tơpŭ sơ̆, Sư đei hơdrol loi kơ inh boih.”

English: And of His fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.
Bahnar: Sư 'mêm mơnat đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n, pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng tơgŭm bơ̆n lăm tôm tơdrong tơpă.

English: For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Môis ată kơ bơ̆n tơdrong juăt đơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Yêsu Krist pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ đei bu gơh 'bôh Sư, lăp minh 'nu Kon pôm Sư đĕch 'bôh Sư păng oei hơdai Sư tơpă. Kon Sư tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong 'Bă Sư.

English: Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
Bahnar: Bơngai Juđê wơh lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi mă jang lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem tơ Pơlei Bethani pah to krong Jôrđăn wă jet lăng Yôhan. Chă Yôhan 'bôh boih na jet thoi âu: “Ih bu mă tơpă?”

English: He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
Bahnar: Yôhan roi tơpăt hloi ưh kơ ôn ôh. Sư khan: “Inh ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai ôh.”

English: And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng: “Lei hăm trŏ kơ ih Êli bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆?” Yôhan khan: “Ưh ôh.” “Lei hăm trŏ kơ ih bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mă nhôn chang gô đơ̆ng sơ̆?” Yôhan khan: “Ưh mơ̆n.”

English: Then they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng: “Lei ih bu? Ih khan kơ nhôn mă tơpăt wă kơ nhôn gơh roi kơ lu bơngai mă wơh nhôn năm jet ih. Na ih khan mă tơpăt, ih bu mă tơpă?”

English: He said: “I am ‘The voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Make straight the way of the LORD,” ’ as the prophet Isaiah said.”
Bahnar: Yôhan khan kơ lu sư: “Inh bơngai mă bơtho tơ char glă athei hơmet trong Kră Yang mă tơpăt dang khan tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, yua kơ Sư wă truh tơ bơ̆n boih kư̆m thoi Êsai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆.”

English: Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă năm jet Yôhan noh đơ̆ng bơngai Pharisi wơh lu sư.

English: And they asked him, saying, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng Yôhan thoi âu: “Ih ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Krist, ưh kơ sĭ Êli păng ih kư̆m khan ưh kơ sĭ 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei noh, lei ih bu? Liơ ih gơh pơm kơ đe 'batem?”

English: John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know.
Bahnar: Yôhan khan: “Inh pơm kơ đe 'batem păng đak đĕch. Na lăm bơ̆n dang ei đei minh 'nu bơngai, Sư 'Bok tih tơpă, sơmă iĕm ưh kơ kơnăl kơ Sư.

English: It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.”
Bahnar: Sư boih 'Bok mă truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh, Sư 'Bok tih hloh kơ inh tơpă. Mă khan athei inh yaih ăn tơlei chơkhŏ Sư, inh kư̆m ưh kơ hơnhŏ 'mơ̆i, inh ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng Sư ôh.”

English: These things were done in Bethabara beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ei jet Yôhan gah tơdrong âu tơ Pơlei Bethani, pah to krong Jôrđăn mă đêl anih Yôhan pơm kơ đe 'batem.

English: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, “Behold! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơning dơ̆ng, Yôhan 'bôh Yêsu thar năm tơ sư, na Yôhan khan kơ đe: “Iĕm lăng bĕ, 'Bok to 'noh boih Kon Triu 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok 'noh boih pơklaih yoch bơngai jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.

English: This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’
Bahnar: 'Bok 'noh boih inh krô nŏng roi kơ iĕm: ‘'Bok mă truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh Sư tih hloh kơ inh tơpă; inh tơpŭ sơ̆, Sư đei hơdrol loi kơ inh boih.’

English: I did not know Him; but that He should be revealed to Israel, therefore I came baptizing with water.”
Bahnar: Sơ̆ inh ưh kơ kơnăl kơ Sư, sơmă truh inh wă pơm kơ đe 'batem, na inh wă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael băt kơ Sư, na inh pơm kơ lu sư 'batem păng đak.”

English: And John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and He remained upon Him.
Bahnar: Yôhan roi kơ đe thoi âu: “Inh 'bôh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur đơ̆ng plĕnh thoi sem kơtơp jruh kơpal Sư.

English: I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘Upon whom you see the Spirit descending, and remaining on Him, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ 'noh ki inh kư̆m tam mă băt kơ Sư mơ̆n, sơmă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh inh pơm kơ đe 'batem păng đak păng Sư đei khan kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Ih gô 'bôh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei kơpal minh 'nu bơngai, bơngai 'noh boih pơm kơ đe 'batem phara yua kơ Sư ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei hơdai păng kon bơngai.’

English: And I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh tơpă Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei kơpal minh 'nu bơngai, na inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, bơngai 'noh boih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: Again, the next day, John stood with two of his disciples.
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơning Yôhan dơ̆ng hơdai păng 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng sư.

English: And looking at Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”
Bahnar: Na lu sư 'bôh Yêsu yak brih lu sư. Na Yôhan khan: “Sư 'noh boih Kon Triu 'Bok Kei-Dei”

English: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bơngai mă pơhrăm păng Yôhan kơtơ̆ng sư khan thoi noh, bre sư năm kiơ̆ Yêsu hloi.

English: Then Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, “What do you seek?” They said to Him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, when translated, Teacher), “where are You staying?”
Bahnar: Yêsu hue tơ rŏng 'bôh bre ei kiơ̆ Sư, na Sư jet: “Biĕm chă kiơ?” Bre sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih oei tơ yơ?”

English: He said to them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (now it was about the tenth hour).
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ bre sư: “Lei bĕ biĕm kiơ̆ năm lăng anih Inh.” Na bre sư kiơ̆ năm lăng 'bôh tơpă anih hnam Sư. Kơplah ei dang puăn jơ kơsơ̆. Bre sư oei hơdai Sư lăm năr 'noh đĕch.

English: One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm mă kơtơ̆ng Yôhan khan thoi noh na kiơ̆ lăng hloi anih Yêsu ei, minh 'nu anăn sư Andrê. Sư oh Simôn.

English: He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated, the Christ).
Bahnar: Na Andrê năm chă 'nhŏng sư Simôn, roi kơ 'nhŏng sư khan: “Nhôn 'bôh boih 'Bok Mêsi.” 'Bok Mêsi wă khan 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai.

English: And he brought him to Jesus. Now when Jesus looked at him, He said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is translated, A Stone).
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Andrê anhăk 'nhŏng sư Simôn năm tơ Yêsu. Yêsu lăng sư păng khan: “Ih Simôn kon Yôhan, na dang ei Inh wă anăn ih Sêphaih.” Sêphaih noh nơ̆r Juđê, kiơ̆ nơ̆r Grĕk sư khan Pêtrôs. (Nơ̆r Pêtrôs noh wă khan tơmo.)

English: The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơning dơ̆ng Yêsu wă năm tơ dêh Galilê, na Sư chă Philip pơtơm năm kiơ̆ Sư khan: “Năm kiơ̆ Inh bĕ.”

English: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
Bahnar: Philip sư bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei 'Betsaiđa. Andrê hăm Pêtrôs kư̆m pơlei 'noh mơ̆n.

English: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, and also the prophets, wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
Bahnar: Philip năm roi kơ Nathanel khan: “Nhôn 'bôh boih Yêsu kon 'bok Yôsep Pơlei Nasaret, bơngai ei mă Môis chih roi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt bơ̆n păng lu 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m chih roi lê̆ hơdrol kơ bơ̆n đơ̆ng sơ̆.”

English: And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
Bahnar: Na Nathanel khan: “Lơliơ? Tam mă biơh đei bơngai bu pơm tih đơ̆ng lăm Pơlei Nasaret ôh.” Na Philip khan dơ̆ng kơ sư: “Na ih jah năm lăng Sư deh wă kơ ih băt kơ Sư thoi yơ.”

English: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu 'bôh Nathanel năm tơ Sư, na Sư khan: “Ih boih bơngai Isơrael tơpă. Ih đei đon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh kơ đei layơ hơlĕnh kơ đe.”

English: Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
Bahnar: Nathanel khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, lơliơ Ih băt kơ inh bơngai thoi ei lĕ?” Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh băt tơpă păng Inh kư̆m 'bôh ih ngôi 'bơ̆t tơm 'long hơra hơdrol kơ Philip tam năm roi kơ ih hei.”

English: Nathanael answered and said to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
Bahnar: Nathanel khan kơ Sư dơ̆ng: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, lei Ih boih Kon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih Pơtao bơngai Isơrael tơpă.”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Đon ih lui thoi noh kơlih kơ Inh khan kơ ih Inh 'bôh ih ngôi 'bơ̆t tơm 'long hơra. Mă-lei ning-mônh ih gô 'bôh lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tih hloh loi kơ 'noh dơ̆ng.”

English: And He said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, ning-mônh iĕm gô 'bôh plĕnh tơpơih na iĕm 'bôh lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur tơ Inh Kon Bơngai păng iĕm kư̆m 'bôh lu sư tŏk tơ plĕnh.”

English: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
Bahnar: Truh 'bar năr đơ̆ng rŏng đe pơkong tơ Pơlei Kanna, dêh Galilê. Mĕ Yêsu đei năm hơpong tơ noh.

English: Now both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m wơ̆n Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm mơ̆n.

English: And when they ran out of wine, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei et sa, sik lu sư ưh kơ mah, na mĕ Yêsu khan kơ Yêsu: “Sik đe âu ưh kơ mah.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does your concern have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ duch, ih mah hăt kơ kiơ, yua kơ tam mă trŏ jơ Inh wă tơgŭm lu sư?”

English: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”
Bahnar: Mĕ Sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh boih, na sư năm khan kơ lu bơngai awih: “Iĕm jang kiơ̆ kơ Sư athei hŏ.”

English: Now there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of purification of the Jews, containing twenty or thirty gallons apiece.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam ei đei tơdrâu tŏ ge mong đak. Lu bơngai Juđê juăt iŏk đak đơ̆ng ge ei hơrao jơ̆ng ti kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt lu sư. Rim tŏ ge ei gơh mong đak dang pơđăm gŏ 'bei.

English: Jesus said to them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai awih lăm hnam ei khan: “Iĕm tuh đak 'bĕnh tôm kơ ge âu.” Na lu bơngai awih ei tuh đak 'bĕnh tôm kơ 'bơ̆r ge ei hloi.

English: And He said to them, “Draw some out now, and take it to the master of the feast.” And they took it.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu đe awih ei: “Iĕm tring đak âu năm ăn kơ bơngai kơdranh mă wei-lăng sa et.” Na đe năm ba đak ei truh tơ bơngai kơdranh mă wei-lăng ei boih.

English: When the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom.
Bahnar: Na đak ei jing hloi sik. Bơngai kơdranh ei et sik noh 'lơ̆ng tơpă mă-lei sư ưh kơ băt sik 'noh đơ̆ng yơ. Lu bơngai awih đĕch băt. Na bơngai kơdranh mă wei-lăng ei krao bơngai mă iŏk akăn păng khan

English: And he said to him, “Every man at the beginning sets out the good wine, and when the guests have well drunk, then the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”
Bahnar: “Mă rim đe et sa tih, ling-lang đe ăn kơ tơmoi sik 'băt ngăl hơdrol na sik sap đơ̆ng rŏng. Na âu ăn kơ đe et sik 'băt đơ̆ng rŏng.”

English: This beginning of signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơsêh mơyang âu boih Yêsu pơm tơ'bôh kơ đe mă hơdrol. Sư pơm tơ Pơlei Kanna, dêh Galilê. Thoi noh boih na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư lui kơ Sư đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: After this He went down to Capernaum, He, His mother, His brothers, and His disciples; and they did not stay there many days.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh mĕ Sư păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, yak hơdai Sư đơ̆ng noh năm tơ Pơlei Kapernum. Lu sư oei tơ Pơlei Kapernum noh ưh kơ đunh mơ̆n.

English: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei wă jê̆ truh năr đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih, na Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And He found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers doing business.
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh đe mơdro lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, mơ'nah tĕch rơmo, mơ'nah tĕch triu. Đei mơ'nah tĕch sem kơtơp, kư̆m đei mơ'nah oei tơplih băl jên ră.

English: When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu iŏk tơlei pơm sơnguĕt pơpuh tơlĕch đĭ-đăng bơngai mơdro păng lu rơmo, triu lu sư đơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm ei. Klaih kơ noh Sư săi tŭk jên lu đe ei oei tơplih ră păng tơlơ̆ tơpơ̆k lu gơ'bang sư.

English: And He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My Father’s house a house of merchandise!”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai mơdro sem kơtơp: “Anhăk ba đĭ sem kơtơp iĕm âu tơ nai. Iĕm 'nĕ pă pơm kơ hnam 'Bă Inh thoi lĕ kơ hnam mơdro mơchan.”

English: Then His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house has eaten Me up.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơtơ̆ng Sư pơma thoi noh lu sư 'blŏk kơ tơdrong đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Tơdrong hưch hanh kơ hnam Ih dang luăn sa inh.”

English: So the Jews answered and said to Him, “What sign do You show to us, since You do these things?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ Yêsu: “Ih pơm kơ nhôn mơsêh mơyang Ih bĕ, lei na nhôn lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư ăn kơ Ih pơpuh lu đe âu đơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu.”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan hloi kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Lei iĕm jah yuih hnam akŭm âu bĕ na Inh gô pơm ming kơtĕch pêng năr keh hloi.”

English: Then the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan: “Thoi yơ Ih kĕ? Đe jang pơm hnam âu sơ̆ puăn-jĭt tơdrâu sơnăm 'mơ̆i na gơh keh; na Ih khan kơtĕch pêng năr đĕch keh hloi.”

English: But He was speaking of the temple of His body.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu jô̆ tơdrong 'noh, Sư pơma gah akâu Sư kơdih lôch iung arih kơtĕch pêng năr đĕch, ưh kơ sĭ pơma gah hnam akŭm tơpă ôh.

English: Therefore, when He had risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na lăp Yêsu iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, na lu jơ̆ng 'bang Sư 'blŏk hơdơ̆r gah tơdrong Yêsu pơma pơjuang kơ lu bơngai Juđê noh. Lu sư kư̆m lui kơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei chih khan lê̆ hơdrol, mă Yêsu kư̆m pơma gah akâu Sư kơdih gô iung arih đơ̆ng lôch.

English: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name when they saw the signs which He did.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem lăm năr đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih, na Sư tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư. Na đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Sư.

English: But Jesus did not commit Himself to them, because He knew all men
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu băt kơ đe ưh kơ lui tơpă ôh

English: and had no need that anyone should testify of man, for He knew what was in man.
Bahnar: yua kơ Sư băt rim 'nu lăm jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai lăm to sư thoi yơ. Na Sư huay kơ kăl kơ đe roi ăn kơ Sư bơngai âu thoi yơ, bơngai 'noh thoi yơ ôh.

English: There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Nikôđem, sư kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi. Sư pơm kră sek tơlang khŭl bơngai Juđê.

English: This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
Bahnar: Sư năm ngôi tơ Yêsu kơmăng, na sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn băt kơ Ih 'Bok Thây đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh. Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ tơgŭm Ih, lei Ih ưh kơ gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi Ih pơm ahrei ôh.”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh wă khan kơ ih tơpă, bơngai bu ưh kơ tơpŭ ming 'nao, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ layơ wă đei 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm Pơtao pơgơ̆r sư, mă dang ei mă tơ dêh char Sư ning-mônh.”

English: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
Bahnar: Nikôđem khan kơ Sư: “Thoi yơ bơngai kră boih gơh tơpŭ ming 'nao? Sư gơh mơ̆t lăm klak mĕ sư na tơpŭ ming dơ̆ng hă?”

English: Jesus answered, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh khan kơ ih boih, bơngai bu ưh kơ tơpŭ ming 'nao, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ layơ wă đei 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm Pơtao pơgơ̆r sư, mă dang ei mă tơ dêh char Sư ning-mônh. Tơdrong tơpŭ ming 'nao 'noh đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Sư pơm kơ bơ̆n jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng, na bơ̆n iŏk 'batem păng đak, thoi noh boih tơdrong tơpŭ ming 'nao.

English: That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
Bahnar: Mĕ bơ̆n tơpŭ kơ bơ̆n sơ̆, noh păng akâu sư kơdih. Mă-lei bơ̆n tơpŭ ming 'nao dơ̆ng, 'noh đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơm kơ bơ̆n.

English: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
Bahnar: Na dang ei đon ih 'nĕ tơchĕng hlĭch gah tơdrong Inh athei iĕm tơpŭ ming 'nao 'noh.

English: The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but cannot tell where it comes from and where it goes. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
Bahnar: Kial sư thu gô mơ̆ng kơ sư wă, bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng jơwa sư, mă-lei bơ̆n ưh kơ băt sư thu đơ̆ng yơ wă năm tơ yơ. Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư kư̆m pơm kơ bơ̆n thoi noh mơ̆n; bơ̆n ưh kơ băt Sư pơm thoi yơ mă-lei bơ̆n băt kơ Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n tơpŭ ming 'nao tơpă.”

English: Nicodemus answered and said to Him, “How can these things be?”
Bahnar: Nikôđem khan: “Thoi yơ kon bơngai gơh jing thoi noh lĕ?”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and do not know these things?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ sư: “Liơ lu bơngai Juđê pôk ih thây bơtho lu sư boih mă ih ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong noh?

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, We speak what We know and testify what We have seen, and you do not receive Our witness.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ ih tơpăt: Nhôn bơtho iĕm tơdrong nhôn; nhôn 'bôh tơpă boih na nhôn gơh roi ăn kơ iĕm; mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui dôm tơdrong nhôn bơtho.

English: If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh bơtho iĕm dang ei gah tơdrong ala teh âu, mă iĕm ưh kơ lui. Tơdah Inh wă bơtho gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh ti, iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ lui rai loi.

English: No one has ascended to heaven but He who came down from heaven, that is, the Son of Man who is in heaven.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai ala teh âu, ưh tam đei bu tŏk tơ plĕnh ti boih ôh. Inh Kon Bơngai, pôm Inh đĕch đơ̆ng plĕnh ti jur tơ ala teh âu.

English: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up
Bahnar: “Na tơ char glă sơ̆ ki sơ̆ kach Môis pơm minh dăng 'bih păng mam kong, sư tơ'băk 'bih ei kơpal 'long wă kơ đe lăng 'bih ei na huay kơ lôch đơ̆ng 'bih choh. Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n đe gô atŏk Inh Kon Bơngai tơ 'long pơglang tơpă ning-mônh.

English: that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.
Bahnar: Thoi noh mơ̆n na bơngai bu lui kơ Sư, bơngai 'noh sư gô iung arih oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang.

English: For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat tơpă rim 'nu bơngai jơ̆p ala teh âu na Sư mah ăn Kon pôm Sư lôch tang kon bơngai. Bơngai bu lui kơ Kon Sư huay kơ lôch hiong ôh. Bơngai 'noh sư gô oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang.

English: For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Kon Sư jur tơ ala teh âu wă pơklaih kon bơngai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, ưh kơ sĭ wă phak kon bơngai ôh.

English: “He who believes in Him is not condemned; but he who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu lui kơ Kon Sư huay kơ pŭ tơdrong phak ôh. Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu lui kơ Kon Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang tơdrong sư boih păng wă phak sư tơpă yua kơ sư ưh kơ wă lui kơ Kon pôm Sư.

English: And this is the condemnation, that the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang kon bơngai, Sư pơlong lăng thoi âu: Sư wơh Kon Sư jur pơchrang ăn tơdrong hơdah Sư tơ ala teh âu. Mă-lei kon bơngai ưh kơ wă kơ tơdrong hơdah Sư ôh. Kon bơngai wă oei lăm măng mu đĕch yua kơ lu sư wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ ling-lang.

English: For everyone practicing evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ wă kơ tơdrong hơdah păng sư ưh kơ wă năm jê̆ tơdrong hơdah, yua kơ sư hli, dah năm jê̆ tơdrong hơdah sư tơchĕng 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bôh hloi tơdrong kơnê̆ sư.

English: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his deeds may be clearly seen, that they have been done in God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bu pơm tơpăt, sư ưh kơ hli năm jê̆ tơdrong hơdah păng wă kơ đe 'bôh dôm tơdrong tơpăt sư pơm đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư.”

English: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He remained with them and baptized.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ dêh Juđê. Yêsu oei hơdai hăm lu sư tơ ei păng Sư pơm kơ đe 'batem.

English: Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.
Bahnar: Yôhan sư pơm kơ đe 'batem tơ Pơlei Anon jê̆ Pơlei Salim kơlih kơ tơ ei đei đak dơnâu. Na đe năm tơ sư tơ ei wă iŏk 'batem.

English: For John had not yet been thrown into prison.
Bahnar: Hơtai 'noh đe tam mă tah Yôhan lăm hnam phak ôh.

English: Then there arose a dispute between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about purification.
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđê năm tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan pơjah pơjăng păng sư gah tơdrong pơm kơ đe 'batem.

English: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified—behold, He is baptizing, and all are coming to Him!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan năm tơ Yôhan păng khan: “Ơ 'bok thây, 'Bok mă oei hơdai hăm ih pah to krong Jôrđăn, bơngai mă ih khan Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, dang ei Sư kư̆m pơm kơ đe 'batem. Đĭ-đăng bơngai năm kơdih kơdih tơ Sư.”

English: John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
Bahnar: Yôhan khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơm tơdrong kiơ dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ sư.

English: You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before Him.’
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong inh khan kơ iĕm ki, inh ưh kơ sĭ kơ 'Bok Krist ôh. Inh bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn truh hơdrol wă hơmet trong kơ 'Bok Krist.

English: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.
Bahnar: Pơtih gia, lăp đe pơkong, drŏ-nglo mă iŏk akăn, sư boih hiôk chơt tơpă. Păng buăl mă pơm kơdranh drŏ-nglo 'noh sư kư̆m dơ̆ng jê̆ 'bơ̆t sư mơ̆n păng mơ̆ng sư pơma, buăl sư kư̆m chơt hiôk mơ̆n. Na inh kư̆m dang kơdranh bơngai mă iŏk akăn 'noh mơ̆n. Inh kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma, inh hiôk chơt tơpă.

English: He must increase, but I must decrease.
Bahnar: Sư rai đunh rai pơm tih; gah inh rai đunh rai sruh rai iĕ.

English: He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
Bahnar: “Bơngai mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh ti, bơngai 'noh tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai. Bơngai bu đơ̆ng ala teh âu, sư 'noh bơngai mơnglang đĕch păng sư băt pơma gah tơdrong ala teh âu đĕch. Bơngai mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh ti 'noh tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai tơpă.

English: And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.
Bahnar: Sư roi kơ đe dôm tơdrong Sư 'bôh păng Sư kơtơ̆ng. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bơngai bu wă lui kơ nơ̆r Sư bơtho.

English: He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lui kơ nơ̆r Sư bơtho, bơngai 'noh sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma sĭt tơpă

English: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God does not give the Spirit by measure.
Bahnar: yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Kon Sư Yêsu, na Yêsu jur bơtho nơ̆r 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei hơdai hăm Sư ling-lang, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm Sư lăm tôm tơdrong tơpă ưh kơ đei kơ'bah kiơ.

English: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into His hand.
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ Kon Sư tơpă, na pơchĕp ăn kơ Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.

English: He who believes in the Son has everlasting life; and he who does not believe the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lui kơ Kon Sư, bơngai 'noh sư gô oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang. Bơngai bu ưh kơ lui yom kơ Kon Sư, bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ đei arih ling-lang ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei hil kơ sư tơpă păng sĭt gô phak sư ning-mônh.”

English: Therefore, when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu băt kơ lu bơngai Pharisi kơtơ̆ng ang đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ Sư păng iŏk 'batem hloh loi kơ bơngai kiơ̆ Yôhan.

English: (though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples)
Bahnar: Mă tơpă ưh kơ sĭ Yêsu ôh pơm kơ đe 'batem. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư đĕch pơm kơ đe 'batem.

English: He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu bơngai Pharisi kơtơ̆ng ang thoi noh boih na Sư đơ̆ng dêh Juđê brŏk tơ dêh Galilê.

English: But He needed to go through Samaria.
Bahnar: Sư năm drong hloi dêh Samari.

English: So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm truh tơ Pơlei Sikar lăm dêh Samari. Pơlei ei jê̆ mir Jakôp mă ăn kơ kon sư Yôsep sơ̆.

English: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
Bahnar: Tơ noh đei sơlŭng đak Jakôp sơ̆. Kơplah ei 'năr tŏk-bŏk dơ̆ng, Yêsu yak gleh tơpă yua kơ yak trong ataih. Na Sư pơdơh ngôi 'bơ̆t đak sơlŭng ei.

English: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh blư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn, sư khŭl bơngai Samari năm sŏ đak. Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Asong Inh nhă đak ih bĕ.”

English: For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơplah noh ưh pă tơ noh boih, lu sư đĭ năm răt tơmam sa tơ pơlei đe.

English: Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.
Bahnar: Na duch Samari ei khan kơ Sư: “Liơ Ih bơngai Juđê apinh inh drŏ-kăn Samari athei inh asong Ih đak nhă? Sư pơma thoi noh yua kơ lu bơngai Juđê kơ̆m kơ pơma dơnuh hăm bơngai Samari.”

English: Jesus answered and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dah ih băt kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ ih păng dah ih băt kơ Inh bơngai thoi yơ mă apinh đak ih nhă na dah ih apinh Inh, Inh ăn hloi kơ ih đak mă ih gơh arih ling-lang.”

English: The woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?
Bahnar: Duch ei khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih ưh kơ đei gơhnŏk wă sŏ đak, na thoi yơ Ih gơh sŏ yua kơ sơlŭng đak âu jrŭ? Na Ih khan wă sŏ đak ăn kơ inh arih, Ih wă sŏ đơ̆ng yơ?

English: Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his sons and his livestock?”
Bahnar: Bĭ Ih hăm tih hloh kơ 'bok bơ̆n Jakôp mă ăn kơ nhôn đak sơlŭng âu? Sư, lu kon sư păng sem dơrong sư nhă hơdai minh pôm sơlŭng đak âu sơ̆.”

English: Jesus answered and said to her, “Whoever drinks of this water will thirst again
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Bơngai bu nhă đak âu, kơnh sư rơhing 'maih nhă dơ̆ng.

English: but whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him will never thirst. But the water that I shall give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up into everlasting life.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu nhă đak đơ̆ng Inh ăn, kơnh sư huay pă rơhing boih. Đak mă Inh ăn kơ sư thoi lĕ đak mơlĕch, sư ro jur suŏn lăm to bơngai mă nhă 'noh, pơm kơ bơngai noh gơh arih ling-lang.”

English: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na duch ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, asong inh nhă đak ei bĕ, wă kơ inh huay pă rơhing 'maih nhă dơ̆ng păng wă kơ inh huay pă năm sŏ đak âu.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ duch ei: “Ih năm krao klo ih năm kiơ̆ ih tơ âu dơ̆ng bĕ.”

English: The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have well said, ‘I have no husband,’
Bahnar: Duch ei khan: “Inh ưh kơ đei klo.” Yêsu khan: “Trŏ boih ih khan ưh kơ đei klo.

English: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; in that you spoke truly.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ ih đei pơđăm 'nu klo boih; bĭ bơngai mă oei kơ ih dang ei noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ klo ih ôh, yua kơ biĕm tam mă pơkong. Trŏ boih ih khan ưh kơ đei klo.”

English: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
Bahnar: Duch ei khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, inh băt boih Ih, Ih bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship.”
Bahnar: Lu yă 'bok nhôn sơ̆ khan trŏ kơ kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kông âu. Mă gah iĕm khan athei đe năm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem đĕch trŏ.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ duch, Inh wă khan kơ ih tơpă, ning-mônh đe huay pă năm kơkuh kơ 'Bă bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kông âu dah tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng boih.

English: You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai Samari, iĕm khan kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ. Pôm lu nhôn bơngai Juđê đĕch hlôh tơpă gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Thoi noh yơh na lu bơngai Juđê tơpă đei bơngai wă pơklaih kon bơngai.

English: But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh, kư̆m thoi dang ei mơ̆n, lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ 'Bă bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei mă trŏ ưh kơ sĭ sư kơkuh păng jơ̆ng dah păng ti sư đĕch ôh. Sư kơkuh lăm jơhngơ̆m đon sư. Sư kơkuh mă tơpă na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ Sư thoi noh.

English: God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư Yang tơpă na lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ Sư athei kơkuh mă tơpă hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m đon sư.”

English: The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”
Bahnar: Duch ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Inh băt kơ 'Bok Mêsi mă đe anăn 'Bok Krist Sư gô truh wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai, mưh Sư truh boih Sư roi ăn kơ nhôn tôm tơdrong.”

English: Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Bok 'noh jơ̆ Inh âu boih, Sư mă oei pơma păng ih dang ei âu. Inh boih 'Bok Krist.”

English: And at this point His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with a woman; yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh blư 'bôh hloi lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư wih. Lu sư 'bôh Yêsu pơma dơnuh păng duch noh lu sư pơwao hlĭch. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ jet Yêsu khan: “Ih pơma kiơ?” Dah: “Kơlih kơ kiơ Ih pơma dơnuh păng duch âu?” Lu sư ưh kơ đei jet pơma thoi noh ôh.

English: The woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men
Bahnar: Na duch ei 'măn lê̆ ge đak sư 'bơ̆t ei, na kơdâu wih tơ pơlei roi kơ đe păng pơtơm đe khan

English: “Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?”
Bahnar: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm lăng bĕ. Bơngai ei hlĭch dêh roi 'blep dôm tơdrong inh pơm tơpă. Na iĕm tơchĕng bơngai 'noh hăm trŏ kơ 'Bok Krist tơpă dah ưh?”

English: Then they went out of the city and came to Him.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla luh năm lăng Sư.

English: In the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei nơnăm rok trong tam mă truh tơ Yêsu, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, sŏng sa bĕ.”

English: But He said to them, “I have food to eat of which you do not know.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh đei tơmam sa boih, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ băt ôh.”

English: Therefore the disciples said to one another, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pơma dih băl: “Đe ăn kơ Sư tơmam sa tơpă dah kiơ?”

English: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Tơmam sa Inh jơ̆ Inh athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Inh jang mă keh tơdrong Sư. 'Noh boih tơmam sa Inh.

English: Do you not say, ‘There are still four months and then comes the harvest’? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, for they are already white for harvest!
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ lu iĕm khan thoi âu: ‘Pă puăn khei truh bơyan kĕch 'ba?’ Mă-lei Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: ‘Iĕm iung tơmang lăng kon pơlei pơla to. Lu sư wă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, kư̆m dang lĕ mir 'ba đe mă đum boih. Na dang ei bơ̆n kơchăng wă kĕch iŏk đĕch.

English: And he who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit for eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
Bahnar: Na bơngai bu adrin bơtho đe lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah sư, kư̆m lei-lăi thoi tơ'ngla mir apah đe jang kĕch 'ba mir sư. Lu bơngai jang pơm mir, sư đei 'ba lơ tơpă; lu bơngai jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Sư krao lơ bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na lu bơngai lui kơ sư bơtho 'noh gô arih ling-lang. Bơngai mă bơtho đe hơdrol păng bơngai mă bơtho đe đơ̆ng rŏng na đe lui hloi kơ sư bơtho, bre noh, bre sư chơt hiôk lei-lăi đĕch.’

English: For in this the saying is true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’
Bahnar: 'Noh trŏ kơ nơ̆r đe khan hmă thoi âu: ‘Bơngai âu rei 'ba mă-lei truh bơyan kĕch, bơngai nai kĕch 'ba noh.’

English: I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have entered into their labors.”
Bahnar: Na Inh wơh iĕm năm kĕch 'ba mă đêl đe rei, wă kơ iĕm kĕch dŏng bơngai mă rei 'noh.”

English: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever did.”
Bahnar: Đei lơ tơpă kon pơlei Samari lui kơ Yêsu kơlih kơ duch pơlei noh roi kơ lu sư khan: “Bơngai ei roi 'blep tôm tơdrong đêl inh pơm.”

English: So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na lăp lu sư truh tơ Yêsu boih, lu sư apinh Yêsu oei păng lu sư. Na Yêsu oei păng lu sư 'bar năr.

English: And many more believed because of His own word.
Bahnar: Păng đei lơ bơngai nai dơ̆ng lui kơ Yêsu. Lu bơngai âu lui đơ̆ng Yêsu bơtho kơdih.

English: Then they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we ourselves have heard Him and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui đơ̆ng rŏng khan kơ duch ei thoi âu: “Nhôn lui kơ Sư dang ei ưh kơ sĭ nhôn băt đơ̆ng ih ôh. Nhôn lui kơ Sư dang ei yua kơ nhôn kơtơ̆ng Sư bơtho na nhôn băt hloi kơ Sư 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih kon bơngai tơpă.”

English: Now after the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bar năr ei Yêsu wih hloi tơ dêh Galilê.

English: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi Inh âu, lu bơngai pôm tơring păng sư ưh kơ wă chu yom kơ sư, lu bơngai tơring nai dơ̆ng chu yom kơ sư. Na Inh kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.”

English: So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had gone to the feast.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ dêh Galilê na lu bơngai Galilê sơng iŏk Sư. Lu sư băt kơ Yêsu kơlih kơ đêl lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem lăm năr đe pơm giĕng, na lu sư 'bôh tôm tơdrong Yêsu pơm tơ'bôh ăn mơsêh mơyang Sư tơ pơlei ei.

English: So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Kanna lăm dêh Galilê dơ̆ng, pơlei mă đêl Yêsu tơlĕch mơsêh mơyang Sư pơm kơ đak 'blăng jing đak sik hơmu. Na tơ Pơlei Kapernum đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm 'bok kuan, sư bơ̆jang iĕ 'biơ̆ kơ 'bok pơtao. Na kơplah noh kon sư jĭ dêh.

English: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'bok kuan ei băt kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng dêh Juđê truh tơ dêh Galilê boih, na 'bok kuan ei năm hloi truh tơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Kanna. Sư apinh Yêsu jur pơklaih kon sư jĭ dêh tơ Pơlei Kapernum.

English: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will by no means believe.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dah Inh ưh kơ pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh ôh.”

English: The nobleman said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies!”
Bahnar: Na 'bok ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, apinh Ih jah năm tơ hnam inh. Inh hli kơ kon inh lôch hơdrol.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your son lives.” So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ 'bok ei: “Brŏk kơ ih bĕ, kon ih huay kơ lôch ôh. Na 'bok ei lui kơ nơ̆r Yêsu pơma. Na 'bok kuan ei brŏk hloi.”

English: And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, “Your son lives!”
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei yak rok trong na sư tơ'bơ̆p lu đĭch sư giong khan kơ sư. Lu sư khan: “Kon ih klaih boih.”

English: Then he inquired of them the hour when he got better. And they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok kuan ei jet lu đĭch sư khan: “Sư 'nao klaih layơ?” Lu sư khan: “Klaih đơ̆ng mônh jơ 'năr lăp glơh brei, sư klaih hloi kơ bơlŏ.”

English: So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” And he himself believed, and his whole household.
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan ei băt hloi kơplah mônh jơ 'năr glơh brei 'blep hloi kơ jơ Yêsu khan kơ sư, khan kon sư huay kơ lôch. Thoi noh na 'bok kuan ei lui hloi kơ Yêsu păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư kư̆m lui mơ̆n.

English: This again is the second sign Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơsêh mơyang âu Yêsu tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t Sư năm đơ̆ng dêh Juđê 'nao truh tơ dêh Galilê kư̆m thoi tơdrong mơsêh Sư pơm sik hơdrol ki, Sư kư̆m tơ'bôh kơ đe 'bơ̆t Sư năm đơ̆ng dêh Juđê 'nao truh tơ dêh Galilê mơ̆n.

English: After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu năm hơpong tơ lu bơngai Juđê pơm la-giĕng sŏng sa tih tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem đei minh tŭm dơnâu đak 'bơ̆t jê̆ 'măng tơm pơlei mă đe anăn 'Măng Triu. Đak dơnâu ei lăm nơ̆r Juđê anăn khan dơnâu Betsatha. Tơ noh đei pơđăm tŏ prơng hnam.

English: In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
Bahnar: Tơ ala prơng noh đei lơ bơngai 'bĭch păn kơ jĭ jăn. Lu mơ'nah măt tol, mơ'nah ti kue, mơ'nah jơ̆ng jo go kơdŭ. Lu bơngai jĭ ei chang gô đak dơnâu tơglăk

English: For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had.
Bahnar: yua kơ phŏ phŏ đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur tơ đak dơnâu ei, wă pơm kơ đak dơnâu ei tơglăk. Na bơngai bu mă hơbĕch dah kơtah lăm dơnâu ei hơdrol kơ đe, sư noh klaih hloi kơ jĭ sư.

English: Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty-eight years.
Bahnar: Lăm ei đei minh 'nu bơngai jĭ đunh đei pêng-jĭt tơhngam sơnăm boih.

English: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in that condition a long time, He said to him, “Do you want to be made well?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu 'bôh sư 'bĭch lăm ei. Păng Yêsu băt kơ bơngai ei jĭ đunh tơpă na Yêsu jet sư: “Ih hăm wă klaih kơ jĭ?”

English: The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
Bahnar: Bơngai jĭ ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, 'bơ̆t đak tơglăk inh ưh kơ đei bôl hiot tơdŏng inh jur lăm đak dơnâu. Na ling-lang jei đe ngăl jur hơdrol kơ inh.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Rise, take up your bed and walk.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan: “Ih iung bĕ, lôm sơkok ih chĕp brŏk kơ ih bĕ.”

English: And immediately the man was made well, took up his bed, and walked. And that day was the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Bơngai jĭ ei klaih hloi, lôm sơkok sư iung nơnăm hloi wă brŏk. Năr ei năr pơdơh Sa'bat.

English: The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ bơngai 'nao klaih ei khan: “Năr âu năr giĕng lah. Ih 'nĕ tung anhăk sơkok ih.”

English: He answered them, “He who made me well said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nao klaih kơ jĭ ei khan kơ lu sư: “Kơlih kơ 'Bok mă pơklaih inh hei Sư athei inh khan: Lôm sơkok ih chĕp brŏk kơ ih bĕ.”

English: Then they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê jet sư: “'Bok bu athei ih lôm sơkok ih brŏk ei?”

English: But the one who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a multitude being in that place.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nao klaih kơ jĭ ei, sư ưh kơ băt anăn 'Bok mă pơklaih jĭ sư hei, kư̆m ưh pă 'bôh Sư tăm yua kơ đei bơngai tơpôl 'bơ̆t ei na Yêsu năm tơ nai boih.

English: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu 'bôh bơngai Sư pơklaih noh tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm na Yêsu khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Dang ei ih klaih boih, ih 'nĕ pă pơm yoch dơ̆ng, kơnh ih pŭ tơdrong trăp hloh kơ noh.”

English: The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nao klaih kơ jĭ ei năm khan kơ đe Juđê Yêsu pơklaih sư.

English: For this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ tơdrong noh na lu bơngai Juđê wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ Yêsu, kơlih kơ Sư pơklaih đe jĭ lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat.

English: But Jesus answered them, “My Father has been working until now, and I have been working.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê ei thoi âu: “'Bă Inh oei jang ling-lang truh dang ei ưh kơ đei pơdơh na Inh athei jang lei-lăi thoi Sư mơ̆n.”

English: Therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ tơdrong noh lu bơngai Juđê chă tơdrong wă kơ gơh rôp pơlôch Sư, yua kơ lu sư khan Yêsu tŭk tơdrong kơ̆m lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat; păng khan 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Sư, dang wă khan Sư tih atŏ hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then Jesus answered and said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do; for whatever He does, the Son also does in like manner.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê ei: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, Inh Kon Sư ưh kơ gơh jang kiơ̆ kơ Inh ôh. Inh athei jang kiơ̆ kơ Sư đĕch. 'Bă Sư jang thoi yơ Kon Sư jang thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself does; and He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel.
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư 'mêm kơ Kon Sư na tơ'bôh kơ Kon Sư tôm tơdrong 'Bă Sư jang. 'Bă Sư gô ăn kơ Kon Sư jang wă pơm gah tơdrong mơsêh mơyang hloh kơ tơdrong pơklaih bơngai jĭ noh hei, wă kơ iĕm lăng hlĭch kơ đon.

English: For as the Father raises the dead and gives life to them, even so the Son gives life to whom He will.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'Bă Inh gơh tơiung arih kon bơngai đơ̆ng lôch na Inh Kon Sư kư̆m thoi Sư mơ̆n, Inh gơh ăn tơdrong arih kơ kon bơngai gô mơ̆ng kơ Inh wă.

English: For the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư ưh kơ sek tơlang kon bơngai ôh. Sư ăn Kon Sư đĕch sek tơlang

English: that all should honor the Son just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
Bahnar: wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui yom kơ Kon Sư kư̆m thoi lu sư lui yom kơ 'Bă Sư. Bơngai bu ưh kơ lui yom kơ Kon Sư, bơngai 'noh kư̆m dang sư ưh kơ lui yom kơ 'Bă Sư, yua kơ Kon Sư đơ̆ng 'Bă Sư wơh.

English: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who hears My word and believes in Him who sent Me has everlasting life, and shall not come into judgment, but has passed from death into life.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu mơ̆ng Inh bơtho păng lui hloi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă wơh Inh, bơngai 'noh ning-mônh sư gô oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang păng Inh huay pă sek tơlang tơdrong sư boih. Sơ̆ sư kiơ̆ tơdrong lôch mă-lei dang ei sư kiơ̆ tơdrong arih.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, the hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God; and those who hear will live.
Bahnar: “Inh khan tơpăt kơ iĕm dơ̆ng, ning-mônh kư̆m thoi dang ei mơ̆n, lu bơngai lôch gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei krao sư, na bu mă mơ̆ng Sư krao, sư 'noh gô iung arih.

English: For as the Father has life in Himself, so He has granted the Son to have life in Himself
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi 'Bă Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong arih, na 'Bă Sư ăn kơ Kon Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong arih thoi Sư mơ̆n.

English: and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man.
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư ăn kơ Kon Sư sek tơlang kon bơngai, yua kơ Kon Sư jur jing bơngai.

English: Do not marvel at this; for the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice
Bahnar: Na Inh bơtho iĕm thoi noh, iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng hlĭch kơ đon. Ning-mônh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lôch oei lăm bơsat kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh krao sư

English: and come forth—those who have done good, to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of condemnation.
Bahnar: na lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng bơsat. Lu bơngai đei đon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt sư iung arih đơ̆ng noh sư gô arih ling-lang. Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, sư iung arih đơ̆ng noh Inh gô phak sư.

English: I can of Myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is righteous, because I do not seek My own will but the will of the Father who sent Me.
Bahnar: “Inh ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ thoi Inh wă ôh. Inh kơtơ̆ng 'Bă Inh pơma kơ Inh thoi yơ, Inh sek tơlang kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơma 'noh mơ̆n. Tơdrong Inh sek tơlang Inh sek tơlang mă tơpăt kiơ̆ thoi Sư, kơlih kơ Inh ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ thoi Inh kơdih, Inh athei pơm trŏ thoi 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh wă.

English: “If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true.
Bahnar: “Dah ưh kơ đei bu nai pơma bơ̆ng Inh, lei iĕm ưh kơ lui kư̆m bưh.

English: There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the witness which He witnesses of Me is true.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei minh 'nu nai pơma bơ̆ng Inh tơpă păng Inh kư̆m băt kơ Sư pơma tơpăt tơpă tơdrong Inh.

English: You have sent to John, and he has borne witness to the truth.
Bahnar: Iĕm lu bơngai Juđê puh lu jơ̆ng 'bang iĕm năm tơ Yôhan, na Yôhan sư pơma bơ̆ng tơdrong Inh tơpă.

English: Yet I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ kăl kon bơngai pơma bơ̆ng Inh ôh. Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Yôhan bơtho tơpăt, wă kơ iĕm lui kơ nơ̆r Sư bơtho, na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch iĕm.

English: He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing for a time to rejoice in his light.
Bahnar: Yôhan thoi ŭnh kơđeng nhơk hơdah. Iĕm mơ̆ng sư bơtho hiôk chơt tơpă ră, mă-lei lăp minh yuh đĕch.

English: But I have a greater witness than John’s; for the works which the Father has given Me to finish—the very works that I do—bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh đei minh 'nu tih hloh kơ Yôhan, Sư tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong Inh. Na dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng Sư ăn kơ Inh, na Inh bơ̆jang ahrei âu, dôm tơdrong noh wă kơ iĕm băt 'Bă Inh wơh Inh tơpă.

English: And the Father Himself, who sent Me, has testified of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form.
Bahnar: “'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh, Sư pơma bơ̆ng gah Inh. Lu iĕm ưh kơ layơ kơtơ̆ng Sư pơma păng iĕm ưh kơ lah 'bôh akâu Sư thoi yơ.

English: But you do not have His word abiding in you, because whom He sent, Him you do not believe.
Bahnar: Păng dôm tơdrong Sư pơma iĕm ưh kơ wă iŏk lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm tăm, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh mă sư wơh.

English: You search the Scriptures, for in them you think you have eternal life; and these are they which testify of Me.
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm đŏk lăng sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang, khan wă kơ đei tơdrong arih ling-lang. Sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei boih roi tơdrong Inh

English: But you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life.
Bahnar: mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă năm iŏk tơdrong arih đơ̆ng Inh ôh.

English: “I do not receive honor from men.
Bahnar: “Inh ưh kơ wă kon bơngai ang Inh hơgei ôh, Inh wă kơ 'Bă Inh đĕch lăp đon kơ Inh.

English: But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah iĕm, Inh băt lăm to iĕm ưh kơ wă 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: I have come in My Father’s name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, him you will receive.
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Inh jur tơ ala teh âu, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă sơng iŏk Inh ôh. Na bơngai nai năm kơdih sư, noh iĕm tơkan sơng iŏk sư hloi.

English: How can you believe, who receive honor from one another, and do not seek the honor that comes from the only God?
Bahnar: Na lơliơ iĕm gơh lui lĕ? Ling-lang iĕm wă kơ bôl iĕm lăp đon kơ iĕm. Minh 'nu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch tih hloh tơpă mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă Sư lăp đon kơ iĕm.

English: Do not think that I shall accuse you to the Father; there is one who accuses you—Moses, in whom you trust.
Bahnar: “Iĕm khan iĕm lui kơ Môis bơtho, na 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih iĕm. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ lui tơpă ôh yua kơ Môis roi tơdrong Inh tơpă, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh. Lăp 'Bă Inh sek tơlang ning-mônh Môis gô jô̆ iĕm bơngai kơchu na Inh huay kơ kăl jô̆ iĕm ôh.

English: For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me; for he wrote about Me.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm lui kơ nơ̆r Môis tơpă, noh iĕm kư̆m wă lui kơ Inh mơ̆n, kơlih kơ sư chih roi tơdrong Inh.

English: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ tơdrong sư chih roi, lơliơ iĕm gơh lui kơ nơ̆r Inh bơtho lĕ?”

English: After these things Jesus went over the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng ei, Yêsu tŏk pah to đak dơsĭ Galilê mă đe kư̆m anăn dơsĭ Tiberia.

English: Then a great multitude followed Him, because they saw His signs which He performed on those who were diseased.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai tơpôl lơ kiơ̆ Sư kơlih kơ lu sư 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Yêsu ming pơklaih lu bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: And Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
Bahnar: Yêsu tŏk tơ kông oei hơdai lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơ kông noh.

English: Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei wă jê̆ truh năr đe giĕng lu Juđê đe anăn Giĕng Năm Brih.

English: Then Jesus lifted up His eyes, and seeing a great multitude coming toward Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu ngơk lăng na Sư tơmang 'bôh bơngai tơpôl lơ luh năm tơ Sư. Na Yêsu khan kơ Philip: “Bơ̆n răt tơmam sa đơ̆ng yơ wă kơ mah 'me bơngai dôm noh?”

English: But this He said to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.
Bahnar: 'Noh Yêsu jet pơlong Philip đĕch, yua kơ Yêsu băt kơdih boih thoi yơ Sư gô pơm kơnh.

English: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may have a little.”
Bahnar: Philip khan: “Mă 'bar-hrĕng hlak jên hu kư̆m tam mah 'mơ̆i răt tơmam sa kơ lu sư, rim 'nu sa pơgia đĕch kư̆m ưh tam mah mơ̆n.”

English: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu nai, anăn sư Andrê, sư oh Pêtrôs, sư khan kơ Yêsu

English: “There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two small fish, but what are they among so many?”
Bahnar: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆p tơ âu mơ̆n, sư đei pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi hăm 'bar tŏ ka na liơ mah tôm kơ bơngai lơ?”

English: Then Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, athei lu bơngai tơpôl lơ ei tơoei kơpal 'nhĕt. Tơ ei 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p. Na đĭ-đăng bơngai tơpôl lơ ei tơoei. Lu bơngai ei jô̆ gah drŏ-nglo đĕch đei pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those sitting down; and likewise of the fish, as much as they wanted.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu iŏk pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi ei krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdrol, đơ̆ng noh asong kơ lu bơngai tơpôl oei lăm ei. Ka sư kư̆m asong lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n. Lu đe ei iŏk sa gô mơ̆ng kơ lu sư wă sa.

English: So when they were filled, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the fragments that remain, so that nothing is lost.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu bôl buăl sŏng sa phĭ boih Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, khan: “Năm bĕ iĕm, dônh tah 'bĕng mi păng ka mă rơkah boih hŏ, kuă kơ hŭt lê̆ 'mêm.”

English: Therefore they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
Bahnar: Na lu sư dônh tah 'bĕnh mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bai 'bĕng mi mă rơkah đơ̆ng pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi đơ̆ng lu sư sŏng sa.

English: Then those men, when they had seen the sign that Jesus did, said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dôm lu bơngai tơpôl ei 'bôh Yêsu pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư thoi noh na lu sư khan: “'Bok âu boih 'Bok mă bơ̆n chang gô đơ̆ng sơ̆ khan gô truh tơ ala teh âu wă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Therefore when Jesus perceived that they were about to come and take Him by force to make Him king, He departed again to the mountain by Himself alone.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu đe ei wă rôp pơgŏ Sư athei pơm Pơtao lu sư. Na Sư kơdâu ôn kơdrô̆ Sư tơ kông.

English: Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea
Bahnar: Truh 'năr kơsơ̆ boih, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jur tơ jih đak dơsĭ.

English: got into the boat, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was already dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk thŏng-nan wă năm tơ Pơlei Kapernum. Kơplah ei 'năr mơ̆t boih măng mu, mă-lei Yêsu tam mă jur tơ lu sư ôh na lu sư wơ̆r wă tŏk pah to.

English: Then the sea arose because a great wind was blowing.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei kial hơbŭt đak poh-yă tih tơpă.

English: So when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near the boat; and they were afraid.
Bahnar: Lu sư wơ̆r thŏng-nan ataih dang pơđăm tơdrâu kơsô̆ boih na lu sư 'bôh hloi Yêsu yak kơpal đak dơsĭ năm jê̆ thŏng-nan lu sư. Lu sư hli krê tơpă.

English: But He said to them, “It is I; do not be afraid.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan hloi kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă hli, Inh boih lah.”

English: Then they willingly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na lu sư hiôk chơt na atŏk Sư kơpal thŏng-nan. Na thŏng-nan lu sư truh hloi tơ jih dơsĭ trŏ hloi kơ anih lu sư wă năm hei.

English: On the following day, when the people who were standing on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except that one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but His disciples had gone away alone
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơning lu bơngai tơpôl oei pah to cheng đak dơsĭ, lu sư tam mă tŏk pah âu dơsĭ. Na năr brei lu sư 'bôh lăp minh pôm thŏng-nan đĕch tơ ei păng lu sư kư̆m băt kơ Yêsu ưh kơ tŏk thŏng-nan ei hơdai păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ôh. Bơngai pơhrăm năm kơdrô̆ lu sư đĕch.

English: however, other boats came from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr đơ̆ng rŏng đei lơ thŏng-nan nai đơ̆ng Pơlei Tiberia năm truh tơ anih Kră Yang Yêsu krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na asong kơ lu bơngai tơpôl tơmam sa.

English: when the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt Yêsu tơ yơ păng ưh kơ 'bôh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tăm. Na lu bơngai tơpôl ei tŏk thŏng-nan plơ̆ng ei wơ̆r năm tơpăt tơ Pơlei Kapernum wă chă Yêsu.

English: And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk hloh pah âu dơsĭ boih, na lu sư 'bôh hloi Yêsu na jet hloi: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih năm tơ âu layơ?”

English: Jesus answered them and said, “Most assuredly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw the signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan tơpăt kơ iĕm, iĕm chă Inh ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ iĕm 'bôh Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang wă tơbăt kơ iĕm Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh. Iĕm chă Inh yua kơ iĕm sŏng sa phĭ mah đơ̆ng Inh ăn kơ iĕm tơmam sa.

English: Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set His seal on Him.”
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ chă tơmam sa mă jing ôm hach. Iĕm athei adrin chă tơmam sa sot, săt 'lơ̆ng ling-lang, ưh kơ đei layơ ôm hach, wă 'me iĕm arih ling-lang. Tơmam sa ei, Inh mă jur jing kon bơngai, Inh asong ăn kơ lu iĕm. 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao ăn kơ Inh thoi noh păng Sư kư̆m tơbăt ăn kơ kon bơngai tơdrong noh ră mơ̆n.”

English: Then they said to Him, “What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Lei nhôn pơm thoi yơ wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He sent.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “'Bok Kei-Dei wă thoi âu: Sư wă kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh âu mă đơ̆ng Sư wơh.”

English: Therefore they said to Him, “What sign will You perform then, that we may see it and believe You? What work will You do?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl ei khan: “Lei Ih pơm tơ'bôh kơ nhôn tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Ih bĕ, na nhôn lui kơ Ih. Ih wă pơm kơ nhôn tơdrong mơsêh mơyang kiơ?

English: Our fathers ate the manna in the desert; as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”
Bahnar: Môis pơm ăn kơ yă 'bok bơ̆n 'bĕng mana tơ char glă sơ̆, đŏk kiơ̆ thoi đei chih boih thoi âu: ‘Sư ăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa đơ̆ng plĕnh, wă 'me lu sư.’ ”

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan tơwih kơ lu sư: “Inh khan tơpăt wă kơ iĕm hlôh: Tơmam sa đơ̆ng plĕnh noh sơ̆ ưh kơ trŏ kơ Môis ôh ăn. 'Bă Inh ăn tơmam sa noh sơ̆. Păng 'Bă Inh ăn kơ iĕm tơmam sa, mă tơmam sa ei pha, tơmam sa ei kăl hloh tơpă gơh arih kon bơngai ling-lang

English: For the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
Bahnar: kơlih kơ tơmam sa đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ei na gơh jur đơ̆ng plĕnh wă ăn kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh arih.”

English: Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, asong nhôn tơmam sa ei ling-lang bĕ.”

English: And Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to Me shall never hunger, and he who believes in Me shall never thirst.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh boih jing tơmam sa mă ăn kon bơngai arih ei. Na bơngai bu năm tơ Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ layơ pơngot; bơngai bu lui kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ layơ rơhing.

English: But I said to you that you have seen Me and yet do not believe.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi Inh đei khan kơ iĕm boih: Iĕm 'bôh Inh boih mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh.

English: All that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I will by no means cast out.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm lu bơngai mă 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh, lu sư gô lui kơ Inh. Păng bơngai bu lui kơ Inh, Inh ưh kơ tŭk sư ôh.

English: For I have come down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: Inh jur đơ̆ng plĕnh ưh kơ sĭ wă pơm kiơ̆ thoi Inh wă ôh. Inh jur đơ̆ng plĕnh wă pơm kiơ̆ thoi 'Bă Inh wă, kơlih Sư wơh Inh.

English: This is the will of the Father who sent Me, that of all He has given Me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up at the last day.
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh Sư wă kơ Inh huay kơ tơhiong dôm lu bơngai mă Sư pơjao ăn kơ Inh. Na truh năr tôch ning-mônh Inh gô tơiung arih lu sư.

English: And this is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him may have everlasting life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh wă thoi âu: Ăn dôm lu bơngai mă 'bôh Inh Kon Sư na lui hloi kơ Inh, lu sư gô đei arih ling-lang. Inh tơiung arih lu sư năr tôch ning-mônh.”

English: The Jews then complained about Him, because He said, “I am the bread which came down from heaven.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê pơma tơduă lu sư bơbrơ̆k bơbrăk hil kơ Yêsu kơlih kơ Yêsu khan: “Inh boih tơmam sa mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh.”

English: And they said, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Bơngai âu ưh kơ trŏ Yêsu ôh hă, mă kon Yôsep? Bơ̆n băt kơ mĕ 'bă Sư. Mă-lei liơ Sư khan: ‘Inh jur đơ̆ng plĕnh?’ ”

English: Jesus therefore answered and said to them, “Do not murmur among yourselves.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ bâu roi Inh thoi noh.

English: No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up at the last day.
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh athei Inh truh tơ âu, na ưh kơ đei bu truh tơ Inh ôh, dah 'Bă Inh ưh kơ ăn lu sư truh. Bơngai bu mă 'Bă Inh ăn truh tơ Inh, lu bơngai 'noh đĕch truh tơ Inh, na Inh gô tơiung arih lu sư năr tôch ning-mônh.

English: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they shall all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who has heard and learned from the Father comes to Me.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu sư sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô bơtho đĭ-đăng bơngai.’ Inh khan kơ iĕm, bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bă Inh păng lui kơ nơ̆r Sư bơtho, lu bơngai 'noh gô truh tơ Inh.

English: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God; He has seen the Father.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'bôh 'Bă Inh ôh. Pôm Inh Kon Sư mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh đĕch 'bôh kơdih 'Bă.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me has everlasting life.
Bahnar: “Inh khan tơpăt tơpă kơ lu iĕm, bơngai bu lui kơ Inh sư gô arih ling-lang păng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: I am the bread of life.
Bahnar: Inh boih tơmam sa mă ăn kon bơngai gơh arih.

English: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
Bahnar: Lu yă 'bok iĕm sa 'bĕng mana tơ char glă sơ̆, lu sư kư̆m lôch mơ̆n.

English: This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei âu tơmam sa jur đơ̆ng plĕnh mơ̆n. Dah bơngai bu sa tơmam sa âu sư huay kơ lôch hiong ôh.

English: I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread that I shall give is My flesh, which I shall give for the life of the world.”
Bahnar: Inh boih tơmam sa arih kơ kon bơngai mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh; bơngai bu sa tơmam sa âu sư gô arih ling-lang. Tơmam sa mă Inh ăn noh wă khan sĕch akar Inh ăn kơ kon bơngai arih.”

English: The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ Yêsu pơma thoi noh na lu bơngai Juđê pơma pơjah pơjăng dih băl. Lu sư khan: “Lơliơ bơngai âu gơh ăn kơ bơ̆n sĕch akar Sư wă kơ bơ̆n sa?”

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, dah iĕm ưh kơ sa sĕch akar Inh Kon Bơngai păng ưh kơ huch sa pham Inh, lei iĕm ưh kơ đei arih ôh, iĕm dang lĕ lôch đĕch.

English: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sa sĕch akar Inh păng huch sa pham Inh, bơngai 'noh Inh gô tơiung arih sư ning-mônh na sư gô đei arih ling-lang.

English: For My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed.
Bahnar: Inh wă khan kơ iĕm dơ̆ng, sĕch akar Inh tơmam sa kon bơngai tơpă; pham Inh kư̆m đak nhă kon bơngai tơpă.

English: He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sa sĕch akar Inh păng huch sa pham Inh, bơngai 'noh sư oei păng Inh, Inh oei lăm sư.

English: As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who feeds on Me will live because of Me.
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh mă arih ling-lang, Sư wơh Inh na Inh oei arih yua kơ 'Bă Inh. Thoi noh mơ̆n bơngai mă sa sĕch akar Inh, sư gô oei arih yua kơ Inh.

English: This is the bread which came down from heaven—not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever.”
Bahnar: Tơmam sa âu boih jur đơ̆ng plĕnh, ưh kơ thoi tơmam sa mana mă yă 'bok iĕm sa mă lôch sơ̆ ôh. Tơmam sa âu bơngai bu sa sư gô arih ling-lang.”

English: These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho tơdrong âu tơ hnam akŭm Pơlei Kapernum.

English: Therefore many of His disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying; who can understand it?”
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ Sư đơ̆ng sơ̆ đei lơ 'nu kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Sư bơtho noh na khan: “Tơdrong Sư bơtho noh anat tơpă. Bu gơh pơm thoi noh?”

English: When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples complained about this, He said to them, “Does this offend you?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu băt kơdih lu bơngai ei pơma mơmơnh kơ tơdrong Sư bơtho hei. Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh bơtho thoi noh hei trŏ tơpă, mă-lei iĕm ơh hă?

English: What then if you should see the Son of Man ascend where He was before?
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm ơh kơ tơdrong Inh bơtho 'noh hei, lei iĕm gô 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai, na Inh wih tŏk tơ anih Inh mă oei kơpal plĕnh ti sơ̆, na iĕm tơchĕng liơ dơ̆ng đơ̆ng noh?

English: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and they are life.
Bahnar: “Dah jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm lui kiơ̆ tơdrong Inh, lei iĕm gô arih ling-lang. Dah iĕm kiơ̆ tơdrong akâu akar đĕch, lei ưh kơ đei yua kiơ ôh. Dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm gah tơdrong sa sĕch akar Inh, Inh wă ră kơ jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm lui kiơ̆ kơ Inh na iĕm gô arih ling-lang; lei ră.

English: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm lu iĕm mơ'nah ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh.” Yêsu băt hơdrol tơpă; lu bơngai ayơ mă ưh kơ wă lui kơ Sư, Sư băt mơ̆n; bơngai ayơ wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư, Sư kư̆m băt mơ̆n.

English: And He said, “Therefore I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted to him by My Father.”
Bahnar: Yêsu wih khan kơ lu sư dơ̆ng: “Iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, noh kư̆m thoi Inh khan kơ lu iĕm hei: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh truh tơ Inh, dah 'Bă Inh ưh kơ ăn.”

English: From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no more.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr noh boih lơ bơngai achăng lê̆ Yêsu ưh pă kiơ̆ Sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Bĭ lu iĕm hăm wă achăng lê̆ Inh?”

English: But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, nhôn wă kiơ̆ bu dơ̆ng lĕ? Tơdrong Ih bơtho khan wă ăn kơ nhôn gô arih ling-lang tơpă.

English: Also we have come to believe and know that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
Bahnar: Nhôn lui boih kơ Ih. Nhôn băt kơ Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: Jesus answered them, “Did I not choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh rơih mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lu iĕm mă-lei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm dang lĕ yang kơnê̆.”

English: He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, for it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh, Sư pơma jô̆ kơ Juđa kon Simôn đơ̆ng Pơlei Ikariôt. Sư boih lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu ei, mă-lei sư wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu ning-mônh.

English: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; for He did not want to walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu oei năm chă bơtho tơ dêh Galilê. Sư ưh pă năm bơtho tơ dêh Juđê boih kơlih kơ lu bơngai Juđê wă pơlôch Sư.

English: Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.
Bahnar: Lăp wă jê̆ truh năr giĕng đe Juđê mă đe anăn Giĕng Bơsŭn

English: His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You are doing.
Bahnar: na lu oh Yêsu khan kơ Sư: “Ih jăk đơ̆ng âu năm tơ dêh Juđê wă kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Ih tơ ei 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Ih pơm.

English: For no one does anything in secret while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n wă kơ đe băt kơ tơdrong jang bơ̆n, na bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh ôn tơdrong jang bơ̆n ôh. Dah Ih gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơpă lei Ih athei pơm tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp đe lơ wă kơ đe băt kơ Ih.”

English: For even His brothers did not believe in Him.
Bahnar: Lu oh Sư pơma thoi noh kơlih kơ lu sư ưh tam mă lui; oh Sư tăm mă ưh kơ lui kơ Sư tăm.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu oh Sư: “Ưh tam mă trŏ Inh wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem tơbăt kơ đe tơdrong Inh ôh. Mă-lei dah iĕm wă năm, layơ kư̆m bưh.

English: The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it that its works are evil.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm tơduă kon bơngai ala teh âu, đe huay hil areh kơ iĕm ôh. Pôm Inh đĕch lu sư hil tơpă, kơlih kơ Inh tơ'bôh kơ lu sư tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm.

English: You go up to this feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, for My time has not yet fully come.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm năm hơpong bĕ năr giĕng noh. Gah Inh tam mă năm ôh, kơlih kơ tam mă trŏ kơ Inh wă năm.”

English: When He had said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi noh boih na Sư oei lăm dêh Galilê đĕch năr noh.

English: But when His brothers had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng lu oh Sư năm hơpong tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă pơm giĕng ei, Yêsu kư̆m năm mơ̆n. Mă-lei Sư năm hrĕp ưh kơ ăn đe băt.

English: Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”
Bahnar: Trŏ năr giĕng ei boih lu bơngai Juđê chă Sư tơ noh. Lu sư khan: “Yêsu tơ yơ?”

English: And there was much complaining among the people concerning Him. Some said, “He is good”; others said, “No, on the contrary, He deceives the people.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla pơma 'bơm gah tơdrong Yêsu. Lu mơ'nah khan Sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; lu mơ'nah khan Sư ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh, khan Sư chă hơlĕnh kơ kon pơlei pơla đĕch.

English: However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă pơma thoi noh, lu sư ưh kơ pơma 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl ôh kơlih kơ lu sư hli kơ lu kră sư.

English: Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
Bahnar: Lăp tŏk-bŏk năr giĕng ei na Yêsu mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na Sư bơtho đe lăm noh.

English: And the Jews marveled, saying, “How does this Man know letters, having never studied?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê sơleng kơ đon yua kơ Yêsu bơtho hơgei tơpă. Lu sư pơma dih băl khan: “Lơliơ 'Bok âu ưh kơ đei chă pơhrăm tơ hnam trưng mă-lei Sư hơgei tôm tơdrong?”

English: Jesus answered them and said, “My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Tơdrong Inh bơtho âu ưh kơ sĭ lĕch đơ̆ng Inh ôh. Tơdrong âu lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mă wơh Inh.

English: If anyone wills to do His will, he shall know concerning the doctrine, whether it is from God or whether I speak on My own authority.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'maih pơm kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă, bơngai 'noh sư gô băt tơdrong Inh bơtho âu lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, dah lĕch đơ̆ng Inh kơdih.

English: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu bơtho kiơ̆ kơ đon sư tơchĕng kơdih, bơngai 'noh sư wă pơang akâu sư kơdih đĕch. Mă-lei dah bơngai bu bơtho wă pơư pơang nơ̆r 'Bok mă wơh sư, bơngai 'noh bơtho tơpăt, ưh kơ đei layơ hơlĕnh.

English: Did not Moses give you the law, yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ Môis ată ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong juăt, mă-lei lăm lu iĕm ưh kơ đei bu răk tơdrong juăt noh? Na iĕm khan Inh ưh kơ răk tơdrong juăt Môis, na iĕm khan wă pơlôch Inh. Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm wă pơlôch Inh noh?”

English: The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng sư pơma thoi noh na khan kơ sư: “'Noh Ih wơnh boih, bu đei chă wă pơlôch Ih? Ưh kơ đei bu ôh.”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat Inh pơklaih minh 'nu bơngai jĭ jăn, na iĕm khan Inh pơm ưh kơ trŏ.
