English: Moses therefore gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Môis pơkă ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong kăt tơdra akar; mă tơpă ưh kơ sĭ kơ Môis ôh hơdrol. Tơdrong kăt tơdra akar noh đơ̆ng lu yă 'bok iĕm sơ̆ pơtơ̆p hơdrol. Na lăp năr pơdơh Sa'bat iĕm kư̆m jang kăt tơdra akar đe mơ̆n, yua kơ Môis pơkă thoi noh.

English: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath, so that the law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
Bahnar: Iĕm jang kăt tơdra akar đe lăm năr pơdơh kư̆m gơh; liơ iĕm hil kơ Inh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn lăm năr pơdơh mơ̆n? Inh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat, noh trŏ hloh kơ iĕm kăt tơdra akar đe lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat.

English: Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm pran. Iĕm athei sek tơlang mă tơpăt, athei tơchĕng mă tôm tơdrong hơdrol 'mơ̆i.”

English: Now some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?
Bahnar: Lăm lu kon pơlei pơla Jêrusalem đei bơngai mơ'nah khan: “Yêsu âu dah kiơ lu kră bơ̆n khan wă rôp pơlôch Sư ei?

English: But look! He speaks boldly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is truly the Christ?
Bahnar: Dang ei Sư oei bơtho 'bơ̆t anăp bơ̆n tơpôl, mă-lei lu kră bơ̆n ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ kơ Sư, noh lu kră bơ̆n băt kơ Sư 'Bok Krist mă gô pơgơ̆r bơ̆n tơpă boih dah kiơ dang ei?

English: However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơ̆n băt kơ Sư ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Krist ôh, kơlih kơ bơ̆n băt kơ Sư bơngai đơ̆ng yơ. Mă-lei dah 'Bok Krist truh bơ̆n ưh kơ băt Sư đơ̆ng yơ ôh.”

English: Then Jesus cried out, as He taught in the temple, saying, “You both know Me, and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư pơma thoi noh na Sư bơtho 'bơ̆r re lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm: “Lu iĕm khan iĕm băt kơ Inh bơngai đơ̆ng yơ. Mă tơpă ưh kơ sĭ Inh bơngai đơ̆ng noh ôh. Ưh kơ sĭ Inh truh tơ iĕm yua kơ akâu Inh wă kơdih ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Inh tơpă. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ Sư.

English: But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ Sư tơpă kơlih kơ Inh jur đơ̆ng Sư, yua kơ Sư wơh Inh.”

English: Therefore they sought to take Him; but no one laid a hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu đe ei wă rôp Sư ră, mă-lei ưh kơ đei ti bu chro rôp Sư ôh, yua kơ tam trŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: And many of the people believed in Him, and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than these which this Man has done?”
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai mơ'nah lui kơ Sư tơpă. Na lu đe ei khan: “Bơngai âu pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơpă. Nhôn tơchĕng băt kơ Sư 'Bok Krist tơpă boih âu.”

English: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things concerning Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take Him.
Bahnar: Bơngai Pharisi kơtơ̆ng ang kon pơlei pơma 'bơm Yêsu thoi noh, na lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu 'bok soi tih wơh lu linh sư năm rôp Yêsu.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “I shall be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai tơpôl: “Inh oei hơdai iĕm ưh pă đunh boih. Klaih kơ noh Inh wă wih tơ 'Bok mă wơh Inh.

English: You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am you cannot come.”
Bahnar: Iĕm gô chă Inh mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh. Iĕm ưh kơ gơh truh tơ anih Inh ôh.”

English: Then the Jews said among themselves, “Where does He intend to go that we shall not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê pơma dih băl khan: “Bơngai âu Sư wă năm tơ yơ, Sư khan bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh 'bôh Sư dơ̆ng? Rŏ lăng Sư wă năm oei păng lu bơngai Juđê mă oei tơ dêh đe na bơtho lu bơngai dêh đe.

English: What is this thing that He said, ‘You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am you cannot come’?”
Bahnar: Păng Sư wă khan kiơ Sư khan: ‘Iĕm gô chă Inh mă-lei ưh kơ gơh 'bôh Inh,’ păng: ‘Iĕm ưh kơ gơh truh tơ anih Inh mơ̆n?’ ”

English: On the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone thirsts, let him come to Me and drink.
Bahnar: Tơpă wă tôch Năr Giĕng Bơsŭn ei, năr noh năr đe akŭm giĕng tih tơpă, na Yêsu iung dang dơ̆ng bơtho 'bơ̆r re khan: “Bơngai bu rơhing 'maih nhă đak, năm tơ Inh bĕ.

English: He who believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his heart will flow rivers of living water.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lui kơ Inh sư gô đei đak glung ro lăm jơhngơ̆m sư păng ăn kơ sư arih ling-lang kư̆m thoi đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.”

English: But this He spoke concerning the Spirit, whom those believing in Him would receive; for the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi noh dang khan kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Sư gô đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn jur oei păng lu sư. Mă-lei kơplah noh 'Bok Kei-Dei tam mă ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ôh, kơlih Yêsu tam mă lôch iung arih tŏk tơ plĕnh.

English: Therefore many from the crowd, when they heard this saying, said, “Truly this is the Prophet.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih, na lu bơngai mơ'nah khan: “'Bok âu boih 'Bok mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă mă bơ̆n chang gô Sư đơ̆ng sơ̆.”

English: Others said, “This is the Christ.” But some said, “Will the Christ come out of Galilee?
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “'Bok âu boih 'Bok Krist tơpă.” Đei lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “Ưh ôh. 'Bok âu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Galilê mă-lei 'Bok Krist Sư ưh kơ lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Galilê ôh

English: Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem, where David was?”
Bahnar: yua kơ đei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đe chih khan 'Bok Krist lĕch đơ̆ng krung kơtum 'bok Đawit, đơ̆ng pơlei 'bok Đawit mơ̆n. Pơlei ei anăn Pơlei Betlehem lăm dêh char Juđê.”

English: So there was a division among the people because of Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu kon pơlei pơla tơklah băl đon gah tơdrong Yêsu.

English: Now some of them wanted to take Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah wă rôp Sư ră, mă-lei ưh kơ đei ti bu chro rôp Sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why have you not brought Him?”
Bahnar: Lu linh ei brŏk hoh đĕch tơ lu yŏng sư. Na lu yŏng sư 'bok soi tih păng lu đe Pharisi jet lu linh sư khan: “Lơliơ iĕm ưh kơ rôp anhăk Sư tơ âu?”

English: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this Man!”
Bahnar: Lu linh sư khan: “Đơ̆ng sơ̆ tam lah đei bơngai bơtho hơgei dang Sư.”

English: Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi hil kơ lu sư: “'Noh iĕm hơdai wang lui kơ 'bơ̆r Sư bơtho hơlĕnh kơ kon pơlei pơla hăm trŏ?

English: Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed in Him?
Bahnar: Bĭ lu bơngai pơm tih, lu bơngai Pharisi, hăm đei hơdai lui kiơ̆ Sư? Ưh kơ đei bu ôh.

English: But this crowd that does not know the law is accursed.”
Bahnar: Iĕm kiơ̆ kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, lu sư jơ̆l ưh kơ hlôh lăm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư khŭl bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tŭk.”

English: Nicodemus (he who came to Jesus by night, being one of them) said to them
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai sư kư̆m pơm tih lăm bơngai Pharisi, anăn sư Nikôđem, 'bok mă năm ngôi tơ Yêsu kơmăng sơ̆. Sư iung pơma tơduă lu sư pơm tih thoi âu

English: “Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?”
Bahnar: “Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n, ưh kơ gơh phak đe ôh dah lu kră tam mă mơ̆ng păng sek tơlang bơngai mă đe jâu noh, yua kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ băt sư pơm 'lơ̆ng ră dah sư pơm yoch.”

English: They answered and said to him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and look, for no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.”
Bahnar: Na lu bôl buăl sư khan kơ sư: “Ih bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Galilê mơ̆n hă? Ih đŏk lăng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei bĕ, na ih gô băt đe ưh kơ đei chih roi khan bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Galilê ôh, mă Sư âu lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Galilê.”

English: And everyone went to his own house.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đĭ-đăng lu sư brŏk tơklah tơ hnam kơdih.

English: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm tơ kông Ôliwơ.

English: Now early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came to Him; and He sat down and taught them.
Bahnar: Na pơgê hrôih dơning Yêsu hơloh năm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na đĭ-đăng bơngai tơ ei năm mơ̆ng Sư bơtho, na Sư tơoei bơtho lu đe ei.

English: Then the scribes and Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho lu sư na lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu bơngai Pharisi, lu sư anhăk ba minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn tơ Yêsu. Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei đe 'bôh sư ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă tơpă. Na lu sư athei drŏ-kăn mă ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă ei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl.

English: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, bơngai drŏ-kăn âu đe 'bôh sư ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?”
Bahnar: Na Môis sơ̆ chih pơkă lăm tơdrong juăt bơ̆n khan bơngai bu pơm yoch thoi noh athei klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo. Na bĭ Ih khan thoi yơ?”

English: This they said, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear.
Bahnar: Lu sư jet thoi noh, lu sư wă pơlong lăng Yêsu, wă kơ Sư pơma ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, na lu sư wă jâu Yêsu 'bơ̆t anăp đe kră sek tơlang. Mă-lei Yêsu kŭp kơ̆l, ti Sư chih ngôi tơ teh.

English: So when they continued asking Him, He raised Himself up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw a stone at her first.”
Bahnar: Lu đe ei nŏng jet Sư 'bơ'bel. Na Sư ngơk khan kơ lu đe ei thoi âu: “Lăm lu iĕm bơngai bu tam lah pơm yoch, iĕm ăn kơ sư klơ̆m duch 'noh păng tơmo hơdrol kơ lu bơngai mă pơm yoch.”

English: And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sư kŭp kơ̆l chih ngôi teh dơ̆ng.

English: Then those who heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the oldest even to the last. And Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi noh, na lu sư lĕch brŏk pơtoi, đơ̆ng lu kră hơdrol truh tơ lu bơngai tơdăm đơ̆ng rŏng. Na oei pă Yêsu păng duch ei đĕch oei lăm ei.

English: When Jesus had raised Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu ngơk lăng duch ei khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Tơ yơ lu đe noh hei duch? Hăm đei bu wă jâu areh kơ ih dơ̆ng ưh?”

English: She said, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more.”
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, ưh pă đei bu jâu areh kơ inh dơ̆ng ôh.” Na Yêsu khan: “Inh kư̆m ưh kơ jâu ih mơ̆n. Na dang ei brŏk mă 'lơ̆ng kơ ih bĕ, 'nĕ pă pơm yoch dơ̆ng hŏ.”

English: Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows Me shall not walk in darkness, but have the light of life.”
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh pơchrang hơdah kơ kon bơngai jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak wă kơ sư băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơngai bu kiơ̆ Inh sư huay năm lăm măng mu kiơ̆ tơdrong yoch, sư gô đei Inh pơchrang hơdah kơ sư păng ăn sư arih ling-lang.”

English: The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself; Your witness is not true.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai Pharisi khan kơ Sư: “'Noh Ih pơang tơdrong Ih kơdih ưh kơ đei bu nai pơma bơ̆ng Ih, nhôn ưh kơ wă lui kơ Ih ôh.”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I bear witness of Myself, My witness is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from and where I am going.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Mă Inh pơma tơdrong Inh kơdih, Inh pơma trŏ tơpă, yua kơ Inh băt kơdih Inh bơngai đơ̆ng yơ, wă wih tơ yơ. Mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ hlôh Inh bơngai đơ̆ng yơ, gô wih tơ yơ noh ôh.

English: You judge according to the flesh; I judge no one.
Bahnar: Iĕm sek tơlang tơdrong Inh kiơ̆ kơ đon iĕm tơchĕng kơdih. Gah Inh ưh kơ đei sek tơlang bu ôh.

English: And yet if I do judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah Inh wă sek tơlang, Inh athei sek tơlang mă tơpăt, ưh kơ sĭ sek tơlang hơdrô̆ Inh ôh, nhi 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh sek tơlang hơdai.

English: It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong juăt iĕm, đei chih thoi âu: Dah đei bơngai đe wă sek tơlang, bơngai đe wă sek tơlang noh sư athei đei 'bar 'nu pơma bơ̆ng sư 'mơ̆i wă kơ đe băt sư pơma tơpăt dah ưh.

English: I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness of Me.”
Bahnar: Na gah Inh, akâu Inh kơdih păng 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh pơma bơ̆ng Inh wă kơ iĕm băt tơdrong Inh pơma tơpăt.”

English: Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet: “'Bă Ih tơ yơ?” Yêsu khan: “Yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ Inh, na iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bă Inh mơ̆n. Dah iĕm băt kơ Inh lei iĕm kư̆m băt kơ 'Bă Inh mơ̆n.”

English: These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, for His hour had not yet come.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho tơdrong âu, Sư bơtho lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, 'bơ̆t anih đe tah jên pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei ti bu chro rôp Sư ôh, yua kơ tam trŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sin. Where I go you cannot come.”
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng lu sư thoi âu: “Inh gô jăk tơ nai, na iĕm gô chă Inh mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh. Păng iĕm gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm. Iĕm ưh kơ gơh truh tơ anih Inh ôh.”

English: So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself, because He says, ‘Where I go you cannot come’?”
Bahnar: Lu đe Juđê khan: “Ô tơpă yơh, Sư wă pơlôch akâu Sư dah kiơ na Sư khan: ‘Iĕm ưh kơ gơh truh tơ anih Inh’?”

English: And He said to them, “You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm bơngai đơ̆ng ala teh âu, Inh bơngai đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti.

English: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Inh khan kơ iĕm boih, iĕm gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm. Dah iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh đơ̆ng plĕnh ti iĕm gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm tơpă.”

English: Then they said to Him, “Who are You?” And Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.
Bahnar: Lu sư jet: “Ih bu?” Yêsu khan: “Inh bơngai mă roi kơ iĕm sơ̆ boih.

English: I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him.”
Bahnar: Inh oei đei lơ tơdrong wă pơma păng iĕm mơ̆n gah tơdrong wă sek tơlang iĕm. 'Bok mă wơh Inh Sư pơma ling-lang tơpăt na Inh kơtơ̆ng Sư pơma thoi yơ, Inh bơtho đe kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.”

English: They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
Bahnar: Dôm lu đe noh ưh kơ hlôh Yêsu roi kơ lu sư 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father taught Me, I speak these things.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ hlôh thoi noh na Yêsu wih roi dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Lăp đang kơ iĕm pơ̆ng pơlôch Inh Kon Bơngai ning-mônh, 'bơ̆t ei boih iĕm băt kơ Inh Kon Sư. Păng iĕm gô băt kơ Inh ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ thoi Inh tơchĕng kơdih. Inh kơtơ̆ng Sư pơma thoi yơ, na Inh bơtho đe kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”
Bahnar: 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh, Sư oei hơdai păng Inh ling-lang. Sư ưh kơ achăng lê̆ kơdrô̆ Inh ôh, yua kơ Inh ling-lang pơm trŏ thoi Sư wă.”

English: As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh na đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Sư.

English: Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him, “If you abide in My word, you are My disciples indeed.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê mă lui kơ Sư boih: “Dah iĕm răk kiơ̆ tơdrong Inh bơtho khŏm khŏm, lei iĕm bơngai kiơ̆ Inh tơpă boih.

English: And you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm gô băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, thoi noh na iĕm gô rơngei.”

English: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How can You say, ‘You will be made free’?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai kiơ̆ ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Nhôn kon sâu Abraham. Nhôn ưh kơ lah đĭch đe. Lơliơ Ih khan: ‘Iĕm gô rơngei’?”

English: Jesus answered them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, whoever commits sin is a slave of sin.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, iĕm ưh kơ rơngei ôh, yua bơngai bu pơm yoch ling-lang, bơngai 'noh sư dang đĭch mơ̆n yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư.

English: And a slave does not abide in the house forever, but a son abides forever.
Bahnar: Bơngai đĭch đe sư ưh kơ atŏ yŏng sư ôh; pôm kon yŏng sư atŏ 'bă sư.

English: Therefore if the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dah Kon Sư ăn iĕm rơngei, na iĕm gô rơngei tơpă.

English: “I know that you are Abraham’s descendants, but you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.
Bahnar: Inh băt mơ̆n iĕm kon sâu Abraham, mă-lei iĕm wă pơlôch Inh. Iĕm ưh kơ wă lui yom kơ Inh bơtho hơya tŏ sĕt 'biơ̆.

English: I speak what I have seen with My Father, and you do what you have seen with your father.”
Bahnar: Inh roi kơ iĕm tơdrong mă Inh 'bôh kơplah Inh oei hơdai păng 'Bă Inh. Na iĕm pơm kiơ̆ iĕm kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'bă iĕm.”

English: They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Abraham boih 'bă nhôn.” Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah iĕm kon Abraham tơpă lei iĕm pơm kiơ̆ thoi sư pơm.

English: But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei iĕm wă pơlôch Inh, sơmă Inh roi kơ iĕm tơpăt tơdrong Inh kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. Abraham sư ưh kơ wă pơlôch đe ôh.

English: You do the deeds of your father.” Then they said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father—God.”
Bahnar: Iĕm pơm kiơ̆ kơ 'bă iĕm đĕch.” Lu sư khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ kiơ̆ yang nai ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch 'Bă nhôn.”

English: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Ưh ôh. Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă iĕm tơpă lei iĕm kư̆m 'mêm kơ Inh mơ̆n, yua kơ Inh jur đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh năm bơtho iĕm ưh kơ sĭ Inh 'maih kơdih đĕch ôh. Inh jur tơ âu yua kơ Sư wơh Inh.

English: Why do you not understand My speech? Because you are not able to listen to My word.
Bahnar: Inh tơhlôh ăn kơ iĕm thoi noh boih, kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm ưh kơ wao tơdrong Inh bơtho? Hăm trŏ iĕm arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ wă lui kơ nơ̆r Inh bơtho?

English: You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it.
Bahnar: 'Noh 'bă iĕm yang Satan, na iĕm pơm kiơ̆ kơ sư wă kơ sư lăp đon kơ iĕm. Đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ sư nŏng kơ chă pơlôch đe păng sư ưh kơ pơma tơpăt tŏ sĕt 'biơ̆, yua kơ sư ưh kơ layơ pơm tơpăt. Sư hơlĕnh ling-lang. Sư pơm yŏng pơjing gah tơdrong hơlĕnh.

English: But because I tell the truth, you do not believe Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh âu pơma bơtho iĕm tơdrong tơpăt ră iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh. 'Noh yua kơ đon iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ tơpăt mơ̆n.

English: Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me?
Bahnar: “Lăm lu iĕm ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh Inh pơm yoch kiơ. Dah Inh pơma tơpăt lơliơ iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh?

English: He who is of God hears God’s words; therefore you do not hear, because you are not of God.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai 'noh mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei noh iĕm ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.”

English: Then the Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ Sư: “Trŏ boih nhôn khan Ih bơngai Samari yang mơ̆t.”

English: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh ưh kơ đei yang mơ̆t ôh. Inh pơư pơang anăn 'Bă Inh ră, na iĕm nŏng kơ pơma pơjăm pơjuă Inh.

English: And I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ chă pơư pơang akâu Inh kơdih ôh. Đei minh 'nu 'Bok, Sư wă pơư pơang Inh păng Sư gô sek tơlang tơdrong bơ̆n âu tơpăt.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he shall never see death.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, bơngai bu răk nơ̆r Inh bơtho, bơngai 'noh huay kơ lôch ôh.”

English: Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word he shall never taste death.’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ Sư: “Dang ei nhôn băt kơ Ih bơngai yang mơ̆t tơpă boih. Abraham lôch boih, lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ kư̆m hơdai lôch đĭ, mă Ih khan bơngai bu răk nơ̆r Ih bơtho, bơngai 'noh huay kơ lôch.

English: Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?”
Bahnar: Ih hăm tih hloh kơ 'bok kơdră bơ̆n Abraham? Sư lôch boih, lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ kư̆m lôch boih. Na dang ei đe pôk Ih pơm kiơ boih?”

English: Jesus answered, “If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father who honors Me, of whom you say that He is your God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah Inh pơma pơang kơdih akâu đĕch trŏ mơ̆n iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh. Mă-lei pôm 'Bă Inh đĕch pơang akâu Inh. 'Bă Inh noh iĕm khan Sư Kră Yang iĕm

English: Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I say, ‘I do not know Him,’ I shall be a liar like you; but I do know Him and keep His word.
Bahnar: mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ Sư ôh. Inh băt kơ Sư tơpă. Dah Inh khan Inh ưh kơ băt kơ Sư, lei Inh bơngai hơlĕnh thoi iĕm mơ̆n. Inh băt kơ Sư tơpă, na Inh băt kơ răk nơ̆r Sư.

English: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad.”
Bahnar: 'Bă iĕm Abraham hiôk chơt kơlih kơ sư băt sư gô 'bôh năr Inh truh. Sư 'bôh boih na sư hiôk chơt tơpă.”

English: Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ Sư: “Ih tam truh pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, thoi yơ Ih gơh 'bôh Abraham?”

English: Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I AM.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, hơdrol kơ Abraham tam mă đei, Inh đei boih.”

English: Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei lu sư iŏk hloi tơmo wă klơ̆m Sư ră; mă-lei Sư ôn akâu Sư kơdih hloi lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm ei.

English: Now as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from birth.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei năm rok trong, Sư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai măt tol đơ̆ng mĕ Sư tơpŭ sơ̆.

English: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, bơngai âu măt tol đơ̆ng mĕ sư tơpŭ sơ̆, na yua kơ kiơ? Yua kơ sư kơdih pơm yoch dah yua kơ mĕ 'bă sư pơm yoch?”

English: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but that the works of God should be revealed in him.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Sư măt tol ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ đơ̆ng sư pơm yoch, dah đơ̆ng mĕ 'bă sư pơm yoch ôh. Sư măt tol yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư wă pơklaih bơngai âu.

English: I must work the works of Him who sent Me while it is day; the night is coming when no one can work.
Bahnar: “Dang ei oei 'năr, na bơ̆n athei jang tơdrong 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh. Dah 'năr mơ̆t boih, ưh kơ đei bu gơh jang dơ̆ng.

English: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh oei ala teh âu Inh dang măt 'năr pơchrang hơdah tơ teh âu wă kơ kon bơngai băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: When He had said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu kơsoh đak hai tơ teh, hơwơ̆r đak hai păng teh hơdai. Klaih kơ noh na Sư pik tơ măt bơngai măt tol.

English: And He said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated, Sent). So he went and washed, and came back seeing.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Năm bĕ ih, năm 'nhao măt ih tơ đak dơnâu mă đe anăn dơnâu Silôm.” (Silôm wă khan đak klang đơ̆ng nai ro tơ dơnâu Silôm.) Na sư năm 'nhao hloi tơ đak dơnâu ei. Klaih kơ noh sư brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih, sư gơh 'bôh hơdah boih.

English: Therefore the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind said, “Is not this he who sat and begged?”
Bahnar: Lu buăl sư păng lu bơngai juăt 'bôh sư pơm ăn-mai krô hmă jet thoi âu: “Bơngai âu sơ̆ sư pơm ăn-mai iih?”

English: Some said, “This is he.” Others said, “He is like him.” He said, “I am he.”
Bahnar: Đei buăl mơ'nah khan: “Jơ̆ sư âu tơpă.” Buăl mơ'nah khan dơ̆ng: “Ưh kơ sĭ sư âu ôh, hơbŏ sư âu đĕch thoi sư.” Mă-lei bơngai đêl măt tol ei khan kơ lu sư: “Trŏ kơ inh âu boih măt tol pơm ăn-mai sơ̆.”

English: Therefore they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei jet sư: “Lei lơliơ ih gơh 'bôh hơdah boih?”

English: He answered and said, “A Man called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ So I went and washed, and I received sight.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Bơngai mă đe anăn Yêsu, Sư kơsoh đak hai tơ teh, hơwơ̆r đak hai păng teh hơdai; klaih kơ noh pik kơ măt inh. Na Sư khan kơ inh: ‘Năm bĕ ih, năm 'nhao măt ih tơ đak dơnâu Silôm.’ Na inh năm 'nhao măt inh tơ đak ei na măt inh 'bôh hơdah hloi.”

English: Then they said to him, “Where is He?” He said, “I do not know.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng: “Lei 'Bok ei tơ yơ dang ei?” Bơngai đêl măt tol ei khan: “Inh ưh kơ băt Sư tơ yơ.”

English: They brought him who formerly was blind to the Pharisees.
Bahnar: Na lu sư anhăk ba bơngai đêl măt tol ei tơ lu bơngai Pharisi

English: Now it was a Sabbath when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
Bahnar: kơlih kơ năr noh năr pơdơh Sa'bat, na Yêsu pơklaih minh 'nu bơngai măt tol.

English: Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi jet sư: “Thoi yơ ih gơh 'bôh hơdah boih?” Sư khan: “Kơlih kơ 'Bok ei kơsoh đak hai tơ teh pik kơ măt inh, na inh năm 'nhao tơ đak gơh 'bôh hơdah hloi.”

English: Therefore some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” And there was a division among them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi mơ'nah khan: “Bơngai pơm thoi noh Sư ưh kơ sĭ lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, yua kơ Sư ưh kơ răk năr pơdơh Sa'bat.” Lu mơ'nah khan dơ̆ng: “Yah lei, bơngai yoch ưh kơ gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi Sư noh ôh.” Thoi noh na lu sư tơklah băl đon gah tơdrong Yêsu.

English: They said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him because He opened your eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng bơngai đêl măt tol ei: “'Bok ei, ih khan Sư pơklaih măt ih 'bôh hơdah, na ih anăn Sư 'Bok kiơ ei?” Na bơngai măt tol ei khan: “Inh anăn Sư 'Bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă 'noh.”

English: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê ưh kơ lui kơ bơngai noh đơ̆ng măt tol sơ̆ na 'nao klaih dang ei. Na lu sư năm krao mĕ 'bă bơngai đêl măt tol ei năm tơ lu sư.

English: And they asked them, saying, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư jet: “Bơngai âu hăm trŏ kơ kon biĕm? Đơ̆ng tơpŭ kơ sư sơ̆ sư hăm măt tol ưh? Păng thoi yơ sư gơh 'bôh hơdah dang ei?”

English: His parents answered them and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind
Bahnar: Mĕ 'bă sư khan: “Nhi băt kơ sư âu kon nhi tơpă; păng nhi băt kơ sư măt tol đơ̆ng nge.

English: but by what means he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. He is of age; ask him. He will speak for himself.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei nhi ưh kơ băt yua kơ kiơ măt sư klaih boih âu păng nhi ưh kơ băt bu pơklaih măt sư âu. Iĕm jet lăng sư bĕ, sư kư̆m bơngai kră gơh tơl iĕm mơ̆n.”

English: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, for the Jews had agreed already that if anyone confessed that He was Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
Bahnar: Mĕ 'bă sư ưh kơ wă khan Yêsu pơklaih sư yua kơ sư hli kơ lu bơngai Juđê. Lu bơngai Juđê khan bơngai bu khan Yêsu 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai, bơngai 'noh lu sư ưh kơ ăn năm mơ̆t akŭm tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na mĕ 'bă sư khan: “Sư kư̆m bơngai 'lŏ kră gơh tơl iĕm mơ̆n, na apinh iĕm jet sư bĕ.”

English: So they again called the man who was blind, and said to him, “Give God the glory! We know that this Man is a sinner.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư krao bơngai đêl măt tol ei minh 'măng dơ̆ng na jet sư: “Ih bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch hŏ măt ih gơh 'bôh hơdah boih. Gah nhôn băt kơ Yêsu bơngai yoch tơpă.”

English: He answered and said, “Whether He is a sinner or not I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see.”
Bahnar: Na bơngai đêl măt tol ei khan kơ lu sư: “Inh ưh kơ băt Sư bơngai yoch dah ưh. Pôm tơdrong âu inh băt: Inh băt tơdra kơ inh bơngai măt tol sơ̆ mă-lei đơ̆ng Sư pơklaih inh âu, na dang ei inh gơh 'bôh hơdah hloi tơpă.”

English: Then they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet dơ̆ng: “Sư pơm kiơ kơ ih? Sư pơm kơ ih gơh 'bôh hơdah thoi yơ?”

English: He answered them, “I told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai 'nao klaih kơ măt tol ei khan: “Inh roi kơ iĕm boih, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ lui. Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm wă kơ inh roi dơ̆ng? Iĕm wă lui kơ Sư mơ̆n dah kiơ?”

English: Then they reviled him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ sư khan thoi noh, na lu sư hil tơpă păng khan: “Ih 'maih lui lăi kơ Sư. Nhôn ưh kơ lui ôh. Nhôn lui kơ Môis đĕch.

English: We know that God spoke to Moses; as for this fellow, we do not know where He is from.”
Bahnar: Nhôn băt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma păng Môis tơpă. Mă-lei bơngai noh nhôn ưh kơ băt Sư bơngai đơ̆ng yơ.”

English: The man answered and said to them, “Why, this is a marvelous thing, that you do not know where He is from; yet He has opened my eyes!
Bahnar: Bơngai đêl măt tol ei khan dơ̆ng: “Inh mah chrêu kơ đon tơpă! Sư pơklaih măt inh mah 'bôh hơdah boih, mă-lei iĕm khan ưh kơ băt Sư bơngai đơ̆ng yơ.

English: Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him.
Bahnar: Dah Sư bơngai yoch, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn Sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang ôh, yua kơ bơ̆n băt 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng lu bơngai yoch ôh. Sư mơ̆ng dôm lu bơngai mă lui kơ Sư.

English: Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of one who was born blind.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh păng teh ưh tam đei bu gơh pơklaih bơngai măt tol đơ̆ng nge mĕ sư tơpŭ sơ̆ mă gơh 'bôh hơdah dơ̆ng.

English: If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing.”
Bahnar: Tơdah 'Bok noh ưh kơ lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, lei Sư ưh kơ gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang kiơ ôh.”

English: They answered and said to him, “You were completely born in sins, and are you teaching us?” And they cast him out.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Ih măt tol đơ̆ng 'nao tơpŭ kơ ih sơ̆ kơlih kơ tơdrong yoch, na liơ ih wă bơtho lu nhôn dơ̆ng?” Lu sư pơpuh tơlĕch hloi bơngai ei tơ 'ngoaih.

English: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when He had found him, He said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng ang lu sư pơpuh bơngai ei, na Yêsu năm chă sư dơ̆ng. Lăp 'bôh boih na Sư jet bơngai ei: “Ih hăm wă lui kơ Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei?”

English: He answered and said, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai đêl măt tol ei khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, anăn Sư bu ei? Ih roi kơ inh wă kơ inh lui kơ Sư.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “You have both seen Him and it is He who is talking with you.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ih 'bôh Sư boih, Sư mă pơma dơnuh păng ih dang ei.”

English: Then he said, “Lord, I believe!” And he worshiped Him.
Bahnar: Na bơngai 'nao klaih măt tol ei hloi sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok, inh lui kơ Ih.”

English: And Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may be made blind.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh jur tơ ala teh âu wă sek tơlang kon bơngai wă kơ dôm lu bơngai ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư dang măt tol, gô hlôh; păng dôm lu bơngai khan sư hlôh mă-lei ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, na ăn lu sư jing ưh kơ hlôh dơ̆ng. Lu bơngai ei boih dang măt tol tơpă.”

English: Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we blind also?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi mơ'nah oei dơ̆ng jê̆ 'bơ̆t Yêsu, lu sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na khan: “Lu nhôn măt tol mơ̆n hă?”

English: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei lei Inh ưh kơ jô̆ kơ iĕm yoch ôh. Sơmă iĕm khan iĕm hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh, iĕm pơm thoi noh yoch boih.”

English: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei pơma kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt tơpă, bơngai bu mơ̆t tơ hơdrong triu mă ưh kơ mơ̆t trong 'măng tơm, na hao trong war, bơngai 'noh sư chă tơtông.

English: But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă mơ̆t trong 'măng tơm, bơngai 'noh sư tơ'ngla triu.

English: To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
Bahnar: Na bơngai gak 'măng pơih ăn kơ tơ'ngla sư 'măng hloi. Mă triu kư̆m kơnăl kơ 'bơ̆r tơ'ngla sư mơ̆n. Na tơ'ngla sư krao tôm kơ anăn lu sư, na tơlĕch lu sư kiơ̆ tơ'ngla sư lĕch tơ 'ngoaih.

English: And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
Bahnar: Lăp tơ'ngla sư tơlĕch triu sư tôm đĭ tơ 'ngoaih boih, na sư yak hơdrol kơ triu sư, na triu sư kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng, yua kơ triu sư kơnăl kơ 'bơ̆r tơ'ngla sư.

English: Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”
Bahnar: Lu triu ei ưh kơ kiơ̆ bơngai tơmoi ôh. Sư kơdâu jăk đơ̆ng bơngai tơmoi yua kơ sư ưh kơ băt kơ 'bơ̆r bơngai tơmoi.”

English: Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.
Bahnar: 'Noh Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu bơngai Juđê ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ hlôh Yêsu bơtho tơdrong noh.

English: Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Yêsu bơtho kơ lu sư thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, triu wă mơ̆t lăm hơdrong, sư athei mơ̆t trong 'măng. Na Inh thoi 'măng hơdrong, lu bơngai wă oei păng 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư athei mơ̆t trong Inh, noh wă khan athei lui kơ Inh.

English: All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai truh hơdrol kơ inh khan wă wei-lăng triu, lu sư dang bơngai chă tơtông ngăl mă-lei triu ưh kơ kiơ̆ lu sư ôh.

English: I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.
Bahnar: Inh thoi 'măng hơdrong, bơngai bu mơ̆t trong Inh, lui kơ Inh, sư gô klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Sư gơh mơ̆t păng gơh lĕch chă sa ưh kơ hli tơdrong kiơ.

English: The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.
Bahnar: Bơngai chă tơtông truh, sư wă tơtông iŏk đĕch păng wă pơrăm đĕch. Mă-lei inh truh tơ âu wă ăn kơ triu arih păng hiôk chơt tơpă.

English: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.
Bahnar: “Inh bơngai wei triu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Inh chu lôch yua kơ triu Inh.

English: But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.
Bahnar: Gah bơngai wei triu mă ưh kơ tơ'ngla triu ei, sư bơngai jang đĕch; bơngai 'noh lăp sư 'bôh kŏ-so truh sư achăng lê̆ triu ei, na akâu sư jăk hloi tơ nai. Lu triu ei mơ'nah kŏ-so rôp, mơ'nah jăk tơklah tơklang.

English: The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.
Bahnar: Bơngai ei kơdâu jăk yua kơ sư bơngai jang đĕch, sư ưh kơ 'mêm kơ triu ôh.

English: I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.
Bahnar: Gah Inh bơngai wei triu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng brĕ tơpă. Inh băt kơ triu Inh, triu Inh băt kơ Inh mơ̆n

English: As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.
Bahnar: kư̆m thoi 'Bă Inh băt kơ Inh, na Inh băt kơ Sư mơ̆n. Na Inh athei chu lôch yua kơ triu Inh.

English: And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.
Bahnar: Inh đei mơ̆n triu khŭl nai, mă-lei ưh kơ trŏ khŭl Juđê âu ôh. Na Inh athei iŏk triu khŭl nai ei. Lu triu ei gô lui kơ Inh păng băt kơ 'bơ̆r Inh pơma mơ̆n. Na triu ei păng triu tơpôl âu lu sư gô jing minh tơpôl lơ kiơ̆ minh 'nu Inh wei-lăng.

English: “Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it again.
Bahnar: “'Bă Inh 'mêm kơ Inh kơlih Inh chu ăn akâu Inh lôch, na Sư gô tơiung arih dơ̆ng.

English: No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This command I have received from My Father.”
Bahnar: Dah Inh ưh kơ ăn, ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơlôch Inh ôh. Inh lôch yua Inh wă kơdih Inh đĕch. Inh gơh ăn akâu Inh lôch, Inh gơh ăn akâu Inh iung arih; noh đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh pơkă, na Inh pơm thoi noh.”

English: Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho thoi noh lu bơngai Juđê tơklah băl đon gah tơdrong Yêsu.

English: And many of them said, “He has a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to Him?”
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai mơ'nah khan: “Iĕm 'maih mơ̆ng kiơ kơ Sư, noh Sư bơngai yang mơ̆t pơm kơ Sư wơnh?”

English: Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “Bơngai yang mơ̆t ưh kơ gơh bơtho thoi noh ôh. Lơliơ yang kơnê̆ gơh pơm bơngai măt tol gơh 'bôh hơdah?”

English: Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem, and it was winter.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem năr đe pơm giĕng lu bơngai Juđê. Pơm giĕng ei đe wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr đe pơyơ̆r hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm sơ̆.

English: And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei bơyan puih tơngiĕt. Na Yêsu nơnăm lăm pra Sôlômôn, lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm.

English: Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him, “How long do You keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai Juđê năm akŭm tăp dăr kơ Sư păng jet Sư thoi âu: “Đunh tơpă boih Ih oei chĭt lê̆ đon nhôn gueo sơleng. Dah Ih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơgơ̆r nhôn Ih jah roi kơ nhôn bĕ wă kơ nhôn băt kơ Ih.”

English: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in My Father’s name, they bear witness of Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ iĕm boih mă iĕm ưh kơ wă lui. Dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh pơm tơ'bôh ăn kơ iĕm ră wă kơ iĕm băt kơ Inh âu 'Bok Krist.

English: But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm kuă kơ lui, kơlih lu iĕm ưh kơ trŏ kơ triu Inh.

English: My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm triu Inh tơpă lei iĕm băt kơ 'bơ̆r Inh pơma hloi păng Inh kư̆m băt kơ iĕm mơ̆n, na iĕm kiơ̆ Inh hloi.

English: And I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; neither shall anyone snatch them out of My hand.
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ triu Inh arih ling-lang, sư ưh kơ layơ lôch răm ôh. Ưh kơ đei bu kĕ tơgar iŏk sư đơ̆ng ti Inh.

English: My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father’s hand.
Bahnar: Lu triu 'Bă Inh mă ăn kơ Inh ei, 'Bok ei boih tih hloh kơ dôm lu yang nai, na ưh kơ đei bu kĕ tơgar iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng ti 'Bă Inh ôh.

English: I and My Father are one.”
Bahnar: Nhi 'Bă Inh dang minh 'nu akâu đĕch.”

English: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Juđê kơtơ̆ng Sư khan thoi noh, lu sư iŏk tơmo wă klơ̆m pơlôch Sư ră.

English: Jesus answered them, “Many good works I have shown you from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan hloi: “Iĕm 'bôh Inh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh 'lơ̆ng ngăl boih. 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh pơm dôm tơdrong noh. Na iĕm wă klơ̆m Inh păng tơmo yua kơ Inh pơm dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng mă 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh pơm noh hă?”

English: The Jews answered Him, saying, “For a good work we do not stone You, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, make Yourself God.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ klơ̆m Ih ôh gah tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng, mă-lei nhôn wă klơ̆m păng tơmo yua kơ Ih pơma tih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Ih kon bơngai đĕch, mă Ih khan Ih atŏ păng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods” ’?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đei chih khan, 'Bok Kei-Dei anăn lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ khan sư kư̆m dang yang mơ̆n.

English: If He called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture cannot be broken)
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma trŏ tơpăt, na 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ lu kơdră bơ̆n mă Sư ăn jang tơdrong Sư sơ̆ khan sư dang yang.

English: do you say of Him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
Bahnar: Na lơliơ iĕm khan Inh pơma tih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Inh khan Inh Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh jang tơdrong Sư tơpă păng wơh Inh jur tơ ala teh âu.

English: If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me
Bahnar: Dah Inh ưh kơ pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh ăn lei trŏ tơpă iĕm ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh.

English: but if I do, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”
Bahnar: Iĕm kuă kơ lui kơ nơ̆r Inh bơtho, mă-lei iĕm athei lui kơ dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Inh pơm krô hmă noh hŏ, yua kơ đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh tơpă. Dah iĕm lui iĕm gô băt tơpă 'Bă Inh oei lăm Inh, nhi 'Bă Inh minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon.”

English: Therefore they sought again to seize Him, but He escaped out of their hand.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai Juđê wă rôp Sư ră, mă-lei Sư jăk hloi đơ̆ng anih noh.

English: And He went away again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was baptizing at first, and there He stayed.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu tŏk pah to krong Jôrđăn. Sư năm tơ anih Yôhan juăt pơm 'batem kơ đe sơ̆ na Yêsu oei tơ ei.

English: Then many came to Him and said, “John performed no sign, but all the things that John spoke about this Man were true.”
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai năm tơ Yêsu tơ ei. Lu sư khan: “Yôhan ưh kơ pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang ôh, mă-lei sư khan tôm tơdrong gah Yêsu trŏ tơpă.”

English: And many believed in Him there.
Bahnar: Na đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ ei.

English: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Bethani đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Lasarơ. Oh sư bre Mari păng Mathê kư̆m oei pơlei ei mơ̆n.

English: It was that Mary who anointed the Lord with fragrant oil and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.
Bahnar: Mari âu mă tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu kơ jơ̆ng Yêsu păng iŏk sŏk sư kơdih sut kơ jơ̆ng Yêsu. Na dang ei 'nhŏng sư Lasarơ oei păn kơ jĭ.

English: Therefore the sisters sent to Him, saying, “Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick.”
Bahnar: Na 'bar 'nu bre mai oh ei wơh đe năm tơ Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok, Lasarơ mă Ih 'mêm kơeng, sư oei păn kơ jĭ.”

English: When Jesus heard that, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na khan: “Tơdrong jĭ sư 'noh huay kơ lôch ôh. Tơdrong jĭ 'noh wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng ư-ang kơ Kon Sư mơ̆n.”

English: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'mêm tơpă kơ Mathê, Mari păng 'nhŏng sư Lasarơ.

English: So, when He heard that he was sick, He stayed two more days in the place where He was.
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng Lasarơ jĭ ră, mă-lei Sư oei tơ anih ei pă 'bar năr dơ̆ng, pah to đak krong Jôrđăn.

English: Then after this He said to the disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bar năr ei na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu: “Bĕ bơ̆n wih dơ̆ng tơ dêh char Juđê.”

English: The disciples said to Him, “Rabbi, lately the Jews sought to stone You, and are You going there again?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Lơliơ, lu bơngai Juđê 'nao chă wă klơ̆m Ih păng tơmo, mă dang ei Ih khan wă wih dơ̆ng tơ ei?”

English: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Huay ôh, lăm minh năr đei mơjĭt-'bar jơ dah kiơ? Na bu nơnăm yak kơ'năr sư 'noh huay kơ kơtơih ôh, kơlih kơ đei 'năr pơchrang hơdah tơ ala teh âu.

English: But if one walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu ưh kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sư dang yak kơmăng; kơlih kơ sư ưh kơ lui na pă jor sư gô kuơ̆l kơ trong, kơlih sư ưh kơ wă 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư trong.”

English: These things He said, and after that He said to them, “Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I go that I may wake him up.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Lasarơ bơngai mă juăt păng bơ̆n, sư oei tep na Inh wă năm râu sư dang ei.”

English: Then His disciples said, “Lord, if he sleeps he will get well.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, sư wă klaih kơ jĭ thâu na sư 'maih tep dêh.”

English: However, Jesus spoke of his death, but they thought that He was speaking about taking rest in sleep.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơjuang kơ lu sư Lasarơ lôch boih mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ hlôh, ngêh kơ Lasarơ tep đĕch.

English: Then Jesus said to them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu roi tơpăt kơ lu sư: “Lasarơ lôch boih.

English: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him.”
Bahnar: Trŏ mơ̆n Inh ưh kơ đei năm pơklaih sư năr mơsơ̆ kơlih Inh wă kơ iĕm lui kơjăp. Na dang ei bĕ bơ̆n năm lăng sư.”

English: Then Thomas, who is called the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with Him.”
Bahnar: Na Thôm mă đe krao sư Kon Kơmar, sư khan kơ buăl pơhrăm tơduă sư khan: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm kiơ̆ Sư wă kơ bơ̆n lôch hơdai Sư.”

English: So when Jesus came, He found that he had already been in the tomb four days.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ pơlei ei boih, đe 'bŭ Lasarơ lăm hơgơp tơmo puăn năr boih.

English: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles away.
Bahnar: Pơlei Bethani jê̆ Pơlei Jêrusalem dang pêng kơsô̆ đĕch.

English: And many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
Bahnar: Na đei lơ bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem năm ngôi hơpong tơ bre Mathê păng Mari wă kơ bre sư huay sơ'ngon kơ 'nhŏng bre sư lôch.

English: Now Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met Him, but Mary was sitting in the house.
Bahnar: Lăp Mathê kơtơ̆ng ang đe khan Yêsu wă jê̆ truh tơ bre sư, na Mathê năm tơkan hloi tơ Sư. Gah Mari oei lăm hnam.

English: Now Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
Bahnar: Mathê khan hloi kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, dah Ih tơ âu ki lei 'nhŏng inh huay kơ lôch ôh.

English: But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh kư̆m băt dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơm kiơ̆ thoi Ih apinh Sư.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “'Nhŏng ih gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
Bahnar: Mathê khan: “Inh băt mơ̆n sư gô iung arih năr tôch ning-mônh.”

English: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, he shall live.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh boih tơiung arih bơngai đơ̆ng lôch păng ăn tơdrong arih ling-lang. Bơngai bu lui kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh sư lôch bưh mơ̆n, mă-lei Inh tơiung arih sư dơ̆ng.

English: And whoever lives and believes in Me shall never die. Do you believe this?”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu arih yua kơ sư lui kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ layơ lôch hiong. Ih hăm lui tơdrong 'noh?”

English: She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who is to come into the world.”
Bahnar: Mathê drơ̆ng: “Ơ 'Bok, inh lui tơpă. Inh lui kơ Ih 'Bok Krist, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mă nhôn chang gô jur tơ ala teh âu wă dŏng pơklaih nhôn.”

English: And when she had said these things, she went her way and secretly called Mary her sister, saying, “The Teacher has come and is calling for you.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơma thoi noh Mathê năm krao oh sư Mari. Sư khan kơ oh sư kơdrô̆ bre sư thoi âu: “'Bok Thây truh tơ âu boih păng Sư wă kơ e.”

English: As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came to Him.
Bahnar: Mari kơtơ̆ng thoi noh boih na sư iung tơkan năm tơ Yêsu.

English: Now Jesus had not yet come into the town, but was in the place where Martha met Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu tam mă mơ̆t tơ pơlei ôh. Sư oei 'bơ̆t jih pơlei đêl anih Mathê tơ'bơ̆p Sư hei.

English: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and comforting her, when they saw that Mary rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mă năm hơpong kơ bre Mathê, lu sư oei lăm hnam ei mơ̆n. Lăp lu sư 'bôh Mari iung năm tơkan tơ Yêsu, lu sư iung kiơ̆ hloi. Lu sư ngêh kơ Mari năm nhơ̆m tơ bơsat.

English: Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”
Bahnar: Mari năm truh tơ anih Yêsu na 'bôh hloi Sư. Mari bon hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Sư kơkuh kơ Sư păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok, dah Ih tơ âu ki lei 'nhŏng inh huay kơ lôch ôh.”

English: Therefore, when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh Mari oei hmoi ơh păng lu bơngai Juđê mă năm hơpong kơ sư kư̆m nhơ̆m hmoi mơ̆n na Yêsu sơ'ngon tơpă.

English: And He said, “Where have you laid him?” They said to Him, “Lord, come and see.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet: “Iĕm 'bŭ sư tơ yơ?” Lu sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, bĕ bơ̆n năm lăng.”

English: Jesus wept.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu kư̆m nhơ̆m hmoi mơ̆n.

English: Then the Jews said, “See how He loved him!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu bơngai Juđê khan: “Yêsu 'mêm kơ Lasarơ tơpă.”

English: And some of them said, “Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind, also have kept this man from dying?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “'Bok âu pơklaih bơngai măt tol gơh 'bôh hơdah, na ki dah Sư wă pơklaih lei Lasarơ huay kơ lôch ôh iih?”

English: Then Jesus, again groaning in Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
Bahnar: Yêsu rai sơ'ngon. Lu sư năm truh tơ bơsat boih. Bơsat ei lăm tơmo hơgơp, tơnglơ̆p sư păng tơmo mơ̆n đơ̆p 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsat.

English: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Pơih tơnglơ̆p 'măng tơmo âu bĕ.” Na Mathê oh bơngai mă lôch ei sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, dah bơ̆n pơih tơnglơ̆p tơmo âu dang ei bơ̆n 'bâu ôm dêh, kơlih nhôn 'bŭ sư đei pêng măng boih.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say to you that if you would believe you would see the glory of God?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh khan kơ ih boih, dah ih lui ih gô 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơih tơnglơ̆p tơmo ei. Na Yêsu ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư: “Ơ 'Bă, Inh bơnê kơ Ih kơlih kơ Ih mơ̆ng Inh krao khan kơ Ih boih.

English: And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me.”
Bahnar: Inh băt Ih mơ̆ng Inh ling-lang mơ̆n, mă-lei Inh khan thoi noh wă kơ lu bơngai mă oei tăp dăr kơ Inh kơtơ̆ng na lu sư gô lui kơ Ih wơh Inh.”

English: Now when He had said these things, He cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come forth!”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Lasarơ, iung đơ̆ng bơsat bĕ, lĕch tơ 'ngoaih âu.”

English: And he who had died came out bound hand and foot with graveclothes, and his face was wrapped with a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Loose him, and let him go.”
Bahnar: Lasarơ mă lôch ei iung đơ̆ng bơsat lĕch hloi tơ 'ngoaih. Mă-lei jơ̆ng ti muh măt sư đêl đe chôm pơ̆n păng che oei oei 'bơ̆t akâu sư. Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Yaih che đơ̆ng akâu sư bĕ wă kơ sư jah wih tơ hnam.”

English: Then many of the Jews who had come to Mary, and had seen the things Jesus did, believed in Him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mă kiơ̆ Mari hei, lu sư 'bôh Yêsu tơiung arih Lasarơ na đei lơ mơ̆n lu sư lui kơ Yêsu.

English: But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them the things Jesus did.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu buăl sư mơ'nah năm roi kơ lu bơngai Pharisi Yêsu tơiung arih Lasarơ.

English: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council and said, “What shall we do? For this Man works many signs.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu 'bok soi tih krao akŭm lu kră sek tơlang. Akŭm boih lu sư khan: “Bơ̆n wă pơm thoi yơ kơ Yêsu, yua kơ Sư gơh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang.

English: If we let Him alone like this, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n ưh kơ khă Sư lei đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla gô lui kơ Sư na pôk Sư pơm tih. Kơlih kơ thoi noh na lu bơngai Rôm gô hil na tŏk tơgar iŏk hnam akŭm tơm bơ̆n păng teh đak bơ̆n đĭ hloi.”

English: And one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all
Bahnar: Hơtai ei sơ̆ đei minh 'nu 'bok anăn sư Kaiphe. Sơnăm noh sơ̆ sư pơm 'bok soi tơm. Sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na sư khan: “Iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơpă lah iih tơdrong noh.

English: nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, and not that the whole nation should perish.”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai lôch tang lu bơngai Juđê bơ̆n, thoi noh na teh đak bơ̆n huay kơ hiong, thoi noh yơh trŏ. Liơ iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong 'noh?”

English: Now this he did not say on his own authority; but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation
Bahnar: 'Bok Kaiphe pơma tơdrong 'noh ưh kơ sĭ sư pơma kiơ̆ kơ đon sư tơchĕng ôh. Sơnăm noh sơ̆ sư pơm 'bok soi tơm, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư pơma khan lê̆ hơdrol gah Yêsu wă lôch tang lu bơngai Juđê.

English: and not for that nation only, but also that He would gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă ưh kơ sĭ Sư lôch tang lu bơngai Juđê đĕch ôh. Sư lôch tang đĭ-đăng dôm lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei oei jơ̆p-jang ala teh âu.

English: Then, from that day on, they plotted to put Him to death.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr 'noh boih lu sư chă đon wă pơlôch Yêsu.

English: Therefore Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim, and there remained with His disciples.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Yêsu ưh pă wă năm trong 'ngoaih tơ'bôh akâu Sư tơ lăm dêh Juđê dơ̆ng boih. Sư năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ jih glă. Tơ ei Sư oei tơ Pơlei Êpraim hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư.

English: And the Passover of the Jews was near, and many went from the country up to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei Năr Giĕng Năm Brih đe Juđê wă jê̆ truh boih, na lơ bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng pơlei nai năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơdrol kơ năr giĕng ei. Lu sư năm tơ lu 'bok soi wă pơm rơgoh kơdih tơdrong yoch hơdrol kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih ei.

English: Then they sought Jesus, and spoke among themselves as they stood in the temple, “What do you think—that He will not come to the feast?”
Bahnar: Lu sư chă Yêsu. Lu sư oei ngôi tơ cham hnam akŭm tơm păng jet dih băl: “Iĕm tơchĕng thoi yơ? Rŏ lăng Sư ưh kơ wă năm tơ âu ôh iih?”

English: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command, that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih păng lu bơngai Pharisi pơkă khan: “Bơngai bu băt kơ Sư oei tơ yơ, 'bôh Sư tơ yơ, bơngai 'noh athei roi kơ nhôn wă kơ nhôn năm rôp.”

English: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu năr hơdrol kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih ei, na Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Bethani. Pơlei ei pơlei Lasarơ mă Yêsu tơiung arih sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
Bahnar: Na đe hơmet tơmam sŏng sa kơ Sư. Mathê awih awăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa. Lasarơ kư̆m sŏng sa hơdai păng Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: Then Mary took a pound of very costly oil of spikenard, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
Bahnar: Mari chĕp minh gŏl đak pơgang 'bâu phu. Pơgang ei đe gĭt tơpă dang minh puăt kilô. Na Mari tuh 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu; sư sut jơ̆ng Yêsu hăm sŏk sư kơdih na pơgang ei 'bâu jơ̆p-jang lăm hnam.

English: But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who would betray Him, said
Bahnar: Na Juđa đơ̆ng Pơlei Ikariôt bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu mơ̆n, mă sư wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, sư khan

English: “Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
Bahnar: “Pơgang 'bâu phu âu kăp pêng-hrĕng hlak jên hu. Lơliơ sư ưh kơ wă tĕch chă jên asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin?”

English: This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money box; and he used to take what was put in it.
Bahnar: Juđa khan thoi noh ưh kơ sĭ sư mơnat kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin tơpă ôh. Sư bơngai wei kơdŭng jên tơpôl lu sư păng sư bơngai tơtông mơ̆n. Phŏ phŏ sư tơtông iŏk jên đơ̆ng kơdŭng ei.

English: But Jesus said, “Let her alone; she has kept this for the day of My burial.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ Juđa, lê̆ sư pơm thoi noh boih, yua kơ hơdrol kơ Inh wă lôch na sư tuh pơgang 'bâu phu thoi đe tuh kơ bơngai lôch kơplah đe wă 'bŭ hmă.

English: For the poor you have with you always, but Me you do not have always.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai dơnuh hin sư oei hơdai hăm iĕm ling-lang tơ ala teh âu, mă-lei Inh âu ưh kơ oei hơdai hăm iĕm ling-lang ôh.”

English: Now a great many of the Jews knew that He was there; and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lơ bơngai Juđê kơtơ̆ng ang khan Yêsu oei tơ Pơlei Bethani, na lu sư năm tơ ei. Lu sư năm tơ ei wă kơ 'bôh Yêsu păng wă kơ 'bôh akâu Lasarơ mă Yêsu tơiung arih sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: But the chief priests plotted to put Lazarus to death also
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih chă đon wă pơlôch Lasarơ mơ̆n

English: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
Bahnar: kơlih đơ̆ng sư na đei lơ bơngai Juđê achăng lê̆ lu kră sư, na lui kiơ̆ gah Yêsu.

English: The next day a great multitude that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng, lu bơngai tơpôl lơ mă đêl năm hơpong Năr Giĕng Năm Brih, lu sư kơtơ̆ng ang Yêsu wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him, and cried out: “Hosanna! ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’ The King of Israel!”
Bahnar: Lu sư pĕch iŏk dơng hla gao na năm đih sơng Sư. Lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Hôsana, bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơnê kơ Yêsu Pơtao Isơrael truh tơ bơ̆n yua kơ Kră Yang wơh.”

English: Then Jesus, when He had found a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written
Bahnar: Yêsu iŏk minh pôm aseh iĕ dăm na hao hloi aseh iĕ ei. 'Noh trŏ thoi đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “Fear not, daughter of Zion; Behold, your King is coming, Sitting on a donkey’s colt.”
Bahnar: “Ơ kon pơlei pơla Jêrusalem, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, yua kơ Pơtao iĕm wă mơ̆t tơ pơlei iĕm, Sư hao minh pôm aseh iĕ dăm.”

English: His disciples did not understand these things at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about Him and that they had done these things to Him.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ưh kơ tơchĕng tơdrong âu pơma roi gah tơdrong Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yêsu lôch iung arih tŏk tơ plĕnh lu sư 'blŏk hơdơ̆r tơdrong đe chih noh. Na lu sư băt boih tơdrong noh roi kơ Sư mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Therefore the people, who were with Him when He called Lazarus out of his tomb and raised him from the dead, bore witness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă oei hơdai păng Yêsu ki, lu sư 'bôh Yêsu tơiung arih Lasarơ đơ̆ng bơsat, na lu sư kư̆m ư-ang roi tơdrong noh kơ bôl buăl nai mơ̆n.

English: For this reason the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this sign.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong Yêsu pơm mơsêh mơyang thoi noh, kơlih thoi noh na lu sư đih sơng Yêsu kơplah Sư wă mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “You see that you are accomplishing nothing. Look, the world has gone after Him!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih, na lu bơngai Pharisi ơh klai. Lu sư pơma khan dih băl: “Iĕm lăng, ưh pă jei bơ̆n tơpă boih; dang ei đĭ-đăng kon bơngai kiơ̆ Sư ngăl.”

English: Now there were certain Greeks among those who came up to worship at the feast.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai Grĕk năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơpong kơ năr giĕng ei păng mơ̆t kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then they came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus.”
Bahnar: Lu đe ei năm tơ Philip bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei 'Betsaiđa lăm dêh Galilê. Lu sư năm apinh Philip: “Ơ 'bok, nhôn wă tơ'bơ̆p Yêsu.”

English: Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
Bahnar: Philip năm khan kơ Andrê, na bre sư năm khan kơ Yêsu.

English: But Jesus answered them, saying, “The hour has come that the Son of Man should be glorified.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơma hloi gah tơdrong Sư wă lôch iung arih thoi âu: “Dang ei trŏ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơư pơang Inh Kon Bơngai tơpă boih.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it produces much grain.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah bơ̆n 'măn lê̆ adrĕch 'ba lăm kŭ ling-lang, sư ưh kơ chăt đei plei dơ̆ng ôh. Mă-lei dah bơ̆n rei sư tơ teh, bơ̆n lăng nhen lôch hiong, mă-lei găr lăm to sư gô chăt păng gô đei plei trem.

English: He who loves his life will lose it, and he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ akâu sư kơdih, akâu sư 'noh gô hiong. Mă-lei bơngai bu ưh kơ 'mêm kơ akâu sư kơdih ala teh âu, sư 'noh gô arih ling-lang hơdai păng 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: If anyone serves Me, let him follow Me; and where I am, there My servant will be also. If anyone serves Me, him My Father will honor.
Bahnar: Bơngai lui jang tơdrong Inh, sư 'noh athei lui kiơ̆ Inh mă tơpă. Bơngai lui jang tơdrong Inh, sư 'noh gô oei hơdai hăm Inh ling-lang păng 'Bă Inh gô ăn kơ sư tơdrong apah.”

English: “Now My soul is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But for this purpose I came to this hour.
Bahnar: “Dang ei jơhngơ̆m Inh sơ'ngon 'biơ̆, na Inh wă pơma lơliơ? Dah Inh khan: ‘Ơ 'Bă, apinh Ih 'nĕ ăn tơdrong anat anot âu truh tơ Inh,’ lei ưh kơ trŏ ôh, kơlih kơ 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Inh jur tơ teh âu wă kơ Inh pŭ tơdrong anat anot âu boih.

English: Father, glorify Your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.”
Bahnar: Ơ 'Bă, Inh wă kơ Ih pơư pơang anăn Ih bĕ.” Na đei hloi 'bơ̆r tơl đơ̆ng plĕnh ti khan thoi âu: “Inh pơư pơang anăn Inh boih păng Inh gô pơư pơang anăn Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: Therefore the people who stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl oei 'bơ̆t ei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'noh, lu mơ'nah khan grơ̆m, lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma păng Yêsu.

English: Jesus answered and said, “This voice did not come because of Me, but for your sake.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Bơ̆r Sư pơma thoi noh ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ Inh ôh, yua kơ iĕm, wă kơ iĕm băt kơ Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be cast out.
Bahnar: Dang ei 'Bă Inh wă sek tơlang tơ ala teh âu, Sư pơpuh yang Satan mă pơgơ̆r teh âu.

English: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all peoples to Myself.”
Bahnar: Lăp đe atol Inh na Inh gô dui iŏk đĭ-đăng bơngai năm tơ Inh ngăl.”

English: This He said, signifying by what death He would die.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi noh wă kơ lu đe ei băt kơ Sư lôch thoi yơ.

English: The people answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever; and how can You say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl lơ ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Nhôn đŏk lăng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: 'Bok Krist arih ling-lang ưh kơ layơ lôch. Na Ih khan đe gô atol pơlôch Kon Bơngai tơ 'long pơglang. Kon Bơngai ei bu? Ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Krist hă?”

English: Then Jesus said to them, “A little while longer the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you; he who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư gah akâu Sư kơdih: “Măt 'năr oei pơchrang tơ'bôh ăn kơ iĕm ưh pă đunh boih. Na iĕm athei dah lui kơ Inh dang ei kơplah Inh oei tơ âu, hli kơ măng mu klơ̆p măt iĕm; yua kơ bơngai bu nơnăm lăm măng mu, bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ 'bôh trong.

English: While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become sons of light.” These things Jesus spoke, and departed, and was hidden from them.
Bahnar: Na Inh âu boih tơdrong hơdah pơchrang ăn kơ iĕm, na iĕm jah lui kơ Inh bĕ, na iĕm oei lăm tơdrong hơdah ling-lang.” Đang Sư bơtho thoi noh boih na Sư weh ôn tơ anih nai.

English: But although He had done so many signs before them, they did not believe in Him
Bahnar: Yêsu pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Sư.

English: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke: “Lord, who has believed our report? And to whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?”
Bahnar: 'Noh 'blep trŏ tơpă thoi Êsai chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, đe ưh kơ lui kơ tơdrong nhôn bơtho; păng đe ưh kơ lui kơ mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng ti Ih pơm.”

English: Therefore they could not believe, because Isaiah said again
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ lui kơlih kơ Êsai đei khan lê̆ thoi âu

English: “He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, Lest they should see with their eyes, Lest they should understand with their hearts and turn, So that I should heal them.”
Bahnar: “Inh Kră Yang ăn măt lu sư jing tol, păng ăn kơ lu sư arăng kơ̆l, wă kơ măt lu sư ưh kơ gơh 'bôh, păng đon lu sư ưh kơ hlôh. Kơlih kơ thoi noh na lu sư ưh kơ wă wih tơ Inh, wă kơ Inh pơklaih tơdrong yoch lu sư.”

English: These things Isaiah said when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.
Bahnar: Êsai khan thoi noh kơlih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh kơ sư 'Bok Krist sơ̆, Sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơpă, na Êsai chih roi tơdrong 'Bok Krist.

English: Nevertheless even among the rulers many believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m đei lơ mơ̆n lu kră pơm tih lăm dêh Juđê lui kơ Yêsu. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ roi kơ đe tơdrong sư lui ôh, kơlih kơ lu sư hli kơ lu bơngai Pharisi băt kơ lu sư lui, na bơngai Pharisi ưh kơ ăn mơ̆t akŭm lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
Bahnar: Lu kră ei wă kơ lu bôl buăl sư lăp đon kơ lu sư hloh kơ lu sư wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ lu sư.

English: Then Jesus cried out and said, “He who believes in Me, believes not in Me but in Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu bơtho 'bơ̆r re khan: “Bơngai bu lui kơ Inh, ưh kơ sĭ sư lui kơ Inh đĕch ôh, sư kư̆m lui kơ 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh.

English: And he who sees Me sees Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: Păng bơngai bu 'bôh Inh, sư dang 'bôh 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh mơ̆n.

English: I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in Me should not abide in darkness.
Bahnar: Inh jur tơ ala teh âu wă pơchrang hơdah kơ kon bơngai, na đĭ-đăng bơngai mă lui kơ Inh huay kơ oei lăm măng mu ôh.

English: And if anyone hears My words and does not believe, I do not judge him; for I did not come to judge the world but to save the world.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh bơtho, mă-lei sư ưh kơ lui, bơngai 'noh Inh ưh kơ sek tơlang sư ôh; kơlih kơ Inh jur tơ ala teh âu ưh kơ sĭ wă sek tơlang kon bơngai ôh. Inh jur tơ ala teh âu wă pơklaih kon bơngai yoch.

English: He who rejects Me, and does not receive My words, has that which judges him—the word that I have spoken will judge him in the last day.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak sư năr tôch ning-mônh, yua kơ sư ưh kơ răk dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho.

English: For I have not spoken on My own authority; but the Father who sent Me gave Me a command, what I should say and what I should speak.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ưh kơ sĭ Inh bơtho tơdrong Inh kơdih ôh. 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh, Sư pơkă kơ Inh bơtho thoi yơ, na Inh bơtho thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: And I know that His command is everlasting life. Therefore, whatever I speak, just as the Father has told Me, so I speak.”
Bahnar: Inh băt tơdrong Sư pơkă ăn kơ kon bơngai noh gô ăn kon bơngai arih ling-lang. Dôm tơdrong Inh bơtho đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh ngăl.”

English: Now before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come that He should depart from this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.
Bahnar: Năr ei minh năr hơdrol kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih. Yêsu băt năr Sư wă jăk đơ̆ng ala teh âu tŏk brŏk tơ 'Bă Sư wă jê̆ truh boih. Sư 'mêm tơpă kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Sư, na Sư khŏm ăn akâu Sư lôch tang bơ̆n.

English: And supper being ended, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him
Bahnar: Yêsu hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư sŏng sa hơdai. Yang Satan pơhlŭ Juđa Ikariôt, kon Simôn, na Juđa wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu boih.

English: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ 'Bă Sư ăn kơ Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong. Păng Sư băt Sư kơdih jur đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei păng wă tŏk tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dơ̆ng.

English: rose from supper and laid aside His garments, took a towel and girded Himself.
Bahnar: Na kơplah noh Yêsu iung plôh ao 'ngoaih Sư păng iŏk kơn chô̆ 'bơ̆t rơhiĕo Sư kơdih.

English: After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel with which He was girded.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sư tuh đak lăm kơthao na ôp jơ̆ng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, na sut păng kơn mă đêl Sư chô̆ 'bơ̆t rơhiĕo Sư noh.

English: Then He came to Simon Peter. And Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You washing my feet?”
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ Pêtrôs, Pêtrôs jet Sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih wă ôp kiơ kơ jơ̆ng inh?”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will know after this.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Dang ei ih ưh kơ băt Inh wă pơm kơ kiơ, kơnh ih gô băt.”

English: Peter said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan: “Inh ưh kơ hơnhŏ Ih ôp jơ̆ng inh na inh ưh kơ layơ ăn Ih ôp jơ̆ng ôh.” Yêsu khan: “Dah Inh ưh kơ ôp jơ̆ng ih, lei ih ưh pă pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Inh boih.”

English: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ 'Bok, lei ưh kơ sĭ Ih ôp jơ̆ng inh đĕch ôh, Ih ôp tôm kơ jơ̆ng ti muh măt inh hloi.”

English: Jesus said to him, “He who is bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean; and you are clean, but not all of you.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Bơngai bu hum boih, bơngai 'noh sư rơgoh đĭ boih. Sư ưh pă kăl ôp ti 'nhao muh măt sư dơ̆ng ôh. Sư kăl pôm ôp jơ̆ng sư đĕch. Đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm rơgoh ngăl boih, pă minh 'nu ưh kơ rơgoh.”

English: For He knew who would betray Him; therefore He said, “You are not all clean.”
Bahnar: Yêsu băt boih gah bơngai wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư. Kơlih kơ thoi noh Sư khan: “Pă minh 'nu ưh kơ rơgoh.”

English: So when He had washed their feet, taken His garments, and sat down again, He said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?
Bahnar: Sư ôp tôm kơ jơ̆ng lu sư boih, na Sư iŏk hrŭk ao 'ngoaih Sư, na wih tơ anih Sư. Lăm anih Sư ei Sư jet lu đe ei: “Iĕm hăm hlôh Inh pơm kiơ kơ iĕm thoi noh hei?

English: You call Me Teacher and Lord, and you say well, for so I am.
Bahnar: Iĕm krao Inh 'Bok Thây iĕm păng Yŏng iĕm. Iĕm krao Inh thoi noh bưh mơ̆n yua kơ Inh 'Bok Thây iĕm păng Yŏng iĕm tơpă.

English: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
Bahnar: Inh 'Bok Thây iĕm păng Yŏng iĕm, mă-lei Inh ôp jơ̆ng iĕm dang Inh pơm đĭch iĕm đĕch, mă iĕm athei ôp dih băl jơ̆ng iĕm.

English: For I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you.
Bahnar: Inh ôp jơ̆ng iĕm noh, Inh pơm tơ'bôh kơ iĕm hơdrol wă kơ iĕm pơm kiơ̆ dih băl thoi noh.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master; nor is he who is sent greater than he who sent him.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, đĭch ưh kơ lah tih hloh kơ yŏng sư. Bơngai mă đe wơh, ưh kơ lah tih hloh kơ bơngai wơh sư.

English: If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm băt boih tơdrong 'noh, yua kơ Inh bơtho. Dah iĕm răk tơdrong 'noh lei iĕm gô hiôk chơt tơduă iĕm tơpă.

English: “I do not speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen; but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.’
Bahnar: “Inh pơma tơdrong noh, ưh kơ pơma tôm kơ lu iĕm ôh, yua kơ Inh băt lê̆ hơdrol boih dôm lu bơngai mă Inh rơih. Na lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Đei minh 'nu bơngai sŏng sa hơdai păng Inh, sư wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Inh.’ Yua kơ chih lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei, na dang ei bơ̆n gô 'bôh tơpă.

English: Now I tell you before it comes, that when it does come to pass, you may believe that I am He.
Bahnar: Inh roi kơ iĕm tơdrong sư âu hơdrol kơ sư wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Inh, wă kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh Kră Yang tơpă.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives Me; and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă wă kơ iĕm băt: Bơngai bu sơng iŏk bơngai mă Inh wơh, bơngai 'noh dang sơng iŏk Inh. Bơngai bu sơng iŏk Inh, noh dang sư sơng iŏk 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh.”

English: When Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, “Most assuredly, I say to you, one of you will betray Me.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yêsu roi tơdrong 'noh Sư sơ'ngon tơpă na Sư pơma hơdah hloi gah tơdrong 'noh. Sư khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, đei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Inh.”

English: Then the disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom He spoke.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm Sư chă hue lăng dih băl. Lu sư sơleng kơ đon ưh kơ băt bu wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư.

English: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư mă Sư 'mêm kơeng tơpă, sư oei jê̆ Yêsu.

English: Simon Peter therefore motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs jet bơngai ei khan: “Yêsu khan ei bu wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư?”

English: Then, leaning back on Jesus’ breast, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai ei rĭ jê̆ Yêsu na pơma jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, bu wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Ih ei?”

English: Jesus answered, “It is he to whom I shall give a piece of bread when I have dipped it.” And having dipped the bread, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Dang ei Inh iŏk 'bĕng mi djrŭ lăm đak 'nhĕm na ăn, bơngai bu iŏk, bơngai ei boih plơ̆ plĕch kơ Inh.” Na Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi djrŭ lăm đak 'nhĕm ăn kơ Juđa kon Simôn Ikariôt iŏk.

English: Now after the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you do, do quickly.”
Bahnar: Lăp Juđa iŏk 'bĕng mi ei yang Satan mơ̆t lăm jơhngơ̆m sư hloi. Na Yêsu khan kơ Juđa: “Ih jah năm wăi, na ih jah pơm tơdrong ih wă pơm.”

English: But no one at the table knew for what reason He said this to him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu oei sŏng sa hơdai hăm Sư tơ ei ưh kơ hlôh Yêsu khan kơ Juđa tơdrong kiơ.

English: For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus had said to him, “Buy those things we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Juđa wei-lăng kơdŭng jên lu sư, na lu mơ'nah ngêh kơ Yêsu khan kơ sư năm răt tơmam sa, hiă wă sa lăm năr giĕng ei thâu, dah mơnat ăn kơ bơngai dơnuh kơlĕ.

English: Having received the piece of bread, he then went out immediately. And it was night.
Bahnar: Juđa iŏk 'bĕng mi ei na lĕch hloi tơ 'ngoaih. Kơplah ei măng mu yua kơ 'năr mơ̆t boih.

English: So, when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in Him.
