Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Juđa lĕch na Yêsu khan: “Inh băt kơ dang ei đe gô ư-ang Inh Kon Bơngai. Hăm đe gô ư-ang kơ 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Inh lôch tang kon bơngai.

English: If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself, and glorify Him immediately.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ đe ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Inh lôch tang kon bơngai, na 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ đe ư-ang Inh Kon Bơngai. Sư wă ăn kơ đe ư-ang Inh dang ei boih.

English: Little children, I shall be with you a little while longer. You will seek Me; and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come,’ so now I say to you.
Bahnar: “Ơ tơpôl lu dăm, Inh oei hơdai hăm iĕm ưh pă đunh boih. Iĕm gô chă Inh; kư̆m thoi Inh khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê ki, lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh truh tơ anih Inh ôh.

English: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh wă pơkă ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'nao âu: Inh wă kơ iĕm băt 'mêm mơnat dih băl. Iĕm athei băt 'mêm mơnat dih băl kư̆m thoi Inh 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm.

English: By this all will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.”
Bahnar: Dah iĕm đei đon 'mêm mơnat dih băl, lei đĭ-đăng bơngai băt kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh.”

English: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered him, “Where I am going you cannot follow Me now, but you shall follow Me afterward.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs jet Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih wă năm tơ yơ?” Yêsu khan: “Mă Inh năm tơ yơ, dang ei ih ưh kơ gơh kiơ̆ Inh ôh; gô ning-mônh ih gơh kiơ̆.”

English: Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs jet Sư: “Kơlih kơ kiơ inh ưh kơ gơh kiơ̆ Ih dang ei? Inh chu lôch kiơ̆ Ih.”

English: Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Most assuredly, I say to you, the rooster shall not crow till you have denied Me three times.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ih khan wă chu lôch kiơ̆ Inh hă? Inh khan kơ Ih tơpă, hơdrol kơ iĕr ŏ pơgê dơning, ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng, ih khan ih ưh kơ băt kơ Inh.”

English: “Let not your heart be troubled; you believe in God, believe also in Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei pơma kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Na dang ei iĕm athei chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli tơdrong kiơ. Iĕm adrin lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lui kơ Inh.

English: In My Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
Bahnar: Tơ hnam 'Bă Inh đei lơ anih oei tơpă. Dah ưh kơ đei Inh kư̆m khan ưh kơ đei mơ̆n. Na dang ei Inh wă năm hơmet kơ iĕm anih.

English: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to Myself; that where I am, there you may be also.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Inh năm hơmet kơ iĕm anih oei, Inh gô jur tơ âu dơ̆ng, Inh wă anhăk ba iĕm tơ anih Inh; na iĕm oei hơdai hăm Inh ling-lang tơ ei.

English: And where I go you know, and the way you know.”
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n chă trong năm tơ anih Inh.”

English: Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going, and how can we know the way?”
Bahnar: Na Thôm khan: “Ơ 'Bok, nhôn ưh kơ băt Ih năm tơ yơ, thoi yơ nhôn gơh chă trong năm tơ Ih?”

English: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh boih trong iĕm năm tŏk tơ 'Bă Inh, hăm Inh boih tơhlôh ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong Sư păng Inh gơh ăn kơ kon bơngai arih. Bơngai bu ưh kơ năm trong Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ truh tơ 'Bă Inh ôh.

English: “If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also; and from now on you know Him and have seen Him.”
Bahnar: Dah iĕm băt kơ Inh, iĕm kư̆m băt kơ 'Bă Inh mơ̆n. Đơ̆ng dang ei hloi iĕm băt kơ Sư păng iĕm 'bôh Sư.”

English: Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is sufficient for us.”
Bahnar: Philip khan: “Ơ 'Bok, tơ'bôh kơ nhôn 'Bă Ih bĕ, dôm noh boih nhôn wă.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you so long, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? He who has seen Me has seen the Father; so how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ Philip, Inh oei păng lu iĕm đunh boih, lơliơ ih tam băt kơ Inh. Bơngai bu 'bôh Inh boih, bơngai 'noh dang 'bôh 'Bă Inh mơ̆n. Na lơliơ ih khan: ‘Tơ'bôh kơ nhôn 'Bă Ih bĕ, dôm noh boih nhôn wă’?

English: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in Me? The words that I speak to you I do not speak on My own authority; but the Father who dwells in Me does the works.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ lui ôh hă 'Bă Inh oei lăm Inh, nhi 'Bă Inh minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon? Dôm nơ̆r Inh pơma bơtho ăn kơ iĕm ưh kơ sĭ lĕch đơ̆ng Inh kơdih ôh. Dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Inh pơm ăn kơ lu iĕm 'noh lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh mă oei lăm Inh tơpă.

English: Believe Me that I am in the Father and the Father in Me, or else believe Me for the sake of the works themselves.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ iĕm lui kơ 'Bă Inh oei lăm Inh, nhi 'Bă Inh minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon. Dah iĕm ưh kơ lui, khan nơ̆r Inh pơma đĕch, lei iĕm athei lui kơ dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang mă đêl Inh pơm.

English: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me, the works that I do he will do also; and greater works than these he will do, because I go to My Father.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu lui kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh gô pơm dôm tơdrong Inh pơm mơ̆n. Păng sư gô pơm tơdrong tih hloh kơ Inh dơ̆ng mơ̆n, kơlih kơ Inh wă wih tơ 'Bă Inh boih.

English: And whatever you ask in My name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong iĕm apinh Inh, dah iĕm krao wơ̆n păng anăn Inh wă kơ Inh ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong kiơ Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm tơpă, wă kơ đe ư-ang 'Bă Inh, yua kơ đe 'bôh Inh Kon Sư ăn kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong iĕm apinh.

English: If you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm krao wơ̆n păng anăn Inh, iĕm apinh Inh wă tơdrong kiơ, Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm tơpă ưh kơ jor ôh.

English: “If you love Me, keep My commandments.
Bahnar: “Dah iĕm 'mêm kơ Inh, lei iĕm chu dôm tơdrong Inh pơkă hŏ

English: And I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Helper, that He may abide with you forever
Bahnar: na Inh gô apinh 'Bă Inh ăn kơ iĕm minh 'nu dŏng iĕm plơ̆ng dơ̆ng, anăn Sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Sư gô tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bă Inh tơpă păng Sư gô oei hơdai hăm iĕm ling-lang.

English: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees Him nor knows Him; but you know Him, for He dwells with you and will be in you.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei ala teh âu mă ưh kơ lui, lu sư ưh kơ gơh sơng iŏk Sư ôh, kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ gơh 'bôh Sư păng ưh kơ băt kơ Sư. Mă-lei iĕm, iĕm băt kơ Sư, kơlih kơ Sư oei păng iĕm, Sư kư̆m gô oei lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm mơ̆n.

English: I will not leave you orphans; I will come to you.
Bahnar: “Inh ưh kơ tŭk iĕm thoi kon mơti ôh. Inh gô jur tơ iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: “A little while longer and the world will see Me no more, but you will see Me. Because I live, you will live also.
Bahnar: Pă 'biơ̆ dơ̆ng lu bơngai tơ ala teh âu ưh pă 'bôh Inh boih. Pôm lu iĕm đĕch 'bôh Inh. Inh gô oei hơdai hăm 'Bă Inh arih ling-lang, lu iĕm gô arih ling-lang thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: At that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you.
Bahnar: Lăp Inh iung arih boih, noh iĕm gô băt kơ Inh minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hăm 'Bă Inh tơpă păng lu iĕm minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hăm Inh yua kơ Inh oei lăm iĕm tơpă.

English: He who has My commandments and keeps them, it is he who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and manifest Myself to him.”
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu răk dôm tơdrong Inh pơkă, bơngai 'noh boih 'mêm kơ Inh tơpă. Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ Inh, 'Bă Inh kư̆m 'mêm kơ sư mơ̆n; păng Inh kư̆m 'mêm kơ sư na Inh tơbăt kơ sư akâu Inh.”

English: Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, how is it that You will manifest Yourself to us, and not to the world?”
Bahnar: Juđa mă ưh kơ sĭ Juđa Ikariôt sư jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, kơlih kơ kiơ Ih tơbăt kơ nhôn akâu Ih, mă lu bơngai ala teh âu Ih ưh kơ tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư?”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “If anyone loves Me, he will keep My word; and My Father will love him, and We will come to him and make Our home with him.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh sư gô lui yom kơ tơdrong Inh bơtho. 'Bă Inh 'mêm kơ sư, na nhi 'Bă Inh jur oei hăm sư.

English: He who does not love Me does not keep My words; and the word which you hear is not Mine but the Father’s who sent Me.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ 'mêm kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ răk nơ̆r Inh. Dôm nơ̆r iĕm kơtơ̆ng Inh bơtho ưh kơ sĭ lĕch đơ̆ng Inh kơdih ôh, mă-lei lĕch đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh.

English: “These things I have spoken to you while being present with you.
Bahnar: “Kơplah Inh oei păng iĕm dang ei, Inh athei roi ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong 'noh.

English: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, He will teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all things that I said to you.
Bahnar: 'Bok Dŏng iĕm ei, anăn Sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, Sư 'noh 'Bă Inh wă wơh Sư jur oei păng iĕm jang tang Inh. Sư gô bơtho iĕm tôm tơdrong păng Sư gô tơ'blŏk ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong mă Inh bơtho iĕm boih.

English: Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you; not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
Bahnar: “Inh wă tơklah đơ̆ng iĕm na Inh ăn kơ iĕm jơhngơ̆m hiôk. Jơhngơ̆m Inh hiôk dang yơ, Inh ăn kơ iĕm hiôk dang noh mơ̆n. Inh ăn kơ iĕm hiôk ưh kơ thoi lu bơngai ala teh ăn kơ iĕm hiôk ôh. Iĕm 'nĕ sơ'ngon păng 'nĕ kơ hli.

English: You have heard Me say to you, ‘I am going away and coming back to you.’ If you loved Me, you would rejoice because I said, ‘I am going to the Father,’ for My Father is greater than I.
Bahnar: Iĕm kơtơ̆ng Inh khan kơ iĕm, khan Inh gô jăk đơ̆ng iĕm păng gô wih dơ̆ng tơ iĕm. Dah iĕm 'mêm kơ Inh tơpă, lei iĕm kư̆m hiôk chơt tơduă iĕm mơ̆n, yua Inh khan Inh wă tŏk tơ 'Bă Inh păng yua kơ Sư tih hloh kơ Inh.

English: “And now I have told you before it comes, that when it does come to pass, you may believe.
Bahnar: Inh roi lê̆ kơ iĕm hơdrol tơdrong 'noh dang ei, na lăp iĕm 'bôh tơdrong 'noh ning-mônh, iĕm gô lui kơ Inh tơpă.

English: I will no longer talk much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming, and he has nothing in Me.
Bahnar: Dang ei Inh oei pơma dơnuh păng iĕm ưh pă đunh boih, kơlih kơ yang Satan kră pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu wă truh boih. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ kĕ pơgŏ Inh pơm tơdrong kiơ ôh.

English: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave Me commandment, so I do. Arise, let us go from here.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ kon bơngai ala teh âu băt kơ Inh 'mêm kơ 'Bă Inh. Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Inh khŏm pơm kiơ̆ kơ Sư pơkă kơ Inh. “Na dang ei bĕ bơ̆n jah weh đơ̆ng anih âu.”

English: “I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh âu boih thoi lĕ tơm 'long hơmu, na 'Bă Inh thoi lĕ bơngai pơtăm.

English: Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit.
Bahnar: Na dôm lu bơngai lui kơ Inh thoi lĕ dơng, tơ'bla, sơdrai mă chăt đơ̆ng Inh. Dơng mơ'nah ưh kơ đei plei, 'Bă Inh chre tŭk. Đei dơng mơ'nah plei mơ̆n, mă ưh kơ trem, Sư sơleh tŭk lu tơ'bla iĕ, wă kơ sư plei trem păng plei tih.

English: You are already clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm thoi lĕ dơng 'long mă chăt 'lơ̆ng boih, kơlih kơ iĕm mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho.

English: Abide in Me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in Me.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei oei kơjăp lăm Inh khŏm khŏm, mă Inh kư̆m oei lăm iĕm mơ̆n. Dah iĕm ưh kơ oei lăm Inh, iĕm ưh kơ đei plei ôh, kư̆m thoi lĕ kơ dơng mă ưh kơ đei tơm thoi yơ sư gơh đei plei?

English: “I am the vine, you are the branches. He who abides in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit; for without Me you can do nothing.
Bahnar: “Thoi noh na Inh wă roi kơ iĕm mă nhên dơ̆ng: Inh thoi lĕ kơ tơm 'long, iĕm thoi lĕ kơ dơng, tơ'bla, sơdrai. Bơngai bu oei kơjăp lăm Inh, Inh oei lăm sư mơ̆n, bơngai 'noh sư gô đei plei trem. Dah ưh kơ đei Inh, iĕm ưh kơ gơh pơm kiơ ôh.

English: If anyone does not abide in Me, he is cast out as a branch and is withered; and they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ oei lăm Inh, 'Bă Inh gô tŭk lê̆ sư, kư̆m thoi đe tŭk dơng 'long, na dơng 'noh jing kro. Klaih kơ noh đe dônh lu dơng kro noh klơ̆m tŭk lăm ŭnh, na ŭnh gô sa sư.

English: If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you.
Bahnar: “Dah iĕm oei lăm Inh, lei dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho oei lăm iĕm păng dah iĕm apinh Inh tơdrong kiơ Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'noh mơ̆n păng sĭt gô đei tơpă.

English: By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm đei plei trem iĕm bơngai kiơ̆ Inh tơpă păng đe gô 'bôh iĕm pơm thoi noh na đe ư-ang kơ 'Bă Inh tơpă.

English: “As the Father loved Me, I also have loved you; abide in My love.
Bahnar: Inh 'mêm kơ iĕm kư̆m thoi 'Bă Inh 'mêm kơ Inh mơ̆n. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ achăng Inh hŏ na Inh gô 'mêm kơ iĕm, wei-lăng iĕm ling-lang.

English: If you keep My commandments, you will abide in My love, just as I have kept My Father’s commandments and abide in His love.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm răk dôm tơdrong Inh bơtho, lei inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă, wei-lăng iĕm khŏm khŏm, kư̆m thoi Inh răk dôm tơdrong 'Bă Inh bơtho na Sư 'mêm kơ Inh tơpă păng wei-lăng Inh khŏm khŏm mơ̆n.

English: “These things I have spoken to you, that My joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be full.
Bahnar: “Inh roi ăn kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong âu wă kơ iĕm chơt hiôk kư̆m thoi Inh chơt hiôk. Thoi noh na lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: This is My commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
Bahnar: Inh pơkă ăn kơ iĕm thoi âu: Iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat dih băl kư̆m thoi Inh 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm.

English: Greater love has no one than this, than to lay down one’s life for his friends.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ăn akâu sư kơdih lôch tang lu buăl juăt sư, bơngai 'noh boih 'mêm mơnat kơ buăl juăt sư tơpă.

English: You are My friends if you do whatever I command you.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm răk dôm tơdrong Inh pơkă lei iĕm buăl juăt Inh tơpă.

English: No longer do I call you servants, for a servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, for all things that I heard from My Father I have made known to you.
Bahnar: Dang ei Inh ưh pă lăng iĕm thoi đĭch đam Inh boih. Inh lăng iĕm thoi buăl juăt Inh tơpă. Lu bơngai đĭch đe, yŏng sư ưh kơ roi tôm tơdrong sư ôh. Mă-lei Inh roi kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong Inh kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh.

English: You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatever you ask the Father in My name He may give you.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ iĕm krao Inh tơbôl păng iĕm ôh sơ̆, Inh krao iĕm wă kơ iĕm bôl păng Inh păng Inh wơh iĕm, wă kơ iĕm năm chă bơtho đe wă kơ đei plei păng wă kơ plei noh huay kơ ôm. Dah iĕm apinh 'Bă Inh tơdrong kiơ yua kơ iĕm tơbôl păng Inh, tơdrong noh Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: These things I command you, that you love one another.
Bahnar: Inh pơkă ăn kơ iĕm minh 'măng âu dơ̆ng: Iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat dih băl.

English: “If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.
Bahnar: “Dah bơngai ala teh âu hil areh kơ iĕm, iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n lu sư hil 'noh, lu sư hil areh kơ Inh mă hơdrol.

English: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm khŭl bơngai ala teh âu, lei tơduă iĕm ala teh âu 'mêm mơnat dih băl. Mă-lei Inh rơih iŏk iĕm đơ̆ng khŭl ala teh âu na lu sư lăng iĕm thoi lĕ ưh kơ dih bôl. Kơlih kơ thoi noh na lu sư hil areh kơ lu iĕm.

English: Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.
Bahnar: “Mă lu iĕm athei 'blŏk gah tơdrong Inh bơtho hei: ‘Đĭch ưh kơ lah tih hloh kơ yŏng sư.’ Đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh păng đe gô pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm mơ̆n. Đe lui yom kơ nơ̆r Inh bơtho dang yơ, đe kư̆m lui yom kơ nơ̆r iĕm bơtho dang noh mơ̆n.

English: But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: Iĕm kiơ̆ Inh na lu sư pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh.

English: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
Bahnar: “Dah Inh ưh kơ năm bơtho lu sư lei lu sư ưh kơ hil kơ Inh ôh. Mă-lei dang ei lu sư hil kơ Inh păng kuă kơ lui kơ tơdrong Inh bơtho na lu sư chă tơdrong yoch tơpă.

English: He who hates Me hates My Father also.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hil areh kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh hil areh kơ 'Bă Inh mơ̆n.

English: If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ ưh kơ đei bu pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang dang Inh. Dah Inh ưh kơ pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư wă tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi krô hmă, lei lu sư ưh kơ hil kơ Inh ôh. Na dang ei lu sư 'bôh Inh păng 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh pơm boih, na lu sư hil areh kơ Inh păng hil areh kơ 'Bă Inh mơ̆n. Lu sư chă tơdrong yoch tơpă.

English: But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’
Bahnar: Đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt lu sư sơ̆ khan: ‘Lu sư hil areh kơ Inh ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ.’ Yua kơ chih thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n 'bôh 'blep trŏ thoi noh tơpă.

English: “But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.
Bahnar: “'Bok Dŏng Mơnat gô truh tơ iĕm, anăn Sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Sư tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư gô jur đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh yua kơ Inh wơh Sư đơ̆ng anih 'Bă Inh; na Sư gô bơtho tơdrong Inh.

English: And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.
Bahnar: Mă lu iĕm kư̆m bơtho tơdrong Inh mơ̆n, kơlih kơ iĕm oei hơdai hăm Inh đơ̆ng tơm hmơm sơ̆ boih.

English: “These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.
Bahnar: “Inh bơtho iĕm tôm tơdrong 'noh wă kơ iĕm huay kơ achăng lê̆ Inh.

English: They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh lu sư gô pơpuh iĕm đơ̆ng hnam akŭm lu sư. Ning-mônh mơ̆n lu sư khan pơlôch iĕm khan trŏ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă.

English: And these things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor Me.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơm kơ iĕm thoi noh kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bă Inh păng ưh kơ băt kơ Inh mơ̆n.

English: But these things I have told you, that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you of them. And these things I did not say to you at the beginning, because I was with you.
Bahnar: Inh roi kơ iĕm tơdrong noh dang ei na lăp iĕm tơ'bơ̆p tơpă ning-mônh na iĕm gô 'blŏk tơdrong noh đơ̆ng Inh pơma păng iĕm dang ei. Hơdrol sơ̆ Inh ưh kơ roi tơdrong 'noh, kơlih kơ Inh oei hơdai hăm iĕm.

English: “But now I go away to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
Bahnar: “Na dang ei Inh wă brŏk tơ 'Bok mă wơh Inh. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ đei tơchĕng tơdrong Inh wă brŏk tơ Sư.

English: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.
Bahnar: Iĕm sơ'ngon 'biơ̆ kơlih kơ Inh roi kơ iĕm gô đei tơdrong anat anot truh tơ iĕm.

English: Nevertheless I tell you the truth. It is to your advantage that I go away; for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you; but if I depart, I will send Him to you.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, Inh brŏk tơ 'Bă Inh đĕch 'lơ̆ng hloh dang ei. Dah Inh ưh kơ brŏk tơ Sư dang ei lei 'Bok Dŏng Mơnat ưh kơ jur tơ iĕm ôh. Inh jah brŏk na Inh wơh Sư jur tơ iĕm.

English: And when He has come, He will convict the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment
Bahnar: Lăp Sư jur, Sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu bơngai ala teh âu lu sư đei tơdrong yoch; Sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư Inh, Inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; păng tơbăt kơ lu sư gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu bơngai ưh kơ lui kơ Sư.

English: of sin, because they do not believe in Me
Bahnar: 'Bok Dŏng Mơnat gô tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư đei tơdrong yoch kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Inh.

English: of righteousness, because I go to My Father and you see Me no more
Bahnar: Sư tơbăt kơ lu sư Inh pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kơlih kơ Inh brŏk tơ 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei, na iĕm ưh pă 'bôh Inh dơ̆ng.

English: of judgment, because the ruler of this world is judged.
Bahnar: Sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak tơpă lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui kơ Sư, kơlih kơ Sư sek tơlang boih yang Satan mă pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu.

English: “I still have many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.
Bahnar: “Inh oei đei lơ tơdrong wă pơma păng iĕm dơ̆ng, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ kĕ iŏk pơđĭ ôh dang ei.

English: However, when He, the Spirit of truth, has come, He will guide you into all truth; for He will not speak on His own authority, but whatever He hears He will speak; and He will tell you things to come.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ei truh, Sư bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư ưh kơ bơtho tơdrong Sư kơdih ôh, Sư bơtho iĕm dôm tơdrong Sư kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh. Sư kư̆m bơtho gah tơdrong ning-mônh mơ̆n.

English: He will glorify Me, for He will take of what is Mine and declare it to you.
Bahnar: Sư ư-ang kơ Inh kơlih kơ Sư bơtho iĕm dôm tơdrong Inh.

English: All things that the Father has are Mine. Therefore I said that He will take of Mine and declare it to you.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong 'Bă Inh kư̆m thoi tơdrong Inh mơ̆n, kơlih kơ thoi noh na Inh khan Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng gô bơtho iĕm dôm tơdrong Inh.

English: “A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me, because I go to the Father.”
Bahnar: “Pă 'biơ̆ iĕm ưh pă 'bôh Inh boih. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ưh kơ đunh mơ̆n iĕm 'bôh Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: Then some of His disciples said among themselves, “What is this that He says to us, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’; and, ‘because I go to the Father’?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơjet dih băl: “Sư khan kơ bơ̆n thoi yơ ei khan: ‘Pă 'biơ̆ dơ̆ng iĕm ưh pă 'bôh Inh boih, mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ưh kơ đunh mơ̆n iĕm 'bôh Inh dơ̆ng?’ Sư khan: ‘Iĕm ưh kơ 'bôh Inh kơlih kơ Inh wă brŏk tơ 'Bă Inh.’

English: They said therefore, “What is this that He says, ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is saying.”
Bahnar: Bĭ Sư khan ‘pă 'biơ̆’ ei, Sư khan kiơ? Bơ̆n ưh kơ hlôh Sư pơma kiơ ei.”

English: Now Jesus knew that they desired to ask Him, and He said to them, “Are you inquiring among yourselves about what I said, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư wă jet Sư tơdrong 'noh na Sư khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Inh khan pă 'biơ̆ noh, lu iĕm ưh pă 'bôh Inh boih, na đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ưh kơ đunh mơ̆n, iĕm gô 'bôh Inh dơ̆ng; hăm trŏ tơdrong noh ưh, iĕm jet dih băl hei?

English: Most assuredly, I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; and you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă wă kơ iĕm băt: Pă 'biơ̆ lu iĕm nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ol. Mă-lei lu bơngai ala teh âu 'nă hal. Pă 'biơ̆ mơ̆n jơhngơ̆m iĕm gô sơ'ngon, klaih kơ noh iĕm gô chhơp dơ̆ng.

English: A woman, when she is in labor, has sorrow because her hour has come; but as soon as she has given birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.
Bahnar: Thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn, truh năr sư wă jê̆ tơpŭ, sư sơ'ngon kơlih kơ sư jĭ. Hlôi sư tơpŭ boih sư hiơt kơ tơdrong jĭ sư kơlih kơ sư chhơp yua kơ đei hơ'lơ̆p boih.

English: Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Dang ei iĕm sơ'ngon. Mă-lei Inh gô tơ'bơ̆p iĕm dơ̆ng na jơhngơ̆m iĕm chhơp hiôk chơt tơpă, ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơm kơ iĕm sơ'ngon dơ̆ng.

English: “And in that day you will ask Me nothing. Most assuredly, I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name He will give you.
Bahnar: “Hơtai ei kơnh iĕm huay pă kăl jet Inh dơ̆ng boih mă tôm tơdrong kiơ kiơ. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, kơlih kơ iĕm bơngai lui kiơ̆ Inh na 'Bă Inh gô tơgŭm ăn kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong iĕm apinh Sư.

English: Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei apinh 'Bă Inh, thoi âu: Yua kơ nhôn lui kơ Kon Ih Yêsu na nhôn apinh Ih wă kơ Ih ăn kơ nhôn tơdrong noh. Iĕm apinh Sư thoi noh, gô đei kơ iĕm tơpă. Thoi noh na iĕm chơt hiôk chhơp kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm tơpă. Mă-lei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei iĕm tam mă krao khan apinh Sư thoi noh 'mơ̆i.

English: “These things I have spoken to you in figurative language; but the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figurative language, but I will tell you plainly about the Father.
Bahnar: “Inh bơtho iĕm dôm tơdrong 'noh păng nơ̆r pơtih gia ngăl. Mă ning-mônh kơnh Inh ưh pă bơtho păng nơ̆r pơtih gia boih. Inh gô pơma hơdah hloi gah tơdrong 'Bă Inh.

English: In that day you will ask in My name, and I do not say to you that I shall pray the Father for you
Bahnar: Hơtai ei kơnh iĕm krao khan hăm anăn Inh apinh 'Bă Inh ăn tơdrong kiơ kiơ, Inh ưh pă kăl apinh Sư wă tơdŏng iĕm boih

English: for the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came forth from God.
Bahnar: kơlih kơ 'Bă Inh 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm tơpă. Sư 'mêm kơ iĕm yua kơ iĕm 'mêm kơ Inh păng lui kơ Inh jur đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: I came forth from the Father and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world and go to the Father.”
Bahnar: Inh jur đơ̆ng 'Bă Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă oei hơdai iĕm tơ ala teh âu. Dang ei Inh jăk đơ̆ng ala teh âu brŏk tơ 'Bă Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: His disciples said to Him, “See, now You are speaking plainly, and using no figure of speech!
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Dang ei nhôn băt kơ Ih pơma hơdah tôm tơdrong; Ih ưh pă pơma păng nơ̆r pơtih gia boih.

English: Now we are sure that You know all things, and have no need that anyone should question You. By this we believe that You came forth from God.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei nhôn băt kơ Ih, băt tôm tơdrong păng nhôn ưh pă kăl jet Ih dơ̆ng. Thoi noh boih na nhôn lui kơ Ih jur đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dang ei iĕm lui hă?

English: Indeed the hour is coming, yes, has now come, that you will be scattered, each to his own, and will leave Me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pă 'biơ̆ kơnh, wă jê̆ truh boih, đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm kơdâu sơlah gah kơdih kơdih brŏk tơ hnam tŭk kơdrô̆ Inh đĕch. Mă tơpă Inh ưh kơ oei kơdrô̆ Inh ôh. 'Bă Inh oei hơdai păng Inh.

English: These things I have spoken to you, that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation; but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world.”
Bahnar: Inh roi kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong noh hei wă kơ iĕm chơt hiôk yua kơ iĕm gơnang kơ Inh. Tơ ala teh âu iĕm gô đei tơdrong anat anot. Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ sơ'ngon hŏ yua kơ tôm tơdrong ala teh âu thuơ kơ Inh ngăl boih.”

English: Jesus spoke these words, lifted up His eyes to heaven, and said: “Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son also may glorify You
Bahnar: Đang kơ Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih na Sư ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư: “Ơ 'Bă, truh jơ Inh boih. Apinh Ih atŏk Inh Kon Ih brŏk oei păng Ih bĕ dang ei wă kơ Inh gơh pơư pơang anăn Ih dơ̆ng.

English: as You have given Him authority over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many as You have given Him.
Bahnar: Thoi Ih ăn kơ Inh pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai, Inh gơh ăn kơ kon bơngai mă Ih pơjao kơ Inh gô arih ling-lang păng ba.

English: And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent.
Bahnar: Lu sư đei tơdrong arih ling-lang yua kơ lu sư lui kơ Ih Kră Yang 'Bă Tơm kơpal plĕnh păng băt kơ Inh Yêsu Krist mă Ih wơh jur tơ ala teh âu.

English: I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work which You have given Me to do.
Bahnar: Inh pơư pơang anăn Ih kơ lu bơngai oei tơ ala teh âu; Inh pơm keh boih dôm tơdrong jang mă Ih pơkă ăn kơ Inh.

English: And now, O Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world was.
Bahnar: Na dang ei ơ 'Bă, atŏk inh brŏk oei păng Ih mă hiôk hơiă bĕ 'Bă, kư̆m thoi Inh oei hơdai hăm Ih mă hơdrol kơ Ih pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ hiôk hơiă tơpă.

English: “I have manifested Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.
Bahnar: “Inh roi tơbăt tôm tơdrong Ih kơ lu bơngai ala teh mă Ih pơjao ăn kơ Inh boih. Lu sư bơngai Ih, mă Ih pơjao ăn kơ Inh. Lu sư răk dôm nơ̆r Ih.

English: Now they have known that all things which You have given Me are from You.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu sư băt tôm tơdrong Ih pơjao ăn kơ Inh lĕch đơ̆ng Ih ngăl.

English: For I have given to them the words which You have given Me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came forth from You; and they have believed that You sent Me.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho ăn kơ lu sư tôm tơdrong mă Ih pơkă ăn kơ Inh. Tôm lu tơdrong 'noh lu sư răk kơdih kơdih boih. Lu sư băt kơ Inh jur đơ̆ng Ih tơpă păng lu sư băt kơ Ih wơh Inh.

English: “I pray for them. I do not pray for the world but for those whom You have given Me, for they are Yours.
Bahnar: “Inh krao khan kơ Ih apinh Ih tơgŭm mơnat kơ lu sư. Dang ei Inh ưh kơ krao khan apinh Ih, wă kơ Ih tơgŭm đĭ-đăng bơngai ala teh ôh. Inh krao khan kơ Ih wă kơ Ih tơgŭm lu bơngai mă Ih pơjao ăn kơ Inh, yua kơ lu sư bơngai Ih.

English: And all Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai Inh dang bơngai Ih păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Ih dang bơngai Inh mơ̆n. Lu sư kư̆m pơư pơang Inh.

English: Now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to You. Holy Father, keep through Your name those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are.
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh pă oei tơ ala teh âu dơ̆ng, pôm lu sư đĕch oei tơ teh âu. Inh wă tŏk tơ Ih boih. Ơ 'Bă, Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, apinh Ih yua mơsêh mơyang Ih wei-lăng lu sư mă kơjăp kư̆m thoi Ih pơjao kơ Inh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang. Na apinh Ih wei-lăng lu sư wă kơ lu sư pôm đon, kư̆m thoi ba pôm đon dih băl.

English: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. Those whom You gave Me I have kept; and none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh oei hơdai lu sư, Inh yua mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng Ih pơjao kơ Inh, na Inh wei-lăng lu sư kơjăp. Inh wei-lăng lu sư, lăm lu sư ưh kơ đei bu hiong ôh; lăp minh 'nu bơngai đĕch hiong. Mă-lei trŏ kơ sư wă hiong 'mơ̆i kơlih kơ 'blep trŏ thoi đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Ih.

English: But now I come to You, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.
Bahnar: “Na dang ei Inh wă tŏk oei hơdai păng Ih, mă-lei hơdrol kơ Inh wă tŏk Inh roi kơ Ih dôm nơ̆r âu wă kơ lu sư hiôk chơt tơduă lu sư, kư̆m thoi ba hiôk chơt tơduă ba.

English: I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong Ih pơkă, na lu bơngai ala teh hil areh kơ lu sư, kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ sĭ bơngai đơ̆ng ala teh âu, kư̆m thoi Inh ưh kơ sĭ bơngai đơ̆ng ala teh âu mơ̆n.

English: I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should keep them from the evil one.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ apinh Ih iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng ala teh âu ôh, Inh apinh Ih wei-lăng lu sư mă kơjăp wă kơ lu sư hlôi đơ̆ng yang kơnê̆ Satan.

English: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ sĭ bơngai đơ̆ng ala teh, kư̆m thoi Inh ưh kơ sĭ khŭl bơngai đơ̆ng ala teh âu mơ̆n.

English: Sanctify them by Your truth. Your word is truth.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư tôm tơdrong Ih, wă kơ lu sư gơh jang tơdrong Ih pran kơtang lăp đon rim lu sư kơdih kơdih, trŏ thoi Ih wă.

English: As You sent Me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.
Bahnar: Inh wơh lu sư năm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak âu, kư̆m thoi Ih wơh Inh jur tơ ala teh âu mơ̆n.

English: And for their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified by the truth.
Bahnar: Inh chu ăn akâu Inh tang yua kơ lu sư, wă pơm trŏ thoi Ih wă, wă kơ lu sư kư̆m pơyơ̆r ăn akâu lu sư chu kiơ̆ thoi Ih wă, yua kơ lu sư băt tơdrong Ih boih.

English: “I do not pray for these alone, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word
Bahnar: “Inh ưh kơ đei apinh Ih wă tơgŭm lu sư đĕch ôh. Inh apinh Ih tơgŭm dôm lu bơngai mă lui kơ Inh yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư bơtho.

English: that they all may be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You; that they also may be one in Us, that the world may believe that You sent Me.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ Ih ăn kơ lu sư pơgơ̆p băl minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon. Ơ 'Bă, ba minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon, na Inh wă kơ Ih ăn kơ lu sư oei pôm đon păng ba, wă kơ lu bơngai ala teh âu 'bôh thoi noh na lui kơ Ih wơh Inh.

English: And the glory which You gave Me I have given them, that they may be one just as We are one
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ Inh oei hơdai hăm Ih hiôk hơiă tơpă, na Inh kư̆m asong ăn kơ lu sư thoi noh mơ̆n, wă kơ lu sư pôm đon dih băl kư̆m thoi ba pôm đon mơ̆n.

English: I in them, and You in Me; that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me.
Bahnar: Inh pôm đon hăm lu sư păng ba pôm đon dih băl, wă kơ lu sư pôm đon tơduă lu sư mơ̆n; na lu bơngai ala teh âu băt kơ Ih wơh Inh tơpă păng lu bơngai ala teh gô băt kơ Ih 'mêm kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Inh, noh kư̆m thoi Ih 'mêm kơ Inh mơ̆n.

English: “Father, I desire that they also whom You gave Me may be with Me where I am, that they may behold My glory which You have given Me; for You loved Me before the foundation of the world.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bă, Ih pơjao boih lu sư kơ Inh na Inh wă kơ lu sư tŏk oei hơdai hăm Inh, na lu sư gô 'bôh Inh oei hơdai hăm Ih hiôk hơiă tơpă, yua kơ Ih đei ăn kơ Inh thoi noh. Ih 'mêm kơ Inh hơdrol kơ đei plĕnh teh.

English: O righteous Father! The world has not known You, but I have known You; and these have known that You sent Me.
Bahnar: Ơ 'Bă Inh, Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu bơngai ala teh âu ưh kơ băt kơ Ih, mă-lei Inh băt kơ Ih păng lu sư âu băt kơ Ih wơh Inh.

English: And I have declared to them Your name, and will declare it, that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”
Bahnar: Inh tơhlôh kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong Ih. Păng Inh oei tơhlôh kơ lu sư wă kơ lu sư băt tơpă Ih 'mêm kơ lu sư, kư̆m thoi Ih 'mêm kơ Inh; păng Inh gô oei lăm lu sư mơ̆n.”

English: When Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples over the Brook Kidron, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao khan đang boih, na Sư hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư weh đơ̆ng ei na yak hlôi kơ thong đak Kidrôn. Tơ noh đei minh hlak pơgar na lu sư mơ̆t lăm ei.

English: And Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place; for Jesus often met there with His disciples.
Bahnar: Juđa, bơngai plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu, băt kơ anih noh boih kơlih kơ đêl lu sư juăt kơ akŭm tơ ei.

English: Then Judas, having received a detachment of troops, and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Juđa năm krao iŏk lu linh Rôm păng lu linh Juđê mă gak hnam akŭm tơm mă đêl lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu khŭl Pharisi pơkă ăn kơ lu sư. Lu sư tơ̆k ŭnh, chĕp đao, hơlă, hră, năm tơ pơgar ei.

English: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that would come upon Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom are you seeking?”
Bahnar: Yêsu băt boih tơdrong wă truh kơ Sư, mă-lei Sư năm găn anăp lu đe ei păng jet: “Lu iĕm chă bu?”

English: They answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said to them, “I am He.” And Judas, who betrayed Him, also stood with them.
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei khan: “Nhôn chă Yêsu, Pơlei Nasaret.” Yêsu khan: “Inh boih Yêsu.” Juđa, bơngai plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu, sư dơ̆ng hơdai đe noh.

English: Now when He said to them, “I am He,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
Bahnar: Truh Yêsu khan: “Inh boih,” na lu sư kơdŭn tơ rŏng, pơ̆k tơ teh.

English: Then He asked them again, “Whom are you seeking?” And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Bahnar: Yêsu jet dơ̆ng: “Iĕm chă bu?” Lu đe ei khan: “Nhôn chă Yêsu, Pơlei Nasaret.”

English: Jesus answered, “I have told you that I am He. Therefore, if you seek Me, let these go their way,”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Inh khan kơ iĕm boih Inh bơngai noh. Dah lu iĕm wă rôp Inh, apinh iĕm ăn kơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ Inh âu brŏk.”

English: that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, “Of those whom You gave Me I have lost none.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan tơdrong noh 'blep tơdrong đơ̆ng Sư khan lê̆ hơdrol kơ 'Bă Sư hei thoi âu: “Lăm lu bơngai đêl Ih ăn kơ Inh ưh kơ đei bu hiong ôh.”

English: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu, anăn sư Pêtrôs, sư kieo minh hlak dao, sư toh dao sư, koh đĭch 'bok soi tơm 'bơm đon gah 'ma phơ̆t kơtĕch hloi. Đĭch noh anăn sư Malkơ.

English: So Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink the cup which My Father has given Me?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ Pêtrôs: “Tah lê̆ dao ih tơ anglop bĕ. 'Bă Inh ăn tơdrong anat anot âu truh kơ Inh, trŏ kơ Inh iŏk boih.”

English: Then the detachment of troops and the captain and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu linh Rôm păng minh 'nu 'bok sêp lu sư, hăm lu linh Juđê mă gak hnam akŭm tơm, lu sư rôp chô̆ Yêsu.

English: And they led Him away to Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was high priest that year.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm ba Yêsu tơ Ana. Ana 'noh sư tơnei Kaiphe. Kaiphe pơm 'bok soi tơm lăm sơnăm 'noh.

English: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
Bahnar: Kaiphe âu boih bơngai mă đêl khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê thoi âu: “Minh 'nu bơngai lôch tang lu bơngai Juđê bơ̆n, thoi noh trŏ.”

English: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs hăm minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm nai năm kiơ̆ Yêsu. 'Bok soi tơm sư juăt hăm minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm 'noh, thoi noh bơngai 'nâu gơh mơ̆t hơdai kiơ̆ Yêsu tơ cham 'bok soi tơm.

English: But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought Peter in.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs gô 'bơ̆t 'măng dur. Bơngai pơhrăm mă juăt kơ 'bok soi tơm, sư năm khan kơ drŏ-kăn wei 'măng dur ăn Pêtrôs mơ̆t tơ lăm cham ei mơ̆n.

English: Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, “You are not also one of this Man’s disciples, are you?” He said, “I am not.”
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn ei jet Pêtrôs: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih kư̆m pơhrăm păng Yêsu?” Pêtrôs khan: “Ưh ôh, inh ưh.”

English: Now the servants and officers who had made a fire of coals stood there, for it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
Bahnar: Đei lu linh, lu đĭch đam oei nhur ŭnh ngar kơlih kơ tơngiĕt. Pêtrôs kư̆m năm nhur hơdai hăm lu đe noh mơ̆n.

English: The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His doctrine.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm jet Yêsu: “Lu đe bu juăt pơhrăm păng Ih? Ih bơtho lu sư tơdrong kiơ?”

English: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues and in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and in secret I have said nothing.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Inh ling-lang bơtho tơ bơngai tơpôl, tơ rim hnam akŭm. Inh bơtho tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Tơ yơ yơ lu Juđê akŭm, Inh bơtho kơ lu sư mơ̆n. Inh ưh kơ đei bơtho ôn ôh.

English: Why do you ask Me? Ask those who have heard Me what I said to them. Indeed they know what I said.”
Bahnar: Lơliơ ih jet Inh? Ih jet lu bơngai đêl mơ̆ng Inh bơtho, lu sư băt đĭ boih tơdrong noh.”

English: And when He had said these things, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Do You answer the high priest like that?”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu pơma thoi noh, đei minh 'nu linh Juđê tap tơ'bŏk Sư păng khan: “Ih ưh kơ trŏ pơma kơ 'bok soi tơm thoi noh ôh.”

English: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why do you strike Me?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Dah Inh pơma glăi, ih roi tơdrong glăi 'noh; dah Inh pơma trŏ, liơ ih tap Inh thoi âu?”

English: Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Ana wơh đe ba Yêsu năm tơ 'bok soi tơm anăn sư Kaiphe. Ti Yêsu oei chô̆.

English: Now Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. Therefore they said to him, “You are not also one of His disciples, are you?” He denied it and said, “I am not!”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs oei nhur ŭnh. Lu bơngai nhur ŭnh ei jet Pêtrôs: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih pơhrăm păng Yêsu?” Pêtrôs sơngah khan: “Ưh ôh, inh ưh.”

English: One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of him whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai đĭch đam 'bok soi tơm, 'nhŏng oh bơngai mă đêl Pêtrôs koh hla đon sư, jet Pêtrôs dơ̆ng: “Inh 'bôh ih hơdai hăm Yêsu tơ pơgar 'long noh hei”

English: Peter then denied again; and immediately a rooster crowed.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs sơngah dơ̆ng, klaih kơ noh lêk kơ iĕr ŏ hloi.

English: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, and it was early morning. But they themselves did not go into the Praetorium, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng hrôih đe anhăk Yêsu đơ̆ng hnam Kaiphe tơ hnam birô anih 'bok pơgơ̆r. Lu bơngai Juđê ưh kơ pơ̆n mơ̆t lăm hnam birô noh yua kơ khŭl lu sư kơ̆m kơ mơ̆t lăm hnam tơmoi. Dah lu sư mơ̆t, lu sư ưh kơ gơh sa 'nhĕm sư pơm Giĕng Năm Brih lăm năr noh.

English: Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pilat lĕch jet lu sư: “Iĕm kêng bơngai âu tơdrong kiơ?”

English: They answered and said to him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him up to you.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Dah Sư ưh kơ đei pơm yoch, nhôn ưh kơ đei năm ba Sư tơ ih ôh.”

English: Then Pilate said to them, “You take Him and judge Him according to your law.” Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
Bahnar: 'Noh Pilat khan kơ lu sư dơ̆ng: “Thoi ei iĕm iŏk Sư, sek tơlang kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt lu iĕm wăi.” Lu bơngai Juđê khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ gơh pơlôch bơngai ôh.”

English: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying by what death He would die.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơma 'noh 'blep trŏ thoi Yêsu khan lê̆ hơdrol, Sư wă lôch tơ 'long pơglang.

English: Then Pilate entered the Praetorium again, called Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
Bahnar: Pilat mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ hnam birô 'noh păng jet Yêsu: “Hăm trŏ kơ Ih pơm Pơtao đe Juđê?”

English: Jesus answered him, “Are you speaking for yourself about this, or did others tell you this concerning Me?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Noh ih pơma kơdih dah đe akhan kơ ih?”

English: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests have delivered You to me. What have You done?”
Bahnar: Pilat khan: “Inh ưh kơ trŏ kơ bơngai Juđê ôh. Lu bơngai dêh char Ih păng lu 'bok soi tih, rôp Ih năm ba tơ inh. 'Noh Ih pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ?”

English: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would fight, so that I should not be delivered to the Jews; but now My kingdom is not from here.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Tơdrong Inh pơm Pơtao ưh kơ sĭ thoi lu 'bok pơtao tơ ala teh âu ôh. Dah Inh pơm pơtao thoi lu sư, đei bơngai linh kiơ̆ Inh, tơblah păng lu bơngai Juđê 'noh wă kơ lu sư huay kơ rôp Inh. Tơdrong Inh pơm Pơtao ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng kon bơngai ăn kơ Inh pơm ôh.”

English: Pilate therefore said to Him, “Are You a king then?” Jesus answered, “You say rightly that I am a king. For this cause I was born, and for this cause I have come into the world, that I should bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”
Bahnar: Pilat jet dơ̆ng: “'Noh hăm trŏ Ih 'Bok Pơtao dah ưh?” Yêsu khan: “Trŏ boih ih khan Inh 'Bok Pơtao. Kơlih kơ minh tơdrong âu Inh tơpŭ tơ ala teh âu, wă bơtho tơdrong tơpăt. Bu mă kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt, sư mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh pơma.”

English: Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no fault in Him at all.
Bahnar: Pilat khan: “Tơdrong kiơ khan tơdrong tơpăt?” Pilat lĕch hloi khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê: “Inh 'bôh bơngai 'nâu ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh.

English: “But you have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt iĕm, trŏ kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih, inh wă tơlĕch ăn minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng lăm hnam phak. Iĕm hăm wă inh tơlĕch kơ iĕm 'Bok Pơtao đe Juđê?”

English: Then they all cried again, saying, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ưh ôh, ưh kơ bơngai 'noh. Tơlĕch ăn kơ nhôn 'Barra'ba.” 'Barra'ba 'noh yŏng bơngai tơtông tơgar.

English: So then Pilate took Jesus and scourged Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pilat năm ba Yêsu ăn kơ lu linh sư teh tach Sư păng sơnguĕt.

English: And the soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put on Him a purple robe.
Bahnar: Lu linh gơ̆ jơla, pơm tơlei agăl pơyơ̆l kơ kơ̆l Yêsu, pơhrŭk ăn kơ Sư ao tai 'brê pơm thoi pơtao.

English: Then they said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they struck Him with their hands.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư năm tơ anăp Yêsu khan: “Kơkuh kơ Ih 'Bok Pơtao bơngai Juđê.” Păng lu sư tap tơ'bŏk Yêsu.

English: Pilate then went out again, and said to them, “Behold, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no fault in Him.”
Bahnar: Pilat lĕch dơ̆ng khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê: “Gô inh krao Sư tơ âu wă kơ iĕm băt inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư đei tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh.”

English: Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, “Behold the Man!”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na Yêsu lĕch. Sư yơ̆l tơlei agăl jơla păng hrŭk ao tai 'brê. Pilat khan: “Iĕm lăng bĕ bơngai 'nâu.”

English: Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify Him, crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “You take Him and crucify Him, for I find no fault in Him.”
Bahnar: 'Bôh Yêsu boih, lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu linh ôr pơret khan: “Pơ̆ng Sư tơ 'long pơglang, pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.” Pilat khan: “Lu iĕm iŏk Sư bĕ, pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang. Gah inh, inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư pơm yoch kiơ ôh.”

English: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God.”
Bahnar: Lu Juđê drơ̆ng khan: “Nhôn đei tơdrong juăt, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt 'noh athei pơlôch Sư kơlih kơ Sư khan Sư Yang, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid
Bahnar: Pilat kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư rai hli.

English: and went again into the Praetorium, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
Bahnar: Sư mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ hnam birô păng jet Yêsu: “Ih đơ̆ng yơ?” Yêsu ưh kơ đei drơ̆ng tơwih kơ sư ôh.

English: Then Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to crucify You, and power to release You?”
Bahnar: Pilat khan: “Lơliơ Ih kuă pơma hăm inh? Ih ưh kơ băt inh gơh achăng Ih dah pơ̆ng pơlôch Ih tơ 'long pơglang hă?”

English: Jesus answered, “You could have no power at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn ih pơm thoi noh, ih ưh kơ gơh pơm kơ Inh ôh. Yua kơ 'noh bơngai mă pơjao lê̆ Inh kơ ih, sư yoch hloh kơ ih.”

English: From then on Pilate sought to release Him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If you let this Man go, you are not Caesar’s friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar.”
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, Pilat wă dêh achăng Yêsu. Mă-lei lu Juđê ôr pơret: “Dah ih achăng bơngai âu, ih jing pă buăl hăm 'bok pơtao tơm bơ̆n, Sêsar. Bơngai bu wă pôk akâu sư kơdih pơm pơtao, bơngai 'noh wă ayăt kơ 'bok pơtao tơm bơ̆n.”

English: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
Bahnar: Pilat kơtơ̆ng lu sư pơma thoi noh, sư năm ba Yêsu tơ 'ngoaih. Pilat tơoei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ sek tơlang tơ lăm cham đe krao cham lơ̆k tơmo. Nơ̆r Juđê khan Gabatha.

English: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, “Behold your King!”
Bahnar: Năr noh lăp 'năr wă suăn dơ̆ng, năr đe oei hơmet wă pơm Giĕng Năm Brih, Pilat khan kơ lu Juđê: “Âu 'Bok Pơtao iĕm.”

English: But they cried out, “Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
Bahnar: Lu sư ôr pơret: “Nhôn ưh kơ wă bơngai 'noh. Pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.” Pilat khan dơ̆ng: “Inh pơ̆ng pơlôch 'Bok Pơtao iĕm hă?” Mă-lei lu 'bok soi tih khan: “Nhôn đei minh 'nu Sêsar đĕch pơm pơtao nhôn.”

English: Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pilat pơjao ăn kơ lu sư Yêsu wă pơ̆ng pơlôch tơ 'long pơglang. Lu sư anhăk ba Yêsu hloi.

English: And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha
Bahnar: Yêsu tôi ba 'long pơglang kơdih Sư, năm tơ anih đe anăn kông kơting kơ̆l bơngai lôch. Nơ̆r Juđê khan, Gôlgôtha.

English: where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the center.
Bahnar: Tơ noh boih đe pơ̆ng Sư tơ 'long pơglang. Pơ̆ng hơdai Yêsu kư̆m đei 'bar 'nu bơngai nai, minh 'nu gah 'ma minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo, na Yêsu tŏk-bŏk.

English: Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Bahnar: Pilat chih minh hlak gơ'bang athei đe pơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'long pơglang. Gơ'bang 'noh chih thoi âu: “Yêsu, Pơlei Nasaret, Pơtao đe Juđê.”

English: Then many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.
Bahnar: Lơ bơngai Juđê đŏk lăng gơ'bang 'noh yua kơ anih đe pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu 'noh jê̆ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Gơ'bang 'noh chih păng nơ̆r Juđê, nơ̆r Rôm păng nơ̆r Grĕk.

English: Therefore the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘He said, “I am the King of the Jews.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih năm khan kơ Pilat: “Ih 'nĕ kơ chih khan: ‘'Bok Pơtao đe Juđê.’ Ih athei chih thoi âu: ‘Bơngai âu pơang akâu Sư kơdih khan Pơtao lu bơngai Juđê.’ ”

English: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pilat khan: “Tơdrong noh, inh chih đang boih.”

English: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His garments and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and also the tunic. Now the tunic was without seam, woven from the top in one piece.
Bahnar: Pơ̆ng Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang boih, lu linh iŏk hơbĕn ao Sư păng hek asong băl puăn chăl, minh 'nu iŏk minh chăl. Lu sư kư̆m iŏk ao tai Yêsu mơ̆n, ao 'noh đe tanh pơm hơbĕn ao kơtă, đơ̆ng ako truh tơ jơ̆ng.

English: They said therefore among themselves, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says: “They divided My garments among them, And for My clothing they cast lots.” Therefore the soldiers did these things.
Bahnar: Lu linh pơma băl tơduă lu sư khan: “Lu bơ̆n 'nĕ pă hek ao 'nâu, gô bơ̆n hlang lăng 'mơ̆i, na băt bu gơh iŏk.” 'Noh 'blep trŏ thoi sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol thoi âu: “Lu sư hek asong băl hơbĕn ao Inh, klaih kơ 'noh hlang iŏk ao tai Inh.” Thoi noh lu linh pơm rok tơdrong 'noh.

English: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
Bahnar: Jê̆ 'long pơglang đe pơ̆ng Yêsu 'noh đei mĕ Sư, duch Sư, Mari akăn Klôpas păng Mari Pơlei Mađơla.

English: When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh mĕ Sư păng bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư mă Sư 'mêm. Sư khan kơ mĕ Sư thoi âu: “Ơ duch, 'noh kon ih.”

English: Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.
Bahnar: Păng khan kơ bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “'Noh mĕ ih.” Đơ̆ng năr noh bơngai pơhrăm ei anhăk ba mĕ Yêsu oei tơ hnam sư.

English: After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst!”
Bahnar: Yêsu băt tôm tơdrong đang boih. Wă kơ pơm 'blep trŏ thoi sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol, Sư khan: “Inh 'maih nhă đak.”

English: Now a vessel full of sour wine was sitting there; and they filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on hyssop, and put it to His mouth.
Bahnar: Tơ noh đei minh pơnhan sik 'nhŭ. Na đe iŏk tơmam thoi tơpu dơyĕn, tŏt 'bơ̆t 'long, djrŭ tơ sik 'nhŭ, klaih kơ noh 'me 'bơ̆t 'bơ̆r Yêsu.

English: So when Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And bowing His head, He gave up His spirit.
Bahnar: Trip sik 'nhŭ ei boih, Yêsu khan: “Dôm tơdrong đang boih.” Na Sư kŭp kơ̆l, pơjao bơhngol Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m hloi.

English: Therefore, because it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê năm apinh Pilat wă gơ̆ lê̆ jơ̆ng lu bơngai mă đêl pơ̆ng tơ 'long pơglang, wă kơ lu sư jah lôch na gơh tơjur 'bŭ atâu lu sư. Lu sư pơm thoi noh hơdrol kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat, kơlih kơ năr Sa'bat lu sư kuă kơ lê̆ atâu tơ kơpal 'long pơglang, kơlih kơ năr Sa'bat 'noh năr lu sư khan năr kăl hloh tơpă, yua kơ trŏ năr pơm giĕng.

English: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu linh năm gơ̆ jơ̆ng bơngai gah âu hăm pah to, 'bar 'nu bơngai đe pơ̆ng pơlôch hơdai hăm Yêsu 'noh.

English: But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư năm tơ Yêsu, 'bôh Sư lôch boih, thoi noh na lu sư ưh pă gơ̆ jơ̆ng Yêsu dơ̆ng.

English: But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
Bahnar: Mă-lei minh 'nu linh iŏk tơju 'bet rơhiĕo Yêsu, na pham păng đak lĕch đơ̆ng rơka Sư.

English: And he who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true; and he knows that he is telling the truth, so that you may believe.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă 'bôh tơdrong 'noh, sư ră roi kơ bơ̆n, sư pơma tơpăt. Sư băt sư pơma tơpăt 'lơ̆ng. Sư wă kơ lu iĕm lui mơ̆n.

English: For these things were done that the Scripture should be fulfilled, “Not one of His bones shall be broken.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh 'blep trŏ thoi sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol thoi âu: “Ưh kơ đei minh pôm kơting Sư tơgơ̆ ôh.”

English: And again another Scripture says, “They shall look on Him whom they pierced.”
Bahnar: Sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m đei khan thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Lu sư gô lăng Bơngai mă đêl lu sư 'bet.”

English: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly, for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took the body of Jesus.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Armơthê, anăn sư Yôsep, sư bơngai lui kơ Yêsu mơ̆n, mă-lei sư ôn tơdrong lui sư yua kơ sư hli kơ lu bơngai Juđê. Yôsep 'noh năm apinh Pilat wă iŏk 'bŭ atâu Yêsu. Pilat kư̆m ăn mơ̆n. Thoi noh sư iŏk atâu Yêsu.

English: And Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.
Bahnar: Nikôđem, 'bok mă đêl năm ngôi tơ Yêsu kơmăng sơ̆, sư kư̆m năm hơdai păng Yôsep mơ̆n. Sư chĕp ba dang pơđăm-jĭt kilô pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: Then they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in strips of linen with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bre sư tơjur atâu Yêsu păng asu ăn che kok hăm tă pơgang 'bâu phu 'noh, kiơ̆ kơ lu Juđê juăt kơ hơmet wă 'bŭ atâu.

English: Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been laid.
Bahnar: Tơ anih đe pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu 'noh đei minh hlak pơgar, lăm pơgar 'noh đei minh pôm bơsat 'nao, tam mă đei tah atâu.

English: So there they laid Jesus, because of the Jews’ Preparation Day, for the tomb was nearby.
Bahnar: Yua kơ wă truh năr Sa'bat boih păng bơsat 'noh kư̆m jê̆ mơ̆n, thoi noh bre sư tah atâu Yêsu lăm bơsat ei hloi.

English: Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
Bahnar: Tơ pơgê hrôih năr mă mônh lăm giĕng, oei măng mu, Mari Pơlei Mađơla năm tơ bơsat Yêsu. Truh tơ bơsat sư 'bôh tơmo tơgrŏl lê̆ boih đơ̆ng 'măng bơsat.

English: Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư kơdâu năm tơ Pêtrôs hăm bơngai pơhrăm nai dơ̆ng, bơngai mă Yêsu 'mêm păng sư akhan thoi âu: “Yŏng bơ̆n Yêsu, đe iŏk tơ nai boih, mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ băt đe 'măn Sư tơ yơ ôh.”

English: Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and were going to the tomb.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pêtrôs hăm bơngai pơhrăm ei kơdâu năm tơ bơsat mơ̆n.

English: So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơhrăm nai ei kơdâu ploi kơ Pêtrôs, truh tơ bơsat hơdrol.

English: And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.
Bahnar: Sư kŭp nger lăng tơ lăm bơsat, sư 'bôh che kok lăm bơsat ei, mă-lei sư ưh kơ mơ̆t tơ noh ôh.

English: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there
Bahnar: Pêtrôs truh boih, sư mơ̆t hloi lăm bơsat, sư 'bôh che đêl đe asu kơ Yêsu oei 'bơ̆t ei.

English: and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.
Bahnar: Che đêl đe gom kơ̆l Yêsu 'noh chơ̆p lê̆ tơ anih kơdih.

English: Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơngai pơhrăm mă truh hơdrol 'noh kư̆m mơ̆t tơ lăm bơsat, sư 'bôh na sư lui kơ Yêsu iung arih boih.

English: For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ lu sư ưh kơ hlôh kơ tơdrong mă sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol gah Yêsu gô iung arih đơ̆ng lôch.

English: Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu 'noh wih tơ hnam sư kơdih.

English: But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb.
Bahnar: Mari dơ̆ng hmoi tơ 'ngoaih bơsat, sư hmoi rah păng kŭp nger tơ lăm bơsat.

English: And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh 'bar 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei hrŭk ao kok tơoei 'bơ̆t anih mă đêl đe tơ'bĭch atâu Yêsu, minh 'nu 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng, minh 'nu 'bơ̆t kơ̆l.

English: Then they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him.”
Bahnar: Bre sư jet Mari thoi âu: “Ih hmoi kơ kiơ?” Mari khan: “Đe iŏk atâu Yŏng inh, thoi noh inh ưh kơ băt đe lê̆ Sư tơ yơ ôh.”

English: Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus.
Bahnar: Lăp sư pơma thoi noh sư hue lăng tơ rŏng, sư 'bôh Yêsu dơ̆ng tơ noh, mă-lei sư ưh kơ băt bơngai 'noh Yêsu ôh.

English: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?” She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said to Him, “Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have laid Him, and I will take Him away.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ Mari: “Ih hmoi kơ kiơ, ih chă bu?” Mari ngêh kơ Yêsu 'noh bơngai wei pơgar, na sư khan: “Ơ 'bok, tơdah ih đei iŏk atâu Sư, apinh ih roi kơ inh ih lê̆ tơ yơ, wă kơ inh năm iŏk Sư.”

English: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to Him, “Rabboni!” (which is to say, Teacher).
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Ơ Mari.” Mari hue 'bôh hloi păng khan hăm nơ̆r Juđê: “Rabôni.” Rabôni wă khan 'bok thây.

English: Jesus said to her, “Do not cling to Me, for I have not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say to them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Yêsu khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ rôp Inh, yua kơ Inh ưh tam mă tŏk wih tơ 'Bă Inh. Ih năm khan kơ lu 'nhŏng oh Inh wă kơ sư băt kơ Inh wă tŏk wih tơ 'Bă Inh, Sư kư̆m 'Bă lu iĕm mơ̆n; tơ Kră Yang Inh, Sư kư̆m Kră Yang iĕm mơ̆n.”

English: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things to her.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Mari, Pơlei Mađơla, năm khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm thoi âu: “Inh 'bôh boih Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu.” Păng sư roi tơdrong đêl Yêsu pơkă kơ sư.

English: Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
Bahnar: Hơdrơ̆m kơsơ̆ năr mă mônh lăm giĕng ei, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu oei hơdai lăm hnam, 'măng chơkăl lê̆ ngăl yua kơ lu sư hli kơ khŭl Juđê. Thoi noh Yêsu mơ̆t dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk lu đe ei păng khan: “Oei hiôk bĕ lu iĕm.”

English: When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơma thoi noh, Yêsu tơ'bôh ti păng rơhiĕo Sư kơ lu đe noh. Lu bơngai pơhrăm 'bôh Kră Yang Yêsu, lu sư chhơp tơpă.

English: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Yêsu khan kơ lu sư dơ̆ng: “Oei hiôk bĕ lu iĕm. Thoi lĕ kơ đêl 'Bă Inh wơh Inh, 'noh Inh kư̆m wơh iĕm mơ̆n.”

English: And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Sư pơma thoi noh, Yêsu dơhlu hơyuh mơsêh kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng akhan: “Sơng iŏk Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng bĕ.

English: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”
Bahnar: Dah lu iĕm mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch đe, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat ăn kơ lu đe ei mơ̆n. Dah iĕm ưh kơ mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch đe, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ mơnat ăn kơ lu bơngai ei.”

English: Now Thomas, called the Twin, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm, anăn sư Thôm, đe krao sư Kon Kơmar sư ưh kơ đei tơ lăm noh mă lăm năr Yêsu truh tơ ei.

English: The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord.” So he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai pơhrăm nai khan kơ Thôm: “Nhôn 'bôh boih Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu.” Mă-lei Thôm khan: “Dah inh ưh kơ 'bôh đêl rơka kơđĭnh tơ ti Sư, dah inh ưh kơ tŏt hơnglâu ti inh tơ đêl rơka noh, hăm ti inh ưh kơ tŏt tơ rơhiĕo Sư, lei inh ưh kơ lui.”

English: And after eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, “Peace to you!”
Bahnar: Minh 'măng giĕng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr 'noh, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu năm akŭm lăm hnam dơ̆ng. Thôm sư kư̆m akŭm hơdai mơ̆n. 'Măng hnam oei chơkăl lê̆, mă-lei Yêsu dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk lu sư păng khan: “Oei hiôk bĕ lu iĕm.”

English: Then He said to Thomas, “Reach your finger here, and look at My hands; and reach your hand here, and put it into My side. Do not be unbelieving, but believing.”
Bahnar: Păng Sư khan kơ Thôm: “Pel ti ih 'bơ̆t âu, lăng ti Inh păng chro ti ih tŏt 'bơ̆t rơhiĕo Inh. Ih 'nĕ pă sơngah, athei ih lui bĕ.”

English: And Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Thôm khan: “Ơ Kră Yang inh, 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ih 'bôh Inh boih, thoi noh ih lui. Lu bơngai bu mă ưh kơ 'bôh Inh, mă-lei sư lui, 'noh hiôk tơpă kơ lu sư.”

English: And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, Yêsu đei pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang nai mă ưh kơ đei chih lăm hla bơar âu.

English: but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong chih lăm hla bơar 'nâu wă kơ lu iĕm lui kơ Yêsu Krist, Sư 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih bơ̆n, Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei. Dah lu iĕm lui lei lu iĕm gơh arih ling-lang yua kơ Sư.

English: After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way He showed Himself
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu tơ'bôh akâu Sư minh wơ̆t dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơ jih đak dơsĭ Galilê. Sư tơ'bôh akâu Sư thoi âu

English: Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs, Thôm mă đe anăn sư Kon Kơmar, Nathanel đơ̆ng Pơlei Kanna dêh Galilê păng 'bar 'nu kon Sêbêđê păng 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm buăl sư, lu sư akŭm pơđâu tơduă lu sư.

English: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” They said to him, “We are going with you also.” They went out and immediately got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ lu buăl sư: “Inh wă năm traih ka.” Lu buăl sư khan: “Nhôn wă kiơ̆ ih mơ̆n.” Na đĭ-đăng lu sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm traih jal. Lu sư traih prăt măng mă-lei 'nhŏ kơ đei minh găr.

English: But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore; yet the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr lĕch chră pơnang 'năr chrang kơ kông, na Yêsu dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t jih đak, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ưh kơ băt kơnăl kơ Sư.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Children, have you any food?” They answered Him, “No.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ tơpôl lu dăm, iĕm traih jal hăm đei rôp kiơ?” Lu sư khan: “Nhôn hoh-hoy kơ rôp minh găr.”

English: And He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they cast, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the multitude of fish.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm traih lăng gah 'ma kơ thŏng-nan, 'bơ̆t noh đei ka lơ.” Na lu sư traih hloi 'bơ̆t ei, ka puh jal lu sư lơ tơpă, lu sư ưh kơ kĕ hiot atŏk jal.

English: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment (for he had removed it), and plunged into the sea.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu mă Sư 'mêm kơeng tơpă, sư khan kơ Pêtrôs: “'Noh Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu.” Lăp Pêtrôs kơtơ̆ng thoi noh boih na sư hrŭk ao sư hloi, yua kơ kơplah sư oei traih jal hei sư ưh kơ hrŭk ao. Hrŭk ao đang boih na sư kơtah hloi tơ đak năm tơkan hloi tơ Yêsu. Thŏng-nan ataih kơ jih đak ei dang minh-hrĕng thưk.

English: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fish.
Bahnar: Lu buăl sư oei lăm thŏng-nan na lu sư hiot jal mă ka puh lơ ei tŏk tơ kông.

English: Then, as soon as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư tŏk tơ kông boih, lu sư 'bôh ŭnh ngar păng gơnap ka oei phang kơpal ŭnh ei păng đei 'bĕng mi mơ̆n.

English: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Anhăk tơ âu 'bar pêng hlak ka đêl iĕm rôp.”

English: Simon Peter went up and dragged the net to land, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty-three; and although there were so many, the net was not broken.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs tŏk kơpal thŏng-nan hiot hloi jal ei atŏk kơpal kông. Jal ei ka puh, ling ka tih tih ngăl mah minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt pêng tŏ ka. Ka sư lơ dang noh ngơnh kơ jal sư huay kơ hiah.

English: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” Yet none of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who are You?”—knowing that it was the Lord.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Năm sa tơ âu bĕ.” Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ đei bu pơ̆n jet Sư: “Ih bu?” Yua kơ lu sư băt kơ Sư Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi asong kơ lu sư iŏk hloi; ka asong lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: This is now the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was raised from the dead.
Bahnar: Yêsu tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pêng 'măng kơ âu boih đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch.

English: So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”
Bahnar: Lu sư achăng sa boih na Yêsu jet Simôn Pêtrôs thoi âu: “Ơ Simôn kon Yôhan, ih hăm 'mêm kơ Inh hloh kơ lu buăl ih âu 'mêm kơ Inh?” Pêtrôs drơ̆ng: “Ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt mơ̆n inh 'mêm kơ Ih.” Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Lei ih rong kon triu Inh.”

English: He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”
Bahnar: Yêsu jet Pêtrôs 'măng mă 'bar: “Ơ Simôn, kon Yôhan, ih hăm 'mêm kơ Inh?” Pêtrôs drơ̆ng: “Tơpă, ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt mơ̆n inh 'mêm kơ Ih.” Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Lei ih rong triu Inh.”

English: He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.
Bahnar: Yêsu jet truh pêng 'măng khan: “Ơ Simôn, kon Yôhan, ih hăm 'mêm kơ Inh?” Thoi noh Pêtrôs jing sơ'ngon kơlih kơ Yêsu jet sư pêng 'măng boih, na Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt tôm tơdrong, tơdrong inh 'mêm kơ Ih, Ih băt mơ̆n.” Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Lei ih rong triu Inh.

English: Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ ih tơpă wă kơ ih băt: Hơtai ih oei moh sơ̆ ih gơh hrŭk hơbĕn ao ih năm tơ yơ yơ mơ̆ng kơ ih wă. Mă-lei lăp ih kră ning-mônh ih gô plaih ti ih, na đe nai gô chô̆ ti ih dui ih tơ anih mă ih ưh kơ wă.”

English: This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi noh Sư roi tơdrong Pêtrôs gô lôch lơliơ wă kơ bơ̆n bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ sư gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă. Klaih kơ noh na Yêsu khan: “Bĕ kiơ̆ Inh.”

English: Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs glĕch lăng na 'bôh hloi minh 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ bre sư, bơngai pơhrăm mă Yêsu 'mêm kơeng, bơngai mă sư oei jê̆ Yêsu, jet Yêsu ki, sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, bu wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Ih?” Sư jet noh 'bơ̆t kơplah sŏng sa ki.

English: Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs 'bôh bơngai noh na jet Yêsu: “Ơ Kră Yang, bĭ bơngai âu ning-mônh sư gô thoi yơ?”

English: Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dah Inh wă kơ sư arih sot truh Inh jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh ngê̆ kiơ kơ ih jet? Ih kư̆ lui kơ Inh đĕch.”

English: Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh ră, na lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui đei nơ̆r kơtơ̆ng ang khan: Minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu ei ưh kơ layơ lôch. Mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ đei pơma khan sư ưh kơ đei lôch ôh. Sư khan: “Dah Inh wă kơ sư arih sot truh Inh jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh ngê̆ kiơ kơ ih jet?” Sư pơma thoi noh đĕch.

English: This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.
Bahnar: Dôm nơ̆r pơma âu đơ̆ng bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu ei, bơngai mă Sư 'mêm kơeng. Sư chih roi ăn kơ bơ̆n lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu. Păng bơ̆n kư̆m băt dôm tơdrong sư chih pơma tơpăt ngăl.

English: And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Yêsu pơm oei lơ tơdrong nai ră mơ̆n. Dah bơ̆n chih roi tôm tơdrong Sư pơm, inh tơchĕng teh âu hrăt ưh kơ gơh 'măn sơ̆p hla bơar ră roi tơdrong Sư pơm.
